review.title: Quaint hotel in the heart of Union Square
review.reviewText:
Great location. Close to transportation and shopping.
Room was clean and beds were comfortable. 

Shower was tiny.

Hotel was in a central location, close to transit, restaurants and shopping. Its a fairly old building and some of the rooms are updated better than others. When we first arrived, we were "upgraded" from a queen bed to a very tiny and dingy room with two double beds, which did not benefit us as a couple. It took several conversations before they agreed to move us into the room we actually paid for. The new room was more spacious and updated. Overall, we found the staff to be unfriendly and not overly helpful but the rooms were adequate. Decent hotel if you can get one of the good rooms for the right price. And be aware, the wi-fi connection was very weak which made it challenging to plan the next day's activities

review.title: Nice hotel.  Good location.
review.reviewText: We had a great stay.  One room had a very tiny shower with no tub.  The other room had a nice tub and shower, although water pressure was low.  Our extra blanket and pillow had a bad smell, but they replaced it right away.  Everuthing else was great.   All the staff were plesant and very helpful.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: BF and I took BART into SF for an evening at Biscuits and Blues.  Handlery is perfectly located right across the street from B&B, and next door to Lefty O'Doul's.  Blues Friday night and Bloody Marys Saturday morning!  Easy walking distance from Union Square, Financial District, Farmer's Market at Ferry Building and three BART stops.  Hotel check-in easy and pleasant.  Only downside was we were supposedly 'upgraded' to a better room???  We were by the pool, but in a handicap room.  We didn't really care because we didn't spend much time in the room, but I wonder if we were shuttled off to a less desirable room because I'd gotten a discount via Expedia.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, very clean, nice staff.  Also, much quieter than the two other hotels I've stayed in near Union Square.

review.title: Great location, a little noisy and smelly
review.reviewText:
Overall, I recommend the Handerly. The location was great, room spacious and staff friendly. The adjoining restaurant was very nice and happy hour prices were decent. I used the fitness center and while small, it had adequate equipment.

I did find that the room had an old, musty odor and the bathroom smelled like cigarette smoke. It was also very noisy - it sounded like we were sleeping above a bowling alley and the noise was not coming from outside of the hotel.

review.title: Older hotel wonderfully located but overpriced
review.reviewText: A super outdoor pool, room fine but wheezing air system with little cooling power and somewhat cramped room.  Location was ideal, staff friendly and accommodating. Price was high even for Union Square.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Perfect location , right next to Union Square, and a great bar right next door Lefty O'Douls.
review.locationRemarks: Basically everything is close, Union Square, restaurants, bars, Westfield Mall and the Subway

review.title: Central Location but could do better
review.reviewText:
This is in the centre of Union Square and close to transport, shops, restaurants & bars. The rooms are very nice however even though this is a historic hotel the hallways especially where the bedrooms are situated are very tired and also there is a funny unkempt smell. Staff were very helpful but parking is very expensive. I would use the parking garage round the corner which for overnight is $35 cheaper , 24 hours and secured parking and just literally a 2 minute walk round the corner to the hotel. It is the Hertz rental /car return place and in the same road as Loris diner.
The rooms are modern in terms of beds and TV's but the rest not so much. There are rooms that dont have a view and are larger than those that do. Noise wasn;t an issue as although we have kids they are used to noise and you don't come to San Francisco to go to bed at 8pm. We got an ok rate but I still think this is overpriced compared to others nearby. I liked our stay but probably next time would not stay here or stay on Fishermans Wharf. The staff unlike other reviews I actually found quite helpful and welcoming.
review.positiveRemarks: The location and the beds were very comfortable
review.negativeRemarks: The hallways and smell of it. Need a renovation
review.locationRemarks: Endless shops, chinatown, only a tram ride from pier 39 & Fishermans wharf. Near Cablecars plus lots of restaurants. Also close to some museums

review.title: Great hotel let down by the staff.
review.reviewText: If you're looking for a well located, clean hotel in a great location then I would have recommended the Handlery. However, if you expect any type of customer service from the females working behind the front desk (the male employees there were always helpful, polite and courteous), then think again and take your custom elsewhere to the many other hotels in the area charging the same price and sharing the same great location. We experienced terrible difficulty towards the end of our stay, following a wonderful holiday, trying to arrange a late check out as our flight was not until 9pm. We understand that a late check out can never be guaranteed but we were lied to by the female front desk staff about the situation and offered no alternatives - we challenged their initial claim that the hotel was full after finding all room types advertised online as available, and only then did they admit that actually they were not full but would not give us a late check out (advertised as a service you could pay for in the hotel room guest book) because the cleaners did not stay past 3pm and it would be too inconvenient; only then were we offered shower facilities to use before our flight home instead. I am so disgusted in this unacceptable behaviour from the staff that I could not recommend this hotel to anyone now.

review.title: Nice hotel,in Union Square
review.reviewText: very nice, we were there 2 days and went on a cruise, and came back that must tell something, shame about San Francisco and the fog and chill
review.positiveRemarks: convenient located for our purpose, nice coffee peculator and supplied coffee, lovely bathroom, and the mattress in the king sized bed was firm - good
review.negativeRemarks: NO apart from San Francisco weather  (temperature)
review.locationRemarks: easy to walk every where, lots of shops / restaurants

review.title: Nice hotel close to union square
review.reviewText: Nice foyer and facilities however I do think the corridors and some of the room in the hotel is a little shabby. Excellent service , expensive parking , decor of the room good and quite spacious. Not sure would opt for there again would maybe try another hotel. Great location

review.title: Good hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText: Good hotel in great location, with easy access to transport links , restaurants and shopping. Room was comfortable , clean and in good condition. Staff were all very friendly and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and room we had was of a good standard at a reasonable price. Hotel also has an outdoor pool area. Staff were all very friendly and helpful
review.negativeRemarks: Make sure to ask for quiet room , as there is traffic noise at nights
review.locationRemarks: Good restaurants within walking distance. Port is also only 20 minutes walk away. Good shopping also close to hotel.

review.title: Close to all transport with stops at Union sq
review.reviewText: All positive - upgraded from single to double room at back - nice and quiet. I visited my friends in room on the street and it got a lot of noise drifting up. Ps the power points were a bit loose when I had to recharge my phone . Also I was unsuccessful following instruction to make coffee in room. No milk provided.
Restroom was small and dim. But the place was so great.

review.title: Central position
review.reviewText: Room smaller than expected but comfortable only a few doors down from maceys noisy from the street but usually quiet by 10.30 but great location near shops food and tram

review.title: Adequate.
review.reviewText: Adequate. Nice towels. Parking was expensive & not included.

review.title: Great Location..
review.reviewText: Had a fabulous time in San Fransisco, mainly due to the location and comfort of the hotel, even got in a workout at the gym...it was great.
review.positiveRemarks: The Location, you could easily walk to anything..
review.locationRemarks: My wife loved the shops, the tram was very close by, plenty of restaurants...it's ideal

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: This hotel is within a block to Union Square.  Exactly where you want to be!

review.title: Hotel right in dientown, close to trolley
review.reviewText: Hotel workers were very friendly and helpful.  Room was clean but small with no dresser.

review.title: Small room. Close to union square.
review.reviewText: Staff would not call a cab for my wife to get to china town, they said it was too close so she had to walk. Just not very professional for a $300.00 a night hotel.

review.title: Classic style hotel. Central location
review.reviewText: We have to request change of room after a noisy night from electrical plant. Asked for dining voucher as compensation. This is a very busy tourist hotel with staff under pressure . Otherwise enjoyable stay.
Good location, good food, older hotel with small bathrooms.

review.title: Old hotel in need of renovation
review.reviewText: Like stepping back into the seventies. Room small and ancient fitout. Good location and staff obliging.
review.negativeRemarks: Entire renovation.

review.title: Well....
review.reviewText: Staff was not friendly, they were down to all business.   Had to make appointment to use the sauna and it was on a different floor from the pool.  Hotel layout was confusing and the registration desk mentioned nothing about where any thing was.  The room floors cracked in several areas, it smelled old.
Great location, but rooms very small and stuffy, circulated air did not work well! Room service only offered until 10:00.

review.title: Great location, fantastic staff
review.reviewText: I was a little concerned because of the higher than I was hoping price. However, the location places you right in the heart of SF and the staff was phenomenal. The price tag is worth the experience and location and I would go back to this hotel if I ever come back to the city.

Nice central location close to shopping, downtown and Chinatown. A "heart of the city experience."  Just a quick walk or cable car ride over Nob Hill to Fisherman's Wharf.  Staff was friendly.  Valet service was helpful, albeit a big additional expense.

review.title: Good location, tiny room.
review.reviewText: $300 for a tiny, tiny room with a view of the HVAC equipment. Comfortable enough bed, but incredibly small room.

review.title: Great location in downtown San Fran.
review.reviewText: We arrived via taxi from the airport and initially unsure of the precise location within downtown. The foyer was very busy with two queues waiting to check-in, there seemed to be plenty of staff stood in the foyer also. We eventually got to the front for a quick & efficient check-in. After dropping our bags in the room we headed out and soon realised the hotel is brilliantly located in the heart of downtown. We walked into various stores and bars and spent a great afternoon mooching round. That night we happened upon a great eatery virtually next door to The Handlery, Lefty O'Douls is a big buffet pub, the first we've come across in Canada & the US. The next day we Caught a tram up to Pacific Heights and walked back down Lombard Street. We briefly visited Fishermans Wharf on our way to catch our Alcatraz ferry crossing.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathrooms very small, cramped even.
review.locationRemarks: In the heart of down town, lots of touristy things, shops, cafes and bars to experience.

review.title: Can't beat the location!
review.reviewText: This hotel is right in the center, and walking distance to the mall, with sjopping and restaurants all over. Room is very small with terrible view, but hey, we were barely there ascwe were busy crusing andvsight seein. Staff were extremely friendly and very helpful. We arrived early morning, and plan was to drop off our luggage and come back in the afternoon to check in, but Anthony found as an available room and let us checked in early. Thank you, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay in  San Fran!

review.title: Expensive stay, poor service
review.reviewText: Toilet overflow first night with water in bathroom. No windows to see daylight from room, 2 machines in gym- out of service . Slowest Internet ever. Expensive hotel with poor conditions
review.negativeRemarks: A lot of things...maybe everything ...
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, hop on-off bus station nearby

review.title: Nice hotel conveniently located . . .
review.reviewText:
. . . close to Union Square, Powell/Hyde cable car, and Market Street BART stations.  One of few that has a pool, if that matters.
Parking is pricey, but that's the city.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Check in was easy and the room was small, but clean.  My only issue is the $60 ($52+8 parking tax) charge for parking.Ouch!
It was a good experience. Hotel location is very good

review.title: Close to everything.
review.reviewText: Everyone was very nice and the hotel was clean, comfortable, and close to everything.
review.negativeRemarks: Shower water pressure.
review.locationRemarks: Great location to get anywhere in the city easily.

review.title: I'd recommend...
review.reviewText: Location was great, bed was comfortable, had a pool and the bellmen ( especially Victor) was awesome!!

review.title: Nice historic hotel
review.reviewText: Easy check in, friendly staff, comfortable room, great amenities, great location, lively neighbourhood. Overall great place to stay in the city.

review.title: Nice Hotel close to everything
review.reviewText: Very close to union square and hop on hop off stops.
Great location. Hotel is close to transit stops and lots of restaurants.

review.title: In the heart of Union Square very close to shops a
review.reviewText: In the heart of Union Square very close to shops and restaurants. A very walkable area that felt safe

review.title: It was very close to a lot of good entertainment!
review.reviewText: It was very close to restaurants, bars and stores, as well as close to China town and the Civic Center! It has close parking as well!

Hotel Staff was helpful and overall is good customer service. Most disappointed was 2 factors: 1. Room insolation was very bed, we wasn't able to sleep at night as you can hear how people walking in a walkway 3 am in a morning and #2. No ventilation: we wasn't able to have a fresh air as windows permanently close and system wasn't working properly, it was a quite smelly and air wasn't clean.

review.title: VERY pleasant surprise
review.reviewText:
We stayed in a Premier room on the 7th floor of the hotel. Had heard about Union Square area being very noisy, but our room was very quiet (day and night). Maybe due to double pane glass.
Check-in was quick and we arrived early and they still had a room ready when we arrived 3 hours before check-in.
Hotel is reasonably priced (for SF) and very well located to all the major sights.
Concierge was extremely helpful with both directions and dinner suggestions.
After reading mixed reviews on Expedia and Trip Advisor, we were VERY pleasantly surprised and had an excellent stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything. Premier room was very spacious for a family of 4.
review.negativeRemarks: We had no complaints

review.reviewText: Elevators get a little congested but hey--it was June in SF and the hotel was full. You have to expect some additionsl busyness. Staff was welcoming. Rooms were quiet. Location can't be beat!

The staff and hotel were wonderful.  The only drawbacks were, no spa, no pool towels and I couldn't get the AC to work in the room but didn't really need it because you could open the windows.  I will definitely stay here again!

review.title: Ac not working and no water pressure
review.reviewText: Ac not working and no water pressure After 2 nights went to a nicer hotel a lot bigger and $100 less per night I would not stay here again

review.title: Location, Location, Location!!!!!
review.reviewText:
Perfect location and everything is within walking distance. If you want shopping it's on the blocks all around the hotel. China town is within walking distance and so is market street. Public transportation is a short walk away if you want to go to the pier, or other touristy areas. 

Check in was a breeze, and the hotel staff were very helpful. The room had plenty of space and the beds were comfy. The shower had plenty of hot water but the water pressure wasn't very strong. I'd gladly stay here again the next time we're in San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: Water pressure
review.locationRemarks: Everything is nearby!

review.title: Nice location but old hotel
review.reviewText: Nice location but old hotel. Cramped bathrooms and the hallways have a smell. Pool is smaller than photo.

review.title: Close to everything downtown
review.reviewText: Room was a suite type room which was wonderful for 3 people.  Lots of room to move about and some privacy for TV watching while others slept.
review.positiveRemarks: Excellent service.  Close to everything downtown. 5 minute walk to Union Square. Close to restaurants.  Excellent for us
review.negativeRemarks: The parking was not explained so we had to drive around the block to find it.  The elevator is difficult with 2 separate elevators.

review.title: Great location, close to transport and shops
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed my stay, my bed was a little uncomfortable (2 singles rolled together). The building itself is a little dated, but the rooms and location more than make up for it. If you're looking for somewhere with a central location, close to Walgreens and other services then this place is perfect.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, the room was nice and comfortable
review.negativeRemarks: Housekeeping should be more considerate at 8am by NOT yelling to each other at opposites ends of the hallways. It woke me up most mornings.
review.locationRemarks: Location was great, Union Square is literally 2mins walk. Close to Walgreens, T-Mobile that International Travelers need.

review.title: Bad time to stay in Union Square
review.reviewText: So my boys and I stayed for 4 days. The check in was fast and the staff pleasant enough. I was a little concerned when I was told that our room was in a "quiet" area, by the pool. It was concerning that we could hear the children playing in the pool in the hallway in front pf our room. Well, we get to our room, we find that the view out our window is a brick wall and alley way. During our first day, we heard someone yelling and swearing from the alley way. Finally, the worst part of our "quiet" room was the early morning construction noise going on. I know it's not the hotels' fault that there's construction going on, but it would have been nice to let their guest know prior to booking their accommodations or even upgrading them to an even quieter part of the hotel once they arrive. For as much as they're charging for the room, it would've been the right thing to  If you enjoy shopping and the crowds, this area would be perfect for you. If not, I'd probably look to stay elsewhere. There wasn't much for us to do near the hotel.  The room and staff were pleasant enough.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Older motel but very close to the activities we wanted to do. Friendly staff.

review.title: Quiet room for business stay in SF
review.reviewText:
This is a great hotel.  My one challenge was that there was only working elevator for my 4 day stay.  I didn't mind taking the stairs on occasion but when you have luggage and everyone else also does (check-out day!) there can be quite a wait for an elevator with room.  Once the second elevator is fixed, all will be just perfect!

Lobby is bright and inviting, room is big enough and quiet, bed was comfortable ... all good!
review.negativeRemarks: Fix the elevator!
review.locationRemarks: Close to shopping, transportation, theaters and more.

review.title: Disappointing though excellent location
review.reviewText: The location was great, close walking distance to many attractions and shopping.  Room smelled bad, and couldn't open the window due to the incredible noise from the air-conditioners in the courtyard outside.  I slept with the window open and earplugs in, to at least get fresh air.   Clean room, but otherwise staff generally quite uninterested.  Asked for upgrade to room in newer part of the hotel which was very much better.
review.negativeRemarks: Badly needs refurbishment.  Though some staff were nice, many were uninterested.

review.title: good
review.reviewText: good location, nice staffs. Room is clean, comfortable and quiet.
review.positiveRemarks: Will stay next time. The price has increased double in one week.
review.negativeRemarks: If the two elevators can work, that will be better.
review.locationRemarks: near union square, is easy for everything. For shopping, eating, public transportations and traveling.

review.title: Excellent location for central downtown.
review.reviewText: Hotel layout is weird almost like two buildings smashed together. Room was rediculously small. No way worth $266, no way. I felt taken advantage of. Elevator was broken so it was a bit of a challenge sometimes.
review.negativeRemarks: Fair pricing. Modernize the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Plenty of shopping, dining etc. strong point of hotel. Location location location. Hotel has it.

review.title: VERY NICE HOTEL
review.reviewText:
very quite no noise. room very clean and large
i al very very happy and i comme back

review.title: Nice hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Pleasant convenient hotel.  Staff very friendly and most helpful.  Clean rooms. Greta restaurant attached to hotel.  Location fantastic....close to shopping, trolley, lots of restaurant and Big bus tour stop.
review.negativeRemarks: Both elevators working.  One was out of service but wait times weren't unbearable.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of restaurants, shopping and trolley rides close by.

review.reviewText: Close to union square great price for location staff friendly and hotel was clean

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: Great location, but a very dated & somewhat dingy hotel. I did two (2) upgrades for the room & ended up at the back of the hotel on the 8th floor with a view of other rooms. Will never consider staying at the Handlery again. Many better hotels within a block or two.
review.negativeRemarks: A really good cleaning, updating & remodel of access to rooms & floors. Getting to my room was second rate at best.
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Pity the hotel doesn't live up to the location.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
Hotel is old, rooms are spacious and updated.
The air conditioning they control and room was very warm, they did bring a fan but not appropriate for this type of hotel.
Staff was nice, restaurant was good.
Location is great
review.negativeRemarks:
Only 1 elevator worked
A/c is old and doesn't work well

review.title: Location, location, location!
review.reviewText: Had a nice stay here. Only drawback is that the room was a bit hot and stuffy. Could only set the AC at 68 and it had no fan.
review.negativeRemarks: Better control of the climate in the room.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location!

review.reviewText: Hotel was very clean, the staff was helpful and friendly. I didn't eat in the restaurant. I would definitely stay here again.
Great place, terrible staff! Got robbed by the hotel maids

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Facilities have cancer causing chemicals .  The place is not clean full of dust daily.  See picture of warning from  state of California posted at entrance

Room had more than enough space but small plumbing problems and thermostat was old and uncooperative when trying to adjust the room temperature as it was too cold.  Location was great for me needing to be in the Union Square area.  Never had to take an Uber or cab and was able to walk everywhere as the area was nice.  Hotel  could use a gift shop or something similar as I did have to walk to Walgreens for some simple headache medicine.  These are small things that I noticed but overall was not unhappy with my stay.
it was a short stay, but the overall experience was nice. the hotel is in a good location and really close to the office i was visiting. the rooms are on the small side, but they are clean and tidy.

review.title: Near shopping, very comfortable
review.reviewText: I was there for business and have stayed there before while on vacation. Quick check-in, room clean, great place to eat.

review.title: First time in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
This is a hotel with an old world charm. The staff were lovely and the location was fantastic.
I asked to move from a small room at the back to a bigger room at the front which had a terrific view of the main street below and I could open my window for fresh air and ambience - great. The room was small and bathroom a little tired but the bed was so comfortable. Overall a very pleasant experience
review.positiveRemarks: Location, location, location. Charming staff and charming ambience.
review.negativeRemarks: Much more gluten free options on the in-house menu
review.locationRemarks: Awesome location  - close to shopping, restaurants and transport.

review.title: Too darn hot!
review.reviewText: Air conditioning never got cool enough. One day both elevators weren't operating. Had to take service elevator. One day had to walk up 7 floors. Nice staff and location but elevators and air conditioning g need to be replaced

review.title: Location is great!
review.reviewText: Staff was very friendly and accommodating.  The location was great - right on Union Square, can walk everywhere.  Had a premier queen room it was OK.  Hallways too dark and old feeling.

review.title: the staffs are very nice !
review.reviewText: We forgot our clothes in the closet , the staff kept them and sent to us by mail , which is very appreciated ! Thanks !

review.title: Disappointing for the price
review.reviewText: Hotel outdated, old room, just one elevator working for the whole hotel. Excessively pricey, considering  the poor quality of the facilities.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything
review.locationRemarks: Location is perfect for people attending meetings at Union Square area. Location is the only reason for the crazy price.

review.reviewText: Conveniently located in Union Square with access to tourist attractions. The hotel has two parts, a newer and an older section. We stayed in an older room but it was still nice and clean. Rooms are on the smaller side but bathrooms are ok. I would recommend this hotel as we paid a good price for it through a website and discounts. The parking in the hotel was very expensive but it is due to the fact that parking in San Francisco is just overly scarce and expensive.
Wonderful stay very nice staff. Hotel was in the perfect location.

review.title: Great location; small bathroom
review.reviewText: The Handlery is close to so many SF tourist sites, shopping and some pretty good restaurants.  It's fairly quiet considering it's only 1/2 a block away from Powell where the street car still runs and where plenty of people walk up and down the strip.  It's also 1/2 a block away from Union Square where we were able to pick-up one of the hop on hop off tour buses that took us all over SF.  There's a good restaurant attached to the hotel and the menu and price were fairly reasonable. The beds were very comfortable with high thread count bedding.  The room itself is fairly big and we were able to chill comfortably.  The not-so good things were the small bathroom; especially the shower.  It's positioned in a diagonal and the shower head is facing out so the water was most likely going to leak out on to the bathroom floor until you get in the shower which blocked the water from leaking but boy is it tight in there!  (Beware the shower shelf or else you'll hit your elbow or head on it!)  There was also a device above one of the beds that circulates the air but unfortunately it also generated a lot of dust.  I was wondering how come my phone on the side table was constantly covered in dust in the morning and my allergies acted up indoors when it was so rainy outside.  I was also combing out so much dust from my hair...ewww!  Despite some of these minuses, I will consider staying here again next time I'm in SF.
review.negativeRemarks: Make the shower head face away from the opening so it doesn't leak on the floor.  Replace the noisy and dusty air circulators.
review.locationRemarks: 1/2 a block from Union Square; plenty of shopping, restaurants and access to tour buses.

review.title: Perfect location for getting everywhere
review.reviewText: Very friendly and helpful staff, great room, all a slightly old fashioned charm but clean and comfortable. Location near cable car and all other public transport as well as for seeing city centre on foot, theatres and restaurants was ideal.

review.title: Great location to restaurants and shopping.
review.reviewText:
Comfortable beds, clean. Great view of the city. 
Great restaurants within walking distance.
Good location. Nice staff. And a bit noisy from street traffic.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The hotel was outdated but very clean. The location was great. We were close to everything. The room decor is nice and the hotel was quiet. The rugs had a weird smell and the minibar was empty. The safe was old fashion you would have to walk with your safe key at all times. They should have a minibar just in case you would like to purchase water or drinks at an absurd price but at least you have the option. At least there is a Walgreens 2 blocks away so I guess it all worked out but when you are traveling with kids accessibility is key.

review.title: Great central location
review.reviewText: The hotel has a lot of character, old a newer, the layout is a bit confusing but not impossible.  The people are wonderful, polite, very helpful and fast.  The rate was very competitive and the parking garage was convenient.  Located right on union square so there was a ton to do within walking distance.  I would stay there again. LS
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, China town, waterfront and Fishermans Wharf are all within walking distance (the wharf is about 1.5 miles)

review.title: Disappointing central San Fran hotel
review.reviewText:
This was an expensive two night stay in a very small, average, pokey room with a 'view' of a dirty wall.  The airconditioning system did not seem to register and the tea/coffee facilities only included packet creamer and no real milk; not even in mini pods.

The corridors and lifts looked decidedly tired and the pool was beside a main thoroughfare between the parking area and main lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: Real milk with the tea and coffee;  decoration in lifts and corridors.  Better airconditioning/heaters information
review.locationRemarks: Good location in central San Francisco by Union Square.  Ideal for people who like to shop although only if you prefer high end prices

review.title: Nice hotel in Union Square area
review.reviewText: I actually didn't expect it to look the way it did when I arrived. It's a nice hotel to stay in for a decent price. The only problem I had was that the air fan in the room was not cold enough for me. I did like how everything was walking distance in the Union Square area. I would stay there again in the future. The front desk employees were very kind and helpful. The hotel is kept nice and clean.

review.title: Trip to the Super Bowl
review.reviewText: Dissapointing for the price paid. No extra amentities, no microwave. Had to pay for parking and any extra bottles of water.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, was close to all activities.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking should be included, very expensive stay.
review.locationRemarks: Several restaurants to enjoy and activities

review.reviewText: Clean place, helpful staff, simple small room, the pool and courtyard in middle of building were nice, garage was easy in and out on o'Farrell street.

review.title: Nice Hotel, but bad room service
review.reviewText: Nice Hotel, however worst room service I have ever experienced - not one order was correct & one was so late we couldn't eat because we had to leave on a tour bus. Sneaky that they add the tip of 15% to the bill, then have a separate section for a tip, so as Aussies we didn't realise & ended up over-tipping for constant wrong orders. People were nice however.
review.negativeRemarks: Room Service

review.title: Nice Hotel Conveniently located
review.reviewText: My husband and I stay here as often as we can when we visit San Francisco.  It's right off Union Square so convenient to BART, Muni, shops and restaurants.  It has a decent restaurant attached if we aren't feeling adventurous.  We are frequently upgraded, there's free wifi in the hotel, and the room we were in this time had been updated so it was very nice.  Despite being right off the Square, it is reasonably quiet.  Only one elevator was working this time, so the wait could be a little long, but we just used the stairs.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, conveniently located, very nice staff

review.reviewText: Very comfortable and affordable for being right in Union Square! The location was perfect for us.

review.title: Nice hotel close to union square
review.reviewText: Shower was a bit weak but otherwise no complaint, as the staff was kind and room was clean, close to the major place.

review.title: Location and old fashioned elegance
review.reviewText:
This hotel  is located in the best location! Easy to walk to anywhere and everywhere, close to Powell St cable car line and shopping all around. I loved the old fashioned elegance of this hotel, but for those that prefer everything to be 'new' and 'perfect', this might not be for you. It is a historic building and with that comes some compromise, but I will certainly be staying here again. The customer service from all I encountered was just brilliant.
I stayed in an historic 2 bed room on the Geary St side of the property, so probably the noisiest part of the hotel. I LOVED it. From the fire escape outside my window to the noises of life below, I simply loved this property and time in San Francisco. I am a light sleeper an the ear plugs provided by the hotel were enough to give me 3 nights of sound sleep. However, I can understand if the noise from below may be too much for some. I would recommend asking for a room away from the Geary St noise if you feel this would be an issue for you.
The restaurant at the hotel, being the Daily Grill was absolutely excellent. Beautifully decorated and great food and wine options. Ate there 3 times in 3 days and not one time did it disappoint. I will definitely be back to stay again.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything. Perfect little place of history in a bustling and vibrant city.
review.negativeRemarks: For the price and facilities available, I think it is right on point.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location, Chinatown is a short 5 minute walk away across Union Square, cable car access within 200 metres of front door of hotel. Perfect!

review.title: Close to shops
review.reviewText: This is a nice hotel to stay in even though we were just here for a night... The only downside was that the room became hot as you stay in it longer...cannot even adjust the temperature by yourself.  I would still stay in this hotel in spite of that because it is near shops, very walkable, near restaurants.
review.negativeRemarks: The temperature inside the room should be improved.

review.reviewText: Great 1 night stay. This is a historic building, which can give that scary movie feeling, but the cleanliness and upkeeping makes you feel at ease. Staff was very professional and polite at all times. Lobby decor is beautiful.
The room was spacious and the bed was comfortable.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We stayed overnight for our anniversary and decided to leave the car home. We rode BART to the Powell station and it was a quick and easy walk. Our room had a great balcony that was nice to relax on after dinner and drinks near by.

review.title: one of the most comfortable and convenient hotels
review.reviewText: comfortable, convenient and a great value in Union Square

review.title: Hotel was right in Union Square.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. The only thing I didn't like was the parking situation. A high price per night so I parked across the street for a more economic price.

review.title: Causy, cheap, and well situated
review.reviewText: Great hotel overall. Walking distance to most shops. Nice staff. The room had two queen beds and a great street view. The concierge (John Wood) is a lovely man who has been doing this for 20+ years. He will give you advice about places to visit in the city.

review.title: Prime location for shopping
review.reviewText:
We go here every year for a weekend of Christmas shopping.  This year we stayed in the newer towers. About the same as the historic rooms. The staff did a great job keeping out rooms close which hasn't always been easy in years past. 

The only things to improve are the beds as they are too hard and the lift for handicapped by the pool. To get to the lobby from the garage you either have to carry your luggage up and down stairs or use the lift that doesn't feel very safe.

review.title: Great Experience
review.reviewText: This is the first time we have stayed at the Handlery Union Square...we usually stay at another more expensive hotel on Union Square, but thought we'd give this one a try.  I would stay here again over any other hotel we have stayed at in SF.  The quality of the service, the amenities, the location were all way above standard!  We were able to check in early (unusual because we had 3 rooms), the restaurant is very good, and the concierge was extremely helpful!  The restaurant next door Lefty O'Douls has a piano bar on Thursday, Friday, and Saturday nights, and that is definitely a must-do! (And best of all, it's only a few steps back to the hotel.

review.title: Hotel near Union square
review.reviewText: We paid for a standard room w/queen bed. The picture shown in the Handlery's gallery is not the room we received.  The picture indicates a larger room well lit with natural light. I'm sure it exists somewhere in that hotel but we didn't see it.  We stayed on the 4th floor... there was no view of the city scape or even the sky as the pictures suggest.  Just the façade of a building next to it. The room was the smallest we ever visited, but the bed was comfortable and the room clean.  If you want a view of the activity on the adjacent street or the nice view of the pool area be sure to check with the desk for an upgrade. The pool area was beautiful and excellently cared for.  The staff was great.  They have two elevators... one was not working which meant the other was overused and predictably there was a wait line during heavy traffic times such as check-in and check-out. We missed 3 elevators because of crowding. This was during  12/4 and 5.  The lobby is nice, Union square and expensive shopping close by.  A short walk to Starbuck's - nice.  The room was pricey... but then, don't you expect to be given short shift ... it's San Francisco after all.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevators?

review.title: Great hotel for the price
review.reviewText: I recently spent the night in SF and decided to stay at Handerly as it was recommended to me years ago. I paid $150 for the night, which wasn't bad at all. The staff was very accommodating, carried our luggage up to my room, was helpful with check-in, etc. but the hotel was a bit old and run down. If you're not going to be spending much time in your room, its great. It's clean and the bed was comfortable. My next trip I would probably choose another hotel in Union Square.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was very pleasant, price was great.
review.negativeRemarks: Updates throughout.
review.locationRemarks: 1 block from Union Square, close to tons of shopping and restaurants.

review.title: Location location location
review.reviewText: This is my second stay in the Handlery and I find it ticks lots of boxes, ie close to the shops, easy walking to some sights and righ in the heart of places to eat and drink.
review.positiveRemarks: Right downtown, has a pool which is good when weather permitting, beds comfortable and a good size TV in the room.
review.negativeRemarks: The air con is very noisy, the hotel would get a 5* from me if the air con units were silent or at least a lot quieter.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, cable car, walk to Chinatown.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Great location, right on Union Square.  All was great except the fire alarm at 2:30 am.  Would have liked some information from the staff with a credit of some kind for having to evacuate the building.

review.title: Handlery Union Square the ultimate location!
review.reviewText: A fantastcic location and hotel all round. The only heated outdoor hotel pool in San Fran makes for an awesome morning swim even in winter! This hotel has superb  facilities, great food and friendly staff. The rooms are spacious and comfortable many have balconies that look out onto the street action or inwards to the pool facilities. A fantastic location this is definately the place to be in San Fran down town!

review.title: Hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Not happy that they charge to park car for the whole stay along with the room which I thought could of been cleaner and better.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to everything we wanted to do
review.negativeRemarks: add the car parking into the room charge

review.title: Great location, yet a quiet stay
review.reviewText: This hotel is close to all the action in union square.   We were able to comfortably walk to Moscone center, China town and do a lot of nearby shopping.   The cable car also runs right around the corner from the hotel.  The hotel was comfortable, clean and quiet.  We couldn't ask for more after long days of sightseeing. I enjoyed that we didn't have to go outside to have dinner since the daily grill is right next door and connected through a hallway.  Great overall experience.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: It's a little tired and run down, but it's a place to ready your head and has everything you need.  You can go out all day, come back to refresh and head back out with everything on your doorstep.

review.title: Good value at Union Square
review.reviewText: This hotel was much cheaper than others in the same great location.  The room was fine.  Comfortable bed...everything you need.

review.title: Historic hotel on Hollywood Boulevard
review.reviewText: Old Hollywood hotel which has been re vamped with modern touches.  Great position on Hollywood boulevard
review.positiveRemarks: The Fab pool area, the bars and great service by all the staff. The modern rooms and position on Hollywood boulevard.
review.negativeRemarks: It seemed dark in the lobby and mixology bar. The lobby, also seems abit soulless, it's so big. Also turn the air con down abit!
review.locationRemarks: Great position for Hollywood boulevard. Walk of fame, Chinese theatre where we we very lucky to see Angelina and Brad do their premiere.

review.title: good location- dated hotel - no view
review.reviewText: first room had one queen bed - paid for an upgrade. Hotel feels old - I know it is an old building but it looks tired internally
review.negativeRemarks: needs an upgrade
review.locationRemarks: Union square

review.title: Close to all we wanted to see
review.reviewText: We wanted a clean hotel in a safe area close to transport and shopping - couldn't have been better.

review.title: Nice classic hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: The location is great, right by Union Square. Can be a little loud, due to street noise, but that's the trade off. The rooms are older, but clean and kept up.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise
review.locationRemarks: Union Square and all of San Fransisco.

review.reviewText: The bed was way too soft. We had sore backs in the morning 😕

review.title: great hotel restaurant
review.reviewText: great location right off Union Square, with heated hidden courtyard pool, and great restaurant
They made our visit enjoyable. Had some trouble with air conditioning and they offered a room change. Would stay there again.

review.title: Pleasant and Affordable
review.reviewText: While this hotel is a bit chopped up - old and new sections as well as the parking it was a pleasant stay.  Found our way around a bit easier after first day and the trick to getting to each section.
review.positiveRemarks: We loved the balcony looking out over the pool - booked on expedia and asked for this but didn't get my hopes, daughter loved the comfortable bed.
review.negativeRemarks: The cleanliness of area around the vending machines, little paint touch ups in the rooms, replacing tv remote batteries before they completely fail.
review.locationRemarks: All the shopping you could hope for, eateries you could need and the hills to work it off.

review.reviewText: Great location.  Right in the heart of everything.  Great front desk staff who were more than willing to point you in the right direction for good food and fun.  The old historic feel to the hotel was quite nice.  A real nice change of pace from the "modern" hotels all over the place these days.  Price was well worth the location.  Would absolutely stay there again.

review.title: small space no air conditioning
review.reviewText: This hotel is great if u just want a place to sleep. The hotel is very old and room and bathroom super small. They do have air conditioning but I couldn't tell the room was so hot and stuffy. I couldn't open the windows for fear a rat might come in because they had no screens. It's across from the Westin so you are right smack in Union Square this the high price for such a small space. The staff at check in wasn't very friendly but the guy that helped us with our luggage was super friendly and helpful!

review.title: Not the beautiful, historic experience yok want.
review.reviewText: The hotel staff is awful! Your queen bed is a twin. The rooms are cute and the hotel is pretty, but it's not worth it. I looked at the Yelp reviews on the hotel where everyone complains about the horrible staff. The president personally thanks everyone for their review and says he will speak to the staff, but months later they are still rude. I was told upon check in that I had a king bed. I called and nothing was to be done. The manager sounded like an 18 year old with zero authority or management skills. I was running a half marathon that morning and was told it would cost me 30 dollars to have a 30 minute late check out. If you're looking for convenience, look elsewhere. Also, I felt like we were looked down on for booking with Expedia.

review.title: Good proximity to almost everything
review.reviewText: I have been staying at the Handlery Hotel for many years.  The service is always efficient and friendly.  The location of the hotel can't be beat.  The amenities are very adequate.  Rooms are well appointed.  I have always enjoyed my stay with them.  Sadly, this time the rooms appeared clean but just felt and smelled stale and grimy.   My husband, who seldom notices these things, commented on it as soon as we arrived in our room. It can be difficult to keep things feeling and smelling fresh in cities close to the ocean but this hotel has accomplished it in the past.   Hopefully they were just getting ready to do a huge fall cleaning!
review.positiveRemarks: parking is great.  staff is great, helpful.  proximity to union square.  good price for value
review.negativeRemarks: need to make rooms feel fresher and cleaner.
review.locationRemarks: Right next to Union Square and great shopping.  Taxi's readily available for all other points.

review.title: Nice hotel in EXCELLENT location
review.reviewText: King size bed with a sofa & chair and there was still room to move around. staff were extremely helpful when we need our room clean at a later time. The hotel resturant was outstanding. We will stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Our room was a great surprise, it had a balcony overlooking the outdoor heated pool, complementary bottle water. Extremely clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevators need to be updated/refurbished.
review.locationRemarks: Great resturants across the street, Shopping galore &'close to the "Powell Street cable car"

review.title: overall is good, you get what you paid for
review.reviewText:
a little bit smell
a little old
room is a little small
very close to Macy's and got discount with your hotel card
Not what we expected. Not up to date at all. Check in staff was not very accommodating. Wouldn't stay here again.

review.title: All in all ok, a little bit run down
review.reviewText:
Booking via Expedia.co.uk perfect.
The staff was friendly and helpful.
The building itself needs some modernization compared to european standards. Everything was a little bit run down.
The rooom was tidy and clean, but smelled as they use an unpleasant room scent.
All in all it's ok and I would book it again for a short stay since it is in the city center.

review.title: The hotel is right near Union Square.
review.reviewText: Hotel is a great place and right near Union Square for good food and lots of great restaurant. The room was comfortable. Only bad part, ordered a glass of wine from room service after there was no place at the bar, and it ended up costing $20.
review.negativeRemarks: Room service cost for a single glass of wine.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square was close and convenient.

photos.caption: We had a standard double room

review.title: Nice hotel - great location
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay here. We stayed in the city for 1 week. The hotel room was very nice and clean. We had a mini frig in the room which was a big help. Staff was very helpful. The location perfect- safe and central to everything and very easy to get around by public transportation.  They say the pool is heated but the water seemed pretty chilly to me, other than that it's a very nice pool with nice courtyard. Definitely would recommend and would stay here again.

review.title: Great hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Helpful staff, great location, close to shopping & tours & transport.
review.locationRemarks: Great location in Union Square, near transport & shopping -easy to get to all attractions.

review.title: Good location but not great Concierge service
review.reviewText:
Good location in Union Square. Rooms were clean, spacious and quiet due to windows being double glazed.
Concierge desk not always occupied. Staff did not really go out of their way to help you. Bell men were more helpful.

Now we know a bit more about the area I would probably stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Need more than 1 Concierge

review.title: Perfect Location in Union Square
review.reviewText: The hotel is situated in the heart of Union Square!!  It is a perfect location!  We were there to celebrate the 50th birthday of a friend that travelled with us.  The hotel had a bottle of champagne in their room for her birthday, for her and her husband to enjoy, along with a Happy Birthday note and phone message from the hotel!!  In addition, when my wife and I met them in the lobby the morning of her birthday, the front desk staff greeted her with a "Happy Birthday!".  It was very impressive!!  They made it very personal for her, and therefore for us as well.  Regarding the hotel itself, the rooms are very clean and comfortable, the staff is friendly and attentive, and the pool and other amenities were clean and well taken care of.  We will definitely return to the Handlery on our next visit to San Francisco!!
review.positiveRemarks: The personal greetings and treatment that our cousin received for her 50th birthday.  It was awesome!!
review.negativeRemarks: Everything was very professional and comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: In the heart of Union Square!!  Walking distance to many stores and restaurants, as well as to where the various tours pick you up!!

review.title:
goo
GREAT LOCATION
review.reviewText: great location good room ,762 overlooking pool , bus tours good, but try trams and public transport, get bus map from tourist info, did great tour to Montery and aquarium,  walk around the habour V relaxing try maritime expo around park/ pier area (free). Down side- V expensive after you add all the taxes and of course you must tip 15-20%
review.negativeRemarks: nothing  but like most of the hotels not cheap
review.locationRemarks: close to union square where all the tour buses ,start, if you are planning Alcatraz book in advance thought Montery was better than going to a prison

review.reviewText: Great location, Union Square,cable cars, shopping and good food

review.title: Very comfortable in great location
review.reviewText: Ver comfortable and convenient for shopping, restaurants, theatre and 20 minute walk to AT&T park.
review.negativeRemarks: Priced too high for small room
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, theatre, restaurants, AT&T park is an easy walk or ine pensive cab ride away

review.reviewText: The Handlery is a great hotel in a great location in Union Square.   If your looking for a quality experience in a great location check this page out!

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: We were in a non smoking room but the room smelled liked cigarettes.  Must have shared ventilation with smoking room.  We only used the room for sleeping and did not spend much time in it
review.negativeRemarks: clean up your ventilation system

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Walking distance to major brand shops including Westfield, an abundance of restaurants to choose from and close to transport.
review.negativeRemarks: Air conditioning - it was hot in the room and you couldn't adjust air con. cost of parking maybe have a reduced rate for hotel guests
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, tram,trolleys,restaurants, taxi to Chinatown and wharf, piers

review.title: Friendly hotel in great location
review.reviewText: This hotel is perfectly located and the staff are extremely friendly and helpful. My original room had a rather noisy air con vent outside  and I am a light sleeper! I mentioned it to the desk staff the following day and they immediately offered to change my room. I would definitely recommend this lovely hotel.

review.title: Great Stay with Better Location!
review.reviewText:
Great place to stay to visit San Francisco! Super easy to get to from the airport and a good walking distance to all the main tourist highlights! If walking isn't your thing, no problem, the sight seeing options are right on the kitty corner as well!
Tons of great places to eat within 5 minutes as well!
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel was very clean and staff were very helpful with anything you need. Price is a little less than other SF hotels which is a nice bonus!
review.negativeRemarks: Sauna is a little hard to find and no signs to help you, but staff give great directions
review.locationRemarks: Right in the heart of whatever you want to see and do!

review.title: The hotel is in the center...convenient....
review.reviewText: They clean my room even though i dont request for it...towels are change and my room was very clean...I like that so much

review.title: Good hotel centrally located for walking & transpo
review.reviewText: Good hotel experience except for uncomfortable mattress.  Easy access to BART and cable cars.  Paid parking in hotel and nearby.

review.title: Very central location.
review.reviewText: On arrival I was allocated a very disappointing room - very small, no chair, no view (looking onto a wall), reeked of stale cigarettes and very tired.  The staff were very helpful in changing it - but why do hotels still insist on putting single travellers in their worst rooms? Sadly still all too common. The rest of the hotel was OK but very tired generally and ancient aircon.  Very strangely there were no curtains throughout and the blinds were inefficient in keeping out light at night.
review.negativeRemarks: Lots! See overall review.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square and Market Street very near.

review.title: Good location but not many other positives.
review.reviewText: The cleaning staff were very nice but the front desk staff were not friendly and we were told they don't serve breakfast. Found out day 3 that they do have breakfast. The room and hallways were quite warm and he air conditioning made strange sounds. There was a lot of noise from the street. Pool was cold and there were no towels available by the pool.

review.title: Great location, 2 minute walk to Union Square
review.reviewText: Very comfortable and well appointed room. Staff are very friendly and helpful. The Daily Grill restaurant is great for breakfast - did not try it for dinner.
review.positiveRemarks: We had ground floor room with patio doors to the pool which was great. The only issue with this location as the noise of the hotel air conditioning .
review.negativeRemarks: Reduce noise of air conditioning.
review.locationRemarks: In the heart of San Fran, so everything is on the door step

review.title: Nice hotel for a work trip
review.reviewText: The staff was friendly I was placed in the premier area telling me that it was the newest part but it was very dilapitated not one of my better stays although it was clean  it would probably be great for business trip I was on vacation and wanted a little more pampering

review.title: Okay hotel
review.reviewText:
I stayed at the Handlery Union Square hotel during VMWORLD-2015.  It was a decent hotel, with close proximity to the Moscone Center.

I was in the "historic" hotel, and the room was a shoe box.  It did have a queen sized bed, a desk and a TV stand with a refrigerator inside.  The bathroom was tiny.  The shower was maybe 4'6" in length and my shoulders were either touching the wall or the curtain.

Additionally, I had a need to print a confirmation email, from my shuttle van provider.  As the email was sent to my work address and could only be accessed through a VPN connection, I could not print to their printer.  The only way to print was to use their $20/hr ($5 minimum) computers, that could not access my email anyway.  I finally just walked to FedEx, where they helped me for free.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff could be a little more helpful with business users, and allow printing from other than their rental computers.
review.locationRemarks: Moscone Center

review.title: Clean hotel, but noisy
review.reviewText: The hotel was centrally located near Union Square and there was plenty of shopping, restaurants, bars, etc nearby and within walking distance.  My husband and I stayed here 2 nights while in San Francisco.  It was clean and comfortable but nothing fancy.   I felt it was overpriced, and the parking fee was terrible at $52 per night.  When we checked in, we were told that our room was accessed from the garage entry on the backside of the same block.  It wasn't a major inconvenience although I did think it was peculiar that it wasn't connected and there was no way for us to get to it without walking around the block.  We had the first room near the elevators and could hear people talking loudly outside our door while waiting for or getting off the elevator.  It wasn't enough of an issue to request a different room, but it was a small annoyance.  The plumbing was also strangely loud - we would hear loud noises from our own toilet each time someone else (above us, or through the wall?) flushed.  So I kept the bathroom door shut so it wouldn't bother us.  The second morning of our stay we were woken up by construction workers jackhammering the street right outside.  I know this one is not the hotel's fault, however when added to the other things mentioned, it did contribute to our conclusion that we think we will look for a different hotel next time we visit San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise levels.

review.title: bathroom very small can't even turn around
review.reviewText:
charge for use computers to print airplane passes
no coffee only water not even all day
Lobby very old furniture not pleasant
review.negativeRemarks:
free coffee 
free use of computers  
updated furniture/dressers in rooms
Handicap 
better equipment in work out area
review.locationRemarks: food in area very tourist high prices for quality offered

review.title: Close to Transit
review.reviewText:
Our room was small but clean and comfortable. After the first night in a room facing Geary St. we requested a quieter room and Tony helped us there and then, "Here's the key to another room, it doesn't face the street, go take a look." So refreshing.
The rooms were clean and housekeeping was good. 
When we asked John, the concierge, for help with the transit system he gave us good directions and a printed timetable, and when we hit a snag with transfer vouchers for the journey home, he printed them for us.
I would recommend this hotel. It's a little older than most and could use new windows to remedy the street noise, but the good service tipped the scale.

review.title: Baseball Getaway!!
review.reviewText: We were a group of three (two sons and dad) going to San Francisco for a couple of Giants games. The hotel staff remembered Dad from previous stays and greeted him warmly, such a nice gesture. We can't say enough nice things about this hotel and its excellent staff and location.
review.positiveRemarks: Wonderful, helpful staff and convenient location.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing!
review.locationRemarks: Baseball, shopping and great restaurants all close by!

review.title: Great location staff need a smile.
review.reviewText:
Firstly the hotel is in great location. Rooms clean and comfortable ,I had a balcony . Food at daily grill was good ,housekeeping great.
I stayed for four days , as I've stayed in San Fran before I knew what I wanted so I did it. Not once in four days walking in and out of reception was I even spoken to. Even though I didn't need help a smile good morning or good afternoon would of gone down well. Daily grill was same ,good food but not a conversation or smile at the bar. 
I'd stay at hotel again for convenience and room comfort. There's better places for service though , I hope this is constructive as its meant to be.
Having said that housekeeping always smiled and said good morning they also cleaned well.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean well sized room with balcony.
review.negativeRemarks: Service.
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic location.

review.title: Great location.  Convenient to union square option
review.reviewText: Staff is excellent.  Restaurant next door is very nice.  Brought pizza back to hotel and ate next to pool area at hotel.  Expensive but not as high priced as other hotels in immediate area for the quality, friendly, cleanliness it provides.

review.title: Nice, quiet - close to bars, restaurants and shops
review.reviewText: Stayed with our two teenagers - great location off union square. Recommended

review.title: Not what I expected at all.
review.reviewText: I had higher expectations, I know my fault. The hotel was close to the cable cars and buses and lots and lots of restaurants but our hallway looked like it had never been vacuumed. All along the edges you could see the dust build up, I am sorry for these prices that should not be. Our room was overall clean but again they must not dust! Maybe because I have allergies but the bathroom fixtures were covered. Our ceiling in the dressing area was leaking again not what I was expecting.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient location to shopping, cable cars and restaurants.
review.negativeRemarks: Dust and vacuum.
review.locationRemarks: The cable cars were awesome but be prepared..we were harassed by drug addicts for money that would not take no for an answer.

review.title: Nice hotel. The staff was very friendly & helpful
review.reviewText: Great location. But if you don't like the busy scene it may not be the best option. However it is at the center of everything. Which only put us at a 10-15 min drive to all the major tourist spots. And the staff was so friendly and helpful. I would stay at this location again.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Nice room Very helpful staff Close to restaurants, shop, and activity

review.title: Great location in downtown SF
review.reviewText: Very good location for everything. Close to shops and restaurants and a nice ride on the street car to get down to the piers.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, obliging staff, old hotel but well maintained.
review.locationRemarks: Close to shopping, easy access to piers, tours and other attractions.

review.title: Good Location right next to union Square
review.reviewText: Very helpful members of staff and a nice place to relax
review.locationRemarks: Close to shopping and close to public Transport

review.title: Nice location, but Stinky Rooms
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is perfect. Very close to Union Square. The room was clean, but there was a terrible smell in the room, and also room was cold and max temperature on heater was 72.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel looks very old. I think they need to renew it.

review.title: Stay away
review.reviewText: Tiny & very hot rooms, unfriendly staff, surprise fees, pointless gym, & the cleaning people were knocking at my door at 8am every morning

review.title: Good, centrally located hotel
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at the hotel very much, especially as it was comfortable and in such a good location.  We didn't use any of the facilities except one of my daughters swam in the pool which was right by our room.  We took the opportunity to get out each day to explore San Francisco.  We had no problem with people begging outside.  Our stay was without any hassle or problem.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was the best thing for us
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing I can think of
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is 10 minutes walk from Powell Street station so very near for using BART and the cable car.  Walking distance from Chinatown etc

review.reviewText: This classic under the radar SF spot has great character and perfect location (if you don't mind the constant construction around Union Square). The pool is a hidden gem if you're bringing the kids.

review.title: good location but hotel configured weird
review.reviewText: Difficult to get to lobby from parking with luggage. Room temperature kept rising and was hot during nights. Very very small bathroom.  Room was clean and nice otherwise. Staff friendly. Parking attendants quick with car retrieval.

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: Good location, staff ok, but room so small , and view to the dirty grey wall. Can have better for this price.
review.locationRemarks: close to public transportation, perfect shopping, cable car station. Location perfect.

review.title: Great hotel great location
review.reviewText: We were lucky enough to have a balcony awesome. Carrying luggage up stairs to the new building was irritating.

review.title: Nice reasonable cost city hotel
review.reviewText: Great spot, good location, good staff.....small quaint hotel small rooms small bathrooms

review.title: Very quaint hotel close to all downtown attraction
review.reviewText: Good, staff nice, room ready early.  Close to lots of places to eat, shopping at many stores in Union Square.  Close to trolley runs.
review.positiveRemarks: Old hotel updated with glass doorknobs, old fashioned safe.
review.negativeRemarks: upgrade carpet.
review.locationRemarks: Right by Union Square and trolley runs.

review.title: Nice and good location.
review.reviewText: Decent place we were in the newer part of the hotel so the room was more updated. Lobby is nothing special but our room was ok. Pool is a plus. Good location. Bed was a little firm for my liking.

photos.caption: The sink could be longer and have more storage space
Had to store cosmetics on floor! Need more hooks and shelves (or drawers) to put itrms

review.title: Last minute find!
review.reviewText: I found this hotel in a frantic search for a room near Union Square and it was wonderful.     My room was tiny but very clean, quiet and comfortable. The staff was very accommodating.  I'll stay here again!

review.title: Good hotel with great location!!
review.reviewText: All staff were great!!  The room was good in a great location.  Would definitely stay there again!!
review.positiveRemarks: Good Hotel with a great location!
review.negativeRemarks: More information should be given on website about transportation to and from airport.   ran into difficulties and hotel staff were unable to help.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square.  The centre of San Francisco!!

review.title: Don't expect much
review.reviewText: Hotel staff is unfriendly and not helpful.  Room was old and worn . Fitness center was small with broken equipment.  Elevator was "under construction" our entire 4 day stay so it was inconvenient.
review.positiveRemarks: good location - in middle of most places
review.negativeRemarks: Friendly staff, smile please
review.locationRemarks: So much in Union Square

review.title: Hotel was old and room small.
review.reviewText:
The Bell man was the rudest I've ever encountered. Not a great start 
The room was tucked away around the back with a view of air on pipes and a wall!
Room was old smelt musky but did have the two beds as promised   Storage space so limited we were tripping over bags constantly. 
Must be better value hotels in San Fransico 
Only positive was its great location.

review.title: Nice hotel close to every tourist attraction
review.reviewText: Great hotel and I enjoyed my stay.  There were problems in the dining area, they were very slow to wait or assist me.  The last day there were elevator problems and I was located on the 4th floor and had to take the stairs up and down.
review.positiveRemarks: It was close to every tourist attraction in the city of San Francisco. It was centrally located.  The overall service was great.
review.negativeRemarks: The staff could be a lot more friendly and cater to the needs of the guest.
review.locationRemarks: The location was very convienent to all tourist attractions and places to eat and shop.

review.title: In the heart of San Francisco: surprisingly good!
review.reviewText:
I wanted a reasonably priced hotel in the heart of SanF for 2 nights, after a long transatlantic flight and before transferring to student accommodation.
Despite the location, which is very busy and dirty.  The hotel was a pleasant surprise.  The entry lobby was clean, check-in was not complicated and staff were friendly.
Wifi was reliable.
My room was small, but had all what I needed in perfect working order.  More importantly, it was clean.  The bed was super comfortable! However, there was no view and my room was right next to the stairs, so there was occasional foot traffic.  These shortcomings didn't bother me because my intention was only to retire to the room.

Needless to say, I was very impressed for the price and cried when I moved into my grotty student digs!!
review.negativeRemarks: Complementary light food in the morning and in the room.
review.locationRemarks: This Hotel is by Union Square, so closest to all the great shops and restaurants.  It's a fair walk to the financial district and waterfront.

review.title: Good Union square location near cable car station
review.reviewText:
Good central location for first time San fran tourists. Nice pool in the courtyard.
We had one somewhat reasonable rate for one day then the rate went up substantially the following day, due to a "convention in town" even though they were not sold out.

review.title: I stayed there because I participated in marathon
review.reviewText: The staff was incredible but the plumbing in my bathroom was ancient & needed work. They asked u to conserve but it took nearly four mins for the water to heat in my shower & the tub drain was very slow to drain.

review.title: Excellent location for shopping
review.reviewText:
This hotel is just off Union Square and ideal for all shops, Macy's just one block away. 
The Grill Restaurant serves excellent food but does get very busy so book to avoid waiting 30-40 mins for a table. 
The rooms are very noisy, doors banging all night, maybe we were unfortunate.

review.title: excellent location
review.reviewText: Hotel is perfectly adequate if a little dated. One of the 2 lifts was out of order for all 4 days we stayed and the other broke down on 2 occasions (once trapping people for some time).
review.negativeRemarks: Update rooms
review.locationRemarks: Lots of shops nearby. Short taxi ride to all the main attractions

review.title: Wonderful Hotel
review.reviewText: I had a wonderful stay at the Handlery. It is a beautiful, classic, hotel right on Union Square with easy access to shopping, restaurants, art museums, and sights around town via the cable cars, trolleys, and short walks. If you love beautiful, classic, architecture, then this is the place for you to stay. The staff at the hotel was friendly, jolly, and helpful. I would love to stay here again!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing!
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, restaurants, art galleries, tourist sights

review.title: Nice hotel at Union Square.
review.reviewText: Good hotel with excellent central location. Nice, clean and has a outdoor pool.
review.locationRemarks: Located at Union Square, very conveniently close to everything.

review.reviewText: Great location close to all of the action in downtown San Francisco. The staff was quite friendly & helpful. The room itself, however was very small, old/outdated with meager ammenities. The bed was uncomfortable & small; the bathroom was tiny. All in all, you are paying for the location, not the room. It probably would have been more tolerable if I was traveling alone. I would not stay here again voluntarily or recommend this hotel

review.title: Good location for "hop on hop off" tours
review.reviewText: Got an early check in & a late check out, as well as having the hotel look after our luggage until 6:00pm on the day we left. The staff were courteous & did there job without fuss.
review.positiveRemarks: The main thing was it's location.
review.locationRemarks: Located near Union Square it has easy access to bus tours & cable car. If you have cash to splash, high end shops are close.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: Hotel was fine,older and well maintained.Staff was helpful and you could not be in a better location.

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText:
Rooms comfy. Good air-con. Great facilities.
Staff very nice, most were able to answer all our questions with knowledge.
Gave us early check-in without charge as the room was ready.
review.locationRemarks: Great places to eat within 3 minute walk.

review.title: They could have done better
review.reviewText:
The staff was, shall we say, disengaged. Not everyone but the majority didn't seem like they were to interested in us.  Twice I tried to ask the concierge questions. The first time he was on the phone, and simply ignored me. The next time I said "excuse me I have a quick question". His response was "I will be happy to help, just wait a moment and I will be right back" then he walked away. I waited for more than a moment, but he was in the wind.
On one occasion my wife and i had to take the stairs because the elevators were malfunctioning. We are not in bad shape but from the basement to the seventh floor isn't enjoyable (I never liked the stair-master either). Fortunately that only happened once. You would think that was worth at least a complimentary breakfast or a credit towards parking  
All in all I expected better service for a room that was quite expensive. Too bad because the room was nice and the location was great. I don't think that I will give them another try.... and I would not recommend you do either....
review.negativeRemarks: The staff could read "how to make friends and influence people" It couldn't hurt.
review.locationRemarks: Tons of things to do, its SF...Walk any direction until you cannot walk anymore, its a great city.

review.reviewText:
Handy to shopping , sightseeing , everything .
I loved American traditional style .

review.title: Great location in the city
review.reviewText: The hotel was centrally located which made it easy to walk through the city and hop on and off different forms of transportation. The staff was very helpful with directions and recommendations. The hotel is older so it's not the fanciest but overall a good experience.

review.title: A place to stay in San Francisco city
review.reviewText:
An expensive old hotel with small rooms. 

On arrival one of the staff "stole" our bags off us as we walked to reception to check in. He was rude and pushy, we didn't need help with our bags. He then expected a tip for taking them to our room.  Not a very good first impression for us of San Francisco.

At least the room was clean and tidy and everything worked.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square and the cable cars, street cars, BART etc.

review.title: Close to Union Square
review.reviewText:
Good location with up-to-date furnished lobby. Rooms are cleaned fairly well, but carpets need cleaning in rooms. Double rooms are rather small and do not have a lot of room for two to move around at the same time. Moreover, walls are thin and need acoustic work to eliminate room-to-adjacent room noise leaks. 
Bathrooms lack counter space for toiletries for two. One shelf below the mirror is not enough space for ladies, even with one person in the room alone. We had to use the toilet lid to provide enough space to put our toilet cases while in the bathroom. 
Staff is amazing! If you want to see top notch customer service in action, observe the staff at this hotel. Plus, you get free wi-fi.
review.negativeRemarks: Sound-proof rooms; update hallways and room walls and trim to look as up-to-date as the lobby. It's a bit of a let down once stepping off the elevator
review.locationRemarks: It's a few steps from Union Square and central to everything - food, shopping, taxis, art galleries.

review.reviewText: Good localization. We were very well received, the staff is kind and helpful.

review.title: Next to Union Square opposite Westin St. Francis.
review.reviewText: Stayed at the Historical Wing. And yes, it deserves to be called historical as everything in the room was ancient and outdated.
