Nice attempt on covering up the aging walls and more with a new coat of paint and furnishings. Room was stuffy as windows were not able to open. sticky handles and old carpets. Bathroom was clean and renovated but still outdated. Stayed on the pool floor before and really liked the rooms as it was spacious and well maintained. No more Handerly for us in the Historical Building.
review.positiveRemarks: It is just across from Union Square and is very conveniently located. Safe and happening area. Very lively.
review.negativeRemarks: We understand the preservation of Historical Value but guest comfort needs to be focused as charged.
review.locationRemarks: Next to Union Square .

review.title: Breakfast not incl. "b/c we booked with Expedia"
review.reviewText: We stayed for four nights in June. Our first morning they informed us breakfast wasn't included for us because we booked through Expedia, although foreigners booking through travel companies receive the breakfast vouchers. Given that letdown, and the fact that the weather was far too cold to make using the heated pool comfortable, I regret choosing this hotel. We also ended up in the "historic" part of the hotel. While the rooms were renovated, they are cramped--particularly the bathroom. CA has a water shortage, which probably explains the lack of water pressure in the shower. We did eat breakfast in the hotel the first morning and paid over $50 for one waffle, one yogurt with fruit, one tea, one coffee and one juice. The location is near Union Square and Chinatown, but we spent most of our time down near the water and at Golden Gate Park. The lines to ride the trolley are crazy long if you don't get there early. We waited over an hour to get on a trolley to return to our hotel one night and ended up walking all the way back another night (quite the workout on the hills). The room was clean, and the staff friendly, but I would choose a hotel near the waterfront next time.

review.title: Great location and some good rooms
review.reviewText: Location is terrific.  Hotel has 2 buildings: "historic" (old with small noisy rooms overlooking street) & "premier" (where you want to stay).  Expedia booking got us historic building so we upgraded (negotiated from original quote of $40 per night to $20).  This got us a significantly larger room overlooking the interior courtyard of the "premier" building where the outdoor heated pool is located.  Pool was warm enough to use even with cool evenings, with heat lamps around it.  Pool closes at 8:00 so being near it is not noisy, except in the AM but we were up by 8:00 anyway. Room had frig, toilet separated from sink by door, two fairly comfortable beds, updated fixtures, a sitting area so adults could sit up and read/work while kids slept.  We asked for quiet room & got one at the end of the hall with no foot traffic past our windows like some of the others.  Wi-fi was free but not very good. HUGE negative was the concierge--arrogant & unhelpful.  Asked for a quick, inexpensive meal for 2 tired children & 2 casually dressed adults. Gave us names of 4 tourist traps with entrees priced $25-$35. When I challenged these prices as far from "cheap" he haughtily told said "this is Union Square." We proceeded to find a number of nearby places that fit our needs. Overheard him push same places on other guests. He apparently didn't like me publicly challenging his advice because he was openly rude to me for the rest of our five night stay. Other staff were better but not great.
review.negativeRemarks: CONCIERGE
review.locationRemarks: Union Square has tons of shopping but also easy access to cable cars, 20 minute pleasant walk to piers for Exploratorium, etc.

review.title: Oh the stairs!
review.reviewText: Great room but hard to get to the lobby.  Had to get to another part of the hotel and had to go  past the pool and rec area and up and down stairs to get there and back to the room.  Hard with bad knees. My room was fabulous though with a great view!  Wonderful staff!
review.positiveRemarks: Great service and friendly people.  Very nice restaurant next door.
review.negativeRemarks: Better way to get to the lobby from the part of the hotel above the parking garage.
review.locationRemarks: Right off Union Square, lots of shoppig

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Really good place to stay. All staff were very accommodating. One of the elevators did not and the other was sporadic. Also, the pillows were too soft. Otherwise, a good experience.

review.title: Good location, but needs updating
review.reviewText: Good location with a nice lobby and the premium rooms were nicely sized, but really needs updating.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, size of the premium room were good.  Staff was friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: The lobby and parts of the hotel were nice, but the rooms really need updating.
review.locationRemarks: Great location in union square and close the the bart and great shopping and restaurants.

review.title: great location--right at Union Square
review.reviewText: easy check in and parking. very quiet in spite of being in the heart of San Francisco's Union Square and theatres.
review.positiveRemarks: ease of parking, very good restaurant
review.locationRemarks: all the sights of San Francisco are easily accessed by cable car, walking, tour bus, etc

review.title: Old Building, great location
review.reviewText: We found this hotel difficult to get around, the walk from the garage to the lobby is difficult.  The hotel is in a great location surrounded by great food and close to transportation.  Our room was an odd layout though and had 3 big windows, with a view of exhuast fans.  No amenities

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is probably ok; it is convenient locating in the downtown. My friends and I have a room with two queen beds. It is a bit dusk on the desk, lamp, and overhead of bedding. But, overall it is still ok for me. You could park your car at the public parking building, not too far from the hotel, only one block of street by a couple minutes walk, at 35$ paid all day/night. The staff will recommend you where you should park and save your money.
review.positiveRemarks: It is convenient, locating in the heart of downtown, closed to many shopping malls and restaurants; nice for walking and sightseeing the city.
review.negativeRemarks: parki

review.title: Good hotel and perfect location
review.reviewText: Close to everything and do not forget breakfast at Sears Fine Food!

review.title: Eclectic hotel near Union Square/Theater District
review.reviewText:
Upgraded to a Premium Room on pool side (saw previous reviews about noise on street side). Premium Room was spacious - we roomed 4 adults comfortably. Slider door walked right out to heated indoor pool that was just as pictured. Internal room was quiet, street noise was not excessive. Other guests did use the pool on occasion - no issues rooming next to the pool. 
  Hotel & room were clean & well -maintained, but this is not a new hotel so if you are looking for all new fixtures or a modern European style then this is not the hotel for you. Room & bathroom were clean, towels were replaced daily.
review.positiveRemarks: Near Union Square, the Handlery was highly rated but not nearly as expensive.
review.locationRemarks: Near Union Square, Theater District, Powell/Hyde cable line, Market Street shopping & street car line. Many choices near w/easy access to the Wharf.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: Evrything nice. Especially location.  Room was nice.  Service was ok.

review.title: Great location and staff
review.reviewText: Great location and staff. Best concierge ever at any hotel, absolutely and astoundingly fantastic.

review.title: Central San Francisco
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our stay here. The premier room was spacious, comfortable and clean. Rather a long way from reception, but that was ok. Staff were helpful. Had a couple of meals in the restaurant, which offers traditional American cooking - excellent food and wine. Had one swim in the pool (would have been more if the weather had been better) - lovely pool, clean and well-heated. Location of the hotel is great and we were able to get around the city on foot and by the frequent public transport.
review.positiveRemarks: Size and comfort of the room, staff, swimming pool, restaurant. Location.
review.negativeRemarks: Hallway is a bit dingy. Some of the furnishing is old/old-fashioned.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, shops, restaurants, bars, theatre, cable car, all other public transport. Chinatown and Nob Hill walkable.

review.title: Good but noisy
review.reviewText: Outside the window, grusome backs of the building, incessant grumbling noise of the big engine, thundering, threatening earthquake, actually the bed trembled, however so slightly. The location was superb, the Union Sq. and the streetcar named desire terminal nearabout. Two rooms made one was my first experience.. The room was not square.
review.negativeRemarks: cooling systems noise
review.locationRemarks: the union square, streetcar riding to the wharf, China town, etc.

review.title: Awful
review.reviewText:
The room didn't feel clean and every aspect of it was threadbare and worn out. The bed was uncomfortable. The two pillows were both flat and the linens and blanket felt scratchy and cheap. The bathroom was very dated and dim. The shower was cramped, even for someone of average height. Half of the outlets in the room didn't work.  My mini-fridge was warmer than my room and smelled like mildew.  The A/C for the room was set at 70 and never got close to that but because it had to run the entire night, I got lulled to sleep by the low din of the huge recovery fan right over the foot of the bed.  I had to figure out my room's quirky electrical to get the TV to work, which, by the way, is also on the smaller side. Once it worked, the cable signal was spotty. Everything from the carpet in the room to the paint in the halls to the feel of the lobby was drab, dreary and disappointing.  The staff was trying but it didn't seem like they wanted to be there either. 

Three days prior I stayed at another 3-Star hotel on the other side of Union Square and the difference was night and day.  I have also stayed at a 3-Star closer to the Tenderloin that was far and away better despite the neighborhood. The fact that the Handlery is passed off as a 3-Star hotel is a crock, and I believe that every positive review this hotel received is bogus.  

If it's $50 more a night to stay somewhere else, pay it.  If it's $80 more a night, pay it.  Seriously, this place is that bad.  You've been warned.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom, towels, bed, sheets, blanket, carpet, paint, elevators, etc.  Seriously, gut this place and start over because right now it's awful.
review.locationRemarks: It's a half block from Union Square, which is SF's epicenter for high-end shopping, but nobody staying at the Handlery is shopping there.

review.title: Good Hotel, great location
review.reviewText: No complaints. Everything went well, even met Mr. Handlery, nice guy.
review.positiveRemarks:
Location was convenient.
Staff were excellent.
Room was good.
Restaurant was good.
review.negativeRemarks: Room was small but adequate.
review.locationRemarks: BART station, shopping, food & drink all within walking distance.

review.title: Nice Hotel very close to all attractions,
review.reviewText: I had a very pleasant stay, hotel very nice and comfortable, food excellent and all staff can't do enough to help you. I would highly recommend staying here.
Convinient location only a block away from Bart, cable cars and street cars. And lots of excelwnt eateries within a short walking distance.

review.title: Central Hotel with helpful staff.
review.reviewText: Handlery is a safe hoel close to all sight seeing options. Location near Union Square is close and the Hotel rooms of reasonable size and quiet.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff knowledgable and helpful and safe
review.locationRemarks: Cable car and Big Bus close by as are numerous shops and restaurants.

review.title: Too expensive for the quality
review.reviewText: The hotel was fine. Nothing bad, nothing good. It had a fridge, but no microwave. Outdated bathroom. You needed to reserve the sauna but concierge wasn't around to allow you to reserve it. But it was clean and the pool was neat. Valet not the friendliest.
Easy transportation around. Located in the shopping district.  Hotel is old but clean and friendly staff. Would stay again

review.title: Overpriced sham shack
review.reviewText:
We booked this hotel as a king bed package mystery deal via Expedia, as we could not decide where to stay in San Fransisco. When we got there we were told that a king bed upgrade was an extra $20 per night; we declined to add to the already overpriced hotel.
The room we were given was about 2 times the size of an Alcatraz cell we visited. The bathroom barely had enough room to dry yourself outside of the shower.
The bath plug did not close properly and let water out continuously, the sink overflow also leaked water onto the floor.
The bathroom door did not shut properly nor did it lock, the paint was also chipped off and looked like they recycled it from a demolition sale.
The room smelt like cat pee.
The fridge made the milk we bought curdle in 2 days as it did not cool properly.
Overall the hotel is in need of a major upgrade, we paid more to stay here than in a junior suite at the Belagio in Vegas.
The only good point were the housekeeping staff who did a great job.
I would defiantly not stay here again nor book a 'mystery deal' via Expedia!

review.title: Ugh void this neighborhood
review.reviewText: Well located to all transit and shopping. However the neighborhood is teaming with pan handlers and idegents, drug addicts and physically and mentally diabled babbling to themselves and tourists for money outside trains public libraries and many private shops. It's expensive to visit this hotel, constant crowded entry way at checkin. Consierge gives you a bums rush when asking for help. o be subjected to squaler. Plenty lovely things to do but I m heading to a different spot to hunker in. Sorry Im a hotel snit.
Very convenient location....Staff is excellent, very accommodating and attentive to our need.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms need to be upgraded.  Have been going to this hotel and have been thru many restoration.  I think it is ready for a new upgrade.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, car rentals, restaurants and theaters r all near by.

review.title: Great hotel and location
review.reviewText: We had a great 2 day stay at the Handlery. We had a large room by the pool. Very quiet. Walking distance to restraunts. Took the Bart to get to Pier 39. I wish it would have had coffee in the lobby for the morning. Instead had to buy a 4.50 cup of coffee at the hotel restraunt. Staff was very nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Free coffee in the lobby
review.locationRemarks: Had great sushi, rode cable cars, went to Pier 39 and the Golden Gate Bridge

review.title: Great & well priced hotel close to Union Square Sq
review.reviewText: Great experience all around. Food in San Francisco is amazing!!!
Great.  Love the location and convenience of parking and proximity to great restaurants.

review.title: Good value lodging experience in a great location
review.reviewText: I needed a clean, comfortable & quiet room for under $500 a night that was close to SF's Financial District, and The Handlery delivered. My only complaints would be as follows: 1) Room service breakfast delivery at The Handlery doesn't start until 7am---which really means delivery closer to 7:15am. For business travelers they should be offering room service at 6am. If you've come from the East Coast, you're usually up and hungry by 5 or 6am---and need to get your act together for business meetings by 7am. You can't wait until 7:30am to grab a quick breakfast in your room and head on out.

review.title: Close to Union Square and other attractions.
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our time at the Handlery and the closeness of favorite AD attractions.  Did not like all the construction and torn up streets.  Also plan ahead for route of arrival and departure have a plan B for both.

review.title: Old, dilapidated, lacking in service. depressing.
review.reviewText: Pool shut, no accomodation for a late check out when we had a sick one year old with gastro. No help with doctors or anything. Horrible service and completely run down hotel.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: A great place to enjoy San Francisco, right next to Union Square and Cable Cars.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Easy to get transit concearge very helpful.  Front Desk not so much
review.negativeRemarks: Add overhead lighting.  More accommodating staff.  Sign on bed gave us free breakfast but should not have.  Noting was done.
review.locationRemarks: All transportation, cable cars bus Bart within few blocks

review.reviewText:
Great location! 

The parking is too expensive. There is public parking less than 100 feet away, I will suggest you park your car there.

review.title: Just OK
review.reviewText: Service at restaurant is too slow and food variety is also not enough for vegetarians.
review.negativeRemarks: Price is high. Room and Washroom size is so small
review.locationRemarks: In Heart of the city downtown

review.title: Excellent location, close to cable car, restaurant
review.reviewText:
This hotel is perfectly located close to union Square, restaurants, shops and a lot of activity.
The average price per night is good to be San Francisco Downtown, actually I would say is more affordable than the other hotels.
And for the price you get a full , great size, clean, quiet room, full closet, full bathroom, a/c.
You may get lower prices in other hotels in SF Downtown, but sometimes rooms are extremely small, or noisy, or smelly, or in the worst case SHARED BATHROOM.
If I would need to select again, I will choose this Hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Room size, clean, perfect location and reasonable price
review.negativeRemarks: Renew A/C
review.locationRemarks: Restaurants, Cable Car, Pubs, Shopping, BART station, walking distance from businesses centers

review.title: Ok hotel - a little rough around the edges
review.reviewText: We were given a room "with a balcony" which turned out to be overlooking a courtyard with a pool that was being resurfaced AKA jack hammering. When I called to tell the desk they said they'd forgotten about that; hard to believe with how loud it was. The next room was quieter, luckily we'd planned on going out for the day. The bell staff were inattentive unless directly addressed. Just weird. Other than that it was fine.

review.title: Comfortable, clean, and convenient.
review.reviewText: I was there for 5 days in April 2015.  Friendly staff, clean and comfortable room.  I like that the window would open (I was on the 3rd floor) so I could get some fresh air when I wanted.  The only drawback is the shower stall only (no bath- and after days of walking, my legs could've used a soak).  The free wi-fi worked well.
review.locationRemarks: A very short walking distance to all transportation- you can take the BART from SFO to the Powell station and it is a 5-min walk to the hotel.

review.title: Not worth the hassle
review.reviewText: We got caught in rush hour traffic leaving town and it took us 2 hours to go maybe 12 blocks. the one ways were closed in some areas and getting to the front door was VERY difficult. The room was remodeled but not very ergonomic. toilet was too close to the sink counter and hindered access, getting around between the 2 hotels (Yes there is an old and a new) was like being in a rat maze. Almost $50 to park overnight made up the difference in what we saved from using Expedia. Then after you tip the bellhop 3-4 times for things I could do on my own... I'd have rather stayed at the Nob Hill Hotel on Pacific, and rode the Cable Cars to this area. Seriously... the traffic was hell... Motorcycles zipping in between cars, pedestrians jumping out in front of traffic, cars cutting you off and creating gridlock... PURE HELL. I did like the access to some really cool bars... But that was it.... and I could've got a cab from a more reasonable hotel to those...
review.positiveRemarks: Not much really... I'm surprised they stay in business... they do cater to you like a 5 star hotel... but they are 3 star at best.
review.negativeRemarks: If I tell you I can get my own bags..... I can get my own bags... quit bilking everyone for a tip.
review.locationRemarks: Lefty O'Douls is a cool bar.... but over run with Longshoremen union members singing union songs...

review.title: Right in the center of action!
review.reviewText: We were pleased with the location of the hotel! It was also a great looking hotel as well as a cute and quaint room. The room was also bigger than the average hotel room, and better than we anticipated. The bed was very comfortable; we slept like little lambs! Everything was perfect in the room! The staff was very friendly as well as the parking garage staff. We didn't use the pool but it did say it was heated and we saw others swimming even though the weather was a bit chilly! So I know for a fact that the pool was comfortable enough to swim! I noticed the gym area was also being used and I like the fact that you can workout anytime! We also got a chance to eat at the attached restaurant Daily Grill and we liked that it was easy access from the hotel lobby; basically you just had to walk thru a hallway from the lobby. The hotel was super close to all the action and there were name brand stores all along our block! Shopping there was not a problem!! Overall, amazing experience!!
review.positiveRemarks: We loved everything about this hotel and how it was in the center of Union Square! Everything in the room was to satisfactory level!
review.locationRemarks: There are so many brand name stores to shop at within walking distance. It is in the center of a lot of restaurants, stores, bars, and much action!

review.reviewText: Great location and price-service. The room was clean.
Friendly staff! Enjoyed my stay! Located right by the cable carts which was a plus!

review.title: I always stay here!
review.reviewText: This place has such a home feeling to it and its true to San Francisco victorian homes style living.

review.title: Nice hotel in a great location.
review.reviewText: The room overlooked the pool. The room was perfect. The bed was comfortable. The only issue I had was the valet parking was very expensive.

review.title: Nice Trip
review.reviewText: The hotel has a good location, the room was small but nice, did not have a view but everything else was food.
review.negativeRemarks: Fix the smoke detector that goes off with the steam of the shower.

review.title: nice hotel, close to Union square
review.reviewText: Very nice staff, close to everything and room rates are resaonable.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to everything, right off Union square.
review.negativeRemarks: Time to up grade rooms, however than the prices would not be as good.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, theater, restaurants, fun fun fun!

review.title: Great Stay!!
review.reviewText: Staff was so pleasant and accommodating. We were able to check in 4 hours early. They were quick to offer help as my family and I moved around town.

review.title: Very pleasant stay.
review.reviewText: Our overall stay could not have been nicer. The concierge to the front desk were most kind and knowledgeable. At the end of the day it was a joy to return to a well cared for comfortable room.
Excellent central location and clean comfortable accommodations.

review.title: Not nearly as nice in person as in pictures
review.reviewText:
The hotel was quite disappointing. The pictures make the rooms look much larger and brighter than they are in person. The hotel seems to have been created by merging multiple old buildings, creating a maze of dark corridors with very worn carpets, walls, and moldings. The first room I was given did not even have a window with light coming in! It was covered in a translucent film and apparently looked directly onto a brick wall only a foot or two away. The front desk gave me a new room when I complained about it but that shouldn't have been necessary.

The staff at the hotel were friendly and helpful but it's just so much more run down, dark, noisy, and small than it appears in the pictures I'm not sure how much they can do to overcome those problems.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location, close to Union Square goings-on
review.locationRemarks: Good location. Union Square is a fun place to spend a few days.

review.title: Way too much money for a basic room.
review.reviewText: Two disjointed buildings with lots of hallways and no central area. Old dirty carpets and wallpaper.
review.locationRemarks: Immediately outside the "premier" building entrance were bums and trash and stench. More like a back alley than a union square "resort"

review.title: Cute hotel in great location near Union Square.
review.reviewText:
In general the Handlery Hotel in San Francisco is great little hotel in a great location.
Vintage but, clean & reasonably comfortable for the price - $180/day, booking thru Expedia.
Unloading/Parking a little confusing as the entrance to the p garage is on the other side of the block.
review.negativeRemarks:
Staff customer service could use improvement.  Basic greetings & acknowledgments were seriously lacking.
Staff usually chatting amongst themselves.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square & all that comes with it.  Powell St & Cable Cars.

review.reviewText: Despite the location is excellent، hotel was very old. There are voices issued from the floor rooms when you walk on them. Old bathroom too. The windows do not close completely, allowing the entry of dust and noise of the street into the room

review.title: OK, not good
review.reviewText: Hotel is clean and very well-located (although just a few blocks from the Tenderloin), but needs to be updated. Windows thin. I had a room in the back exposing me to a very loud HVAC system. Heating and cooling system didn't work that well.
review.negativeRemarks: See above
review.locationRemarks: Union Square great place for public transpoartation

review.title: Great place to stay with super helpful staff!
review.reviewText: Had to go for some business and I was able to walk anywhere I needed to go because of the excellent location.  The staff was very helpful, friendly and professional.  I will definitely stay here again if I need to be in SF.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, staff and character of the older building.
review.locationRemarks: Union square and great restaurants are walking distance.

review.title: Great location -nice rooms
review.reviewText: Great hotel, love the location, park somewhere else-up the street-parking at the hotel is 57.00  per day plus taxes-parked up the street -for 30 per day

review.title: Great hotel for a shopping weekend
review.reviewText: My Daughters and I stayed at the Handlery for a girls shopping weekend.  It is less than a block from Union Square was perfect for our trip.  Our room was beautiful and large.  The front desk gave me the choice of a street room with a view or a quiet room with no view.  We selected the quiet room and were very happy.
review.positiveRemarks: Large room, comfortable beds, quiet, wonderful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: My daughters wanted to use the Sauna, but it needs to be scheduled in advance and unlocked.  It should be available without a reservation.

review.title: Pleasant and centrally located.
review.reviewText: All staff members were very helpful with getting directions & transportation.  All staff members  should be commended for their excellent social skills.
review.locationRemarks: convenient.  shops, restuarants within an arms length.

review.title: Nice hotel in great location. Close to everything.
review.reviewText: We had four days and explored most of the City. Transit is so convent . GGP, Fishermans Wharf,and great dining.

review.title: Better choice for union square
review.reviewText:
This hotel is very quite (unusual for this side of town). It provides the best value for the area. I will stay here when ever I come to SF from now on. It is actually actress the street from a $500/night hotel....

It is close to the Sushi Boat which is awesome!
review.positiveRemarks: This place is a good value and quiet....
review.negativeRemarks: It's better than the W
review.locationRemarks: Sushi Boat restaurant is very close....

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: AC unit does not cool the room. Nice room layout for 3 adults

review.title: Close and convenient Location
review.reviewText: The hotel is in the heart of Union Square, which makes it easy to get around however, if you're not used to city noise, this hotel isn't for you.  Although its not constant, it can be annoying to some to be woken by sirens or honking horns.  The staff is great and the beds are very comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: Tons of shopping and great restaurants

review.title: USF move in!
review.reviewText:
I was recommended to this hotel by the University of San Francisco website. After looking at reviews, prices and location I decided to book the room for two nights preceding the move in date. 

While at first glance the hotel looked a little dated, it was obvious there was much attention to detail in this family owned hotel!  Very clean and comfortable. You will not be disappointed. Very polite staff.

review.title: It is an older hotel in a great location.
review.reviewText: I lost my wallet in the cab and the bellman (Jaime) and later concierge Dale were so helpful.  Spent two hours trying to get cabbie to respond - ultimately wallet never showed up, but the staff acted as if they had lost their own wallet.  Treated me with much kindness.
review.negativeRemarks: Air conditioning system.
review.locationRemarks: Near Union Square and the turn around for street car.

review.reviewText: Nice and clean. Great walking distance to shopping, restaurants, & other attractions!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great staff  comfortable shopping and restaurants walking distance

review.title: Closer to union square then I thought
review.reviewText: We were upgraded to a bigger room and it was clean and comfortable. The pool and gym were convineint. After searching for a decent hotel in Union square( 3 hour wait at the cheesecake factory) we settled for the daily grill and It was delicious! Will defienitly return.

review.title: Location, Location!
review.reviewText: Stayed three nights prior to hiring car to tour California, Arizona and Nevada. This hotel is ideally located just off Union Square. Staff were excellent without exception. I think there may be a more modern block but we were in the original part of the hotel. Although modern and well equipped the room was cramped as were the shower toilet facilities. In fact the hand basin was in the room itself. But we'd stay again no problem.
review.negativeRemarks: Not sure old rooms could be improved short of major construction work. But fine.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, main shopping area, cable car stops and buses all within walking distance as is an excellent diner for breakfast (cheaper than hotel).

review.title: Great hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: The Handlery Union Square Hotel is in a great location for shopping and touring San Francisco.  Short walk to the cable car station as well.  Staff is very friendly and helpful.  Hotel is nice and clean.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel tower we stayed in was very historic and clean.  A great atmosphere.
review.negativeRemarks: There was not much of a view from our room and the air conditioning unit was a little loud.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping and cable car station is very close by, along with many places to eat.

review.title: Nice hotel.  Close to Union Square.
review.reviewText: We found the hotel to be nice, very clearn and very close to Union Square, however, it was dated.  Although it was advertised that the hotel had valet parking, when we pulled up to the front of the hotel on Geary, we were re-directed to pull around to the parking garage on O'Farrell.  There were no signs posted to reflect this.
review.negativeRemarks: A sign to reflect where parking is would be helpful.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is very close to Union Square.  Lots of shopping and restaurants.

review.title: Expensive
review.reviewText: Not a typical experience as there was unusual storm in area and power out for several hours in the morning.  Most disappointing fact was that there was no effort to provide coffee to hotel guests in the lobby.  It is an expensive hotel but is located nicely for union square activities.  I did feel that with auxilliary power it would have been easy enough to plug in a few coffee pots and get some coffee going.  There was no offer to reduce the price of the room or offer another night stay at a different time.
review.negativeRemarks: management of power outage situation skills improved
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location for union square on foot.

review.title: Pity about us oldies
review.reviewText: This Hotel is in a prime location adjacent to Union Square it has an excellent restaurant attached and service is informative and timely. The hotel comprises two buildings and our room was in the annexed portion which is joined by a flight of stairs from the lobby area of the main building to the annexed wing where our room was situated. There is no passenger lift between the two. My wife and I  are both approaching 70 and neither of us have full mobility. Fortunately we located an open sided service lift in which my wife became very proficient as a lift driver. Better screening of clients on booking in could have prevented our discomfort.
review.negativeRemarks: Access to annexed building

review.reviewText: The guys running the garage were exceptionally helpful. They met all our needs and even helped us get out during the protesting.

review.title: no backup power
review.reviewText: power went off no water no heat no lights had to leave to get warm gave no rain check did not care

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: Very good location but not nearly as nice as the price would lead you to expect.  Small room, very dated.  Rusty junction box in the bathroom.  Just enough room to turn around.  Quality of an older facility at Four Season's prices.  We will not be back at this price.
Nice enough for the price and location. Hospital smell throughout hotel is my only negative comment.
Overall it's a great place if you are near Union Square. My rate was good for the area. My room was a bit small and the bed wasn't super.

review.title: Friendly hotel very close to Union Square
review.reviewText:
Staff very helpful and pleasant and dealt with our noisy neighbors in a timely and efficient manor when it was brought to their attention.
Room was comfortable though bathroom on the small side but to be expected from an older property.
review.negativeRemarks: Stronger coffee in the room and more creamers.
review.locationRemarks: Great shopping and restaurants nearby

review.title: Location, location!!!
review.reviewText: Very friendly and accommodating hotel staff.  Location is perfect for shopping, fine dining, casual lunch, drinks, cable car...  Great hotel!

review.title: Great location and value.
review.reviewText: There's no distinguishing or memorable feature about this property, but that's fine, it just is a reliable property where you will have comfortable stay.  Perfect location adjacent to Union Square.  For an older property it is very well maintained, and the rooms are larger than average, and have all the standard amenities.  It seems 2 building are combined to make this property, and I think I stayed in the older structure, whereas the newer structure did have the appearance of being more up-to-date.  Again, standard comfort, standard decor, larger than average rooms, all the usual services and amenities...it's just a safe pick, and good value too.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.  It's an ordinary property, but totally comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square shopping, nightlife, dining.  Access to public transport and cable cars to everywhere else you'd want to visit.

review.reviewText: Decent hotel at a decent price - staff was a great experience - room are not so great, but if you need a hotel downtown SF at a decent price, absolutely recommendable.

review.title: Weird chemical smell in out of date rooms,
review.reviewText: Bad, indifferent service and nasty chemical smell in rooms. Seriously needs decorating too.

review.title: Loud noises
review.reviewText: I loved how close the hotel was to Union Square but was dissappointed with how noisey the rooms were. It made it very difficult to sleep with all the trucks banging and crashing all night. I would stay there again and ask for a room that didnt face the street to avoid the noise.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was great. Easy walking distance to shopping and resturants.
review.negativeRemarks: We asked for extra coffee and cups as there were 4 in the room and had to call back the next day AGAIN as it was never delivered. NOISE CONTROL
review.locationRemarks: Macy's and the trolley stopped right at the corner for easy access. Lots of shopping and Union Square. Good resturants near by as well.

review.title: A place to sleep
review.reviewText: Before you read mind you, there was nothing wrong with this hotel. The staff was friendly and it was clean. It was just dated. Very dated. It wasn't too far off from staying at your grandmother's house. But it was a safe, affordable place to stay. There was wifi and TV.
review.locationRemarks: It's a great location for staying near Union Square. It's not even a block away. It was extremely convenient to downtown.

review.reviewText:
room was very small, but comfortable.
ok if it were not for the price
overly priced for what i got 
Arnie

review.title: Nice Downtown SF Hotel
review.reviewText: I stayed here for a conference in downtown SF.  Great location, close to conference facility, places to eat in the evening, shopping, and other amenities.  Although a 'historic building' (they still have what looks like the original multistory mail drop in the lobby and each floor) the property was well maintained and updated with things like a small fitness room & pool. The room I was in was clean and comfortable, although a bit on the small side. Also very helpful and friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Open the hotel restaurant earlier (opened at 7AM) and throw in some kind of breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: You can catch a cable car about a block away that goes over nob hill and down to fisherman's wharf in about 15 minutes.

review.title: Lovely hotel close to everything.
review.reviewText: Handlery Union hotel was great. The room we had was clean and roomy with a very comfy bed. It also had a mini fridge which was very handy. Close to many restaurants including our favourite The Cheesecake Factory which is a 2 minute walk away. Close to the tram line and walking distance to the Powell st station BART TRAIN. Smack in the midle of many shops. Highly recommended.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything but mainly location and the big comfy bed.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing.
review.locationRemarks: See above

review.title: Great position
review.reviewText: A little old and dark, but rooms were clean and comfortable. Fridge in room was handy. Position was great, close to everything. Staff were helpful and friendly.
I was there for a convention at another hotel.  I stayed at the Handlery. It was a nice hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms were a little small, but I wasn't there much, so it was not an issue.
review.locationRemarks: Great location.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: Easy to access the hotel via Geary St or O'Farrell St. Within walking distance of eateries, shopping, transportaion, theaters, etc.
review.negativeRemarks: The business center was too warm.

review.title: Needs a little modernising
review.reviewText:
The location was excellent - seconds from Union Square and a train station and Macy's etc. However it was in a very busy spot and could be noisy at night. This could have been solved with some modernising to the windows to the hotel. There was also a lot of light from the street which couldn't be blocked out well with the blinds at the windows. Some thick curtains are really needed on top of the blinds.
The rooms were very clean and presentable but the bathroom was a little shabby and dated and the shower was not very hot or powerful. In addition to this, the boilers/pipes were very noisy and I was woken every morning of my trip by the sound of them starting up.
There was also a very odd musty old smell around the hotel and especially in the room.

review.title: A Halloween Getaway
review.reviewText: Went to SF for weekend getaway. Giants won the World Series and SF scheduled their parade...traffic was horrendous. Hotel was nice and the location was great for the big city experience and fun. Had a good time!
review.negativeRemarks: Room was on the smallish side and a bit uncomfortable but it worked and was clean.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square and shopping but a lot of constructionmade foot travel difficult.

review.title: Exceeded expectations
review.reviewText:
Excellent San Francisco hotel that exceeded expectations. The room size was very generous by San Francisco standards and the front desk staff could not have been more helpful when we required an additional rollaway bed. The place was clean, safe and comfortable and the location couldn’t be better. We were lucky enough to get a very good rate on this (again, by San Francisco standards) so I was expecting something homely but it was actually a very classy place. We had a pool view room with a balcony and had no issues whatsoever with noise. We never used the pool but it looked nice. I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend the Handlery to anyone and if we’re ever back in San Francisco I don’t see any reason for us to look elsewhere for somewhere to stay.

TIP: Lefty O'Douls two doors down is a much better option for breakfast than the Daily Grill next door.

review.title: Best location in town
review.reviewText: The proximity to all things is the best part of the Handlery.  The rooms are small but adequate, especially as they have been 'redone'.  the most disturbing part is the increasing number of homeless and obviously mentally ill people surrounding the downtown area.  I never felt threatened, but the difference from 2008 to now is remarkable.  I wonder what the city is doing to help these people.

review.title: Nice hotel, great location
review.reviewText: Had stayed at the hotel on a previous trip approx 10 years ago so opted to return to a familiar place and am so glad that I did. The hotel has a fantastic location just off Union Square, meaning getting out and about and exploring San Francisco is easy. The hotel itself postively oozes character and charm, whilst also having the modern convience of free wifi. When I next return to San Francisco, this hotel will be top of my list!
review.positiveRemarks: Location, location, location!!! Personality and charm. Free wifi. Swimming pool and exercise room. Choice of room types. Excellent restaurant also.
review.negativeRemarks: Car parking charges are expensive, to be expected due to the location, but should have been better explained on booking. Room service not 24hrs.
review.locationRemarks: Union square, shopping at Westfield, Hop on/off sightseeing buses start here. Easy to jump on a cable car. Loads of restaurants to choose from.

review.title: Nice hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: I had a  good experience staying at this hotel, in The center of SFO near everything

review.title: Great place near Union Square
review.reviewText: We had a great time there.  Super location.  Very convenient.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.  Great attitude.

review.title: GREAT LOCATION
review.reviewText:
We (3 of us) arrived just prior to check in time and had to wait as our requested "Quiet Room " was not ready but the wait was worth it. Staff had actually read our request and admirably accommodated us. Room was spacious and definitely QUIET and well maintained during our 6 night stay. Staff were very helpful and knowledgeable.

When we checked out the hotel stored our luggage until we had to head out to the airport which was a bonus.
review.positiveRemarks: The room  was clean and staff helpful
review.negativeRemarks: Not applicable
review.locationRemarks: Hotel is centrally located downtown and close to public transport and tourist attractions as well as shopping venues

review.title: Ok Hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel very close to Union Square. Room was nice but every sound from rooms next door can be heard, so if you are very sensitive to noise I would not stay here.

review.title: In the center of it all
review.reviewText: Very pleased with the location and price. I didn't want to drive so I looked for a hotel near the cable cars and there was a cable car stop 30 seconds from the front door. Don't expect a view for your surrounded by high-rises, my view was of three other walls of the hotel, but like I said, I didn't get this for the view.Union Square
review.positiveRemarks: Union Square right across the street..cable car stop close by...gadzillion places to eat in every direction you look.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking not easy to find. Circled the block twice and still could not find their parking lot. Had to park at the curb and run in to find where it was
review.locationRemarks: see above about what I Liked

review.title: Good Location Hotel at Union Square
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay in the hotel.  It took us less than 15 minutes to check in and as there was a room available when we reached the hotel at noon, they allowed us to check in immediately.  On the last day of our tour as they were fully booked, though we have to check out by noon, they allowed us to use their sauna room to clean up at the end of the day before we leave for the airport at 9pm.
review.positiveRemarks: It is conventiently located at Union Square and within walking distance to shops like Gap, Macy, etc.
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks:
The location is good and there is a cable car stop just next to the hotel.
There are plenty of eating places near to the hotel.

review.title: Wonderful hotel! Nice big rooms. We'll back!
review.reviewText: One think, in restoran stuff need more training, they below a lot in serving. Some serving spilled coffe on my friend((  I believe in kind like this hotel needs hiring people with experiences.

review.title: San Francisco reacquainted
review.reviewText:
An older style hotel that is both pleasant and very comfortable.  Our room was clean and well appointed with a view over the inner courtyard with a swimming pool.  Good sized bathroom with an ante room. Bath robes supplied.  Getting to our room located in the block at the rear involved climbing a double set of stairs.  Not an easy task.  I believe there is a very small lift for wheelchair access.  Excellent restaurant in the hotel on the ground floor.  Very tastefully decorated with mirrors and masses of old and historical photos of San Francisco.  Free Wifi. We would certainly recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Visit local ethnic restaurants for great food - there is a wide variety of choice.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location; a very short walk to Union Square.  Easy walk to Market Street - shops and transport.
review.negativeRemarks: Air con was rather noisy at times.
review.locationRemarks: Visit Union Square.  Eat at the Cheesecake Factory on top of Macy's overlooking the Square.  Great choice of local restaurants & lots not expensive.

review.title: Great location , ok hotel !
review.reviewText: Checked in and was moved to 3 different rooms . First 2 rooms were tiny and run down and third was good. Great location for all amenities !!

review.title: over priced and dirty room
review.reviewText: We paid $300.00 for a dated, dirty, load room. We found hairs in our bathroom. We were told at check in that the hotel was over sold and no other rooms were available. The room was a corner room and was extremely loud. This was our first and last stay.

This hotel has a fantastic location and a lovely staff. I am used to staying in a larger and more updated room. We were so busy that it didn't bother us too much. If you are used to a very fine hotel, this may not meet your needs. On the other hand, if you want a nice staff and a great location, this is the place for you.
review.negativeRemarks: Updating the rooms

review.title: Nicest view
review.reviewText: me and 3 of my friends stayed there and expedia sent me an email for my reservation i asked for most spacious and extra towels and when i got there i got a really big room and extra towels and even had an extremely nice view! Check in and out was about 5 minutes each

review.title: Lovely hotel close to all amenities.
review.reviewText: Hotel was perfect clean and friendly great location.

review.title: Perfectly located by union square.
review.reviewText: The room was very spacious and well appointed. One negative was the very old and noisy air conditioning which made sleep difficult with it going. It was also too noisy to open the windows for some fresh air. It was also quite inconvenient to have to walk past the pool and down stairs to reach reception, rather than just take a lift. Overall though the room was clean and we'll maintained. The staff were all very helpful and responsive to any requests.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, size of room and staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Upgrade air conditioning unit
review.locationRemarks: Union square, with marvellous live music.

review.title: Best Value On Union Square
review.reviewText: Having stayed at the Handlery several times, I am pleased that it has settled back into its groove following its renovation.  It is a very functional hotel with friendly service and good attention to detail.  The rooms are cleaned promptly as soon as guests are out and they provide adequate comfort and amenities for the price point.  The beds are comfortable, the rooms are large enough for two people and the staff is responsive to all needs of the guests.  The free wifi is slow and erratic, but at least it is not charged ala carte anymore.  The Cable TV package is better than other area hotels and provide major channels and coverage of SF Giants baseball.  I am also pleased that a restaurant has been added, though I find the choice of music a little loud and off-putting to me, so I tend to eat next door at Lefty O'Doul's which is adequate for a quick breakfast.  For me, the Handlery is probably close to an ideal middle class hotel without pretensions to the luxury category, but much better than many nearby alternatives which are pushing the price envelope relative to their value these days.  I would happily recommend the hotel and its perfect location on Union Square to all visitors to San Francisco.  It was a perfect home base for my wife and I as we zoomed around San Francisco enjoying its restaurants, shopping and other attractions so very accessible from Union Square.
review.positiveRemarks: Good value package overall with comfortable rooms, free wifi, good cable and good service.
review.negativeRemarks: The lobby is small and frequently jammed with guests at peak rush, but the tradeoff seems to be the extra space allocated to a useful business center.
review.locationRemarks: Location is perfect for shopping, very good for dining, and ideal for enjoying the atmosphere of San Francisco.

review.title: Handy location to city centre
review.reviewText:
Certainly not worth the money paid for the room provided.
Location of hotel is good.
Pleasant sraff
review.negativeRemarks: The room we were given was too small and we could hardly get our suitcases and ourselves in the room together.
review.locationRemarks:
Good shopping and eateries available near by.
Good access to public transport

review.title: Close to city centre and suburban transport hub
review.reviewText: A lovely hotel that was welcoming and relaxed and very close to the city centre. Staff were helpful. Affordable room rates.
review.positiveRemarks: The history and character and being close to the city centre
review.negativeRemarks: I did not use restaurant but heard diners say there was often a long wait to be seated
review.locationRemarks: Close to some great restaurants.  Close to cable car, F line trolley buses and BART.  An excellent location to start exploring the city

review.title: Great location - handy shopping, food & transport
review.reviewText: Hotel is based in a heritage building right next to Union Square. Staff are helpful. Convenient kerbside loading available. Rooms are a bit cramped, some with no views, but all amenties work as expected.
review.locationRemarks:
Very handy to eateries, Cable car starting point on Market Street and to Westfield Mall & Union Sq shops.
Bellini Cafe on Powell has great coffees.

review.title: Great location.  No complaints..
review.reviewText: New section of the hotel good. Terrible view though. Staff were very rushed when doing something. No real complaints.
review.negativeRemarks: Lighting in rooms should be brighter. Staff should be more approachable . Highly strung.
review.locationRemarks: Shops, restaurants

review.title: Very dated and basic but excellent location
review.reviewText: The rooms are noisy, small and certainly not ideal for sharing if you have an upset belly (the toilet is practically in the room with you) but this is still a good spot for a short, very central stay in San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: It's due a reno!
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location. Right on Union Square and close to all the shops, tram, restaurants and more shops.

review.title: Too short but delightful not the less.
review.reviewText: We were greeted and told where to go for site seeing. Even though we had a tour it was interesting to find the fortune cookie lady in Ross alley.

review.title: Awesome Hotel and Great Location
review.reviewText: Greeted before we even left the cab by the bell boy. Whenever we needed a Cab they would get us one. Staff were great. Concierge could have been a little more helpful with helping us plan our day trips etc. Overall the experience here was awesome.
review.negativeRemarks: Concierge could be more helpful compared to the Concierge we had in LA at another hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Awesome Location. Close to everything. Cable cars just down the road and hop on hop off buses a short walk away too.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: The Handlery is very central to Union Square. Very convenient for shopping and sightseeing. The room was OK but not a lot of room for 2 suitcases.
review.locationRemarks: Sightseeing buses leave from Union Square and all major shops are within walking distance away. All sorts of eating places are in abundance .

review.title: Location and easiness
review.reviewText: I stayed for 4 nights at the hotel and was totally satisfied. I was in the old part of the hotel, but everything worked fine. The location is wonderful, on the corner of Union Square. I recommend any restaurant around the hotel, all great experiences...
review.locationRemarks: Perfect1

review.title: A great location
review.reviewText: This hotel is within a very short walk to Union Square and all the best department stores as well as the start of the the cable cars that go to Pier 39.  Loved it.

review.title: Very close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Our room was in the older section with a modern touch in soft furnishings.  Bathroom basin was in the main room which was only a slight inconvenience.  Bed was springy and probably needed replacing as well as the main bed pillows which were lumpy.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, friendly front staff and porters, free wifi.
review.negativeRemarks: New beds and pillows
review.locationRemarks: Very central to trolleys, buses, Bart, shops and great hub to stay in.

review.title: Hotel ideally situated for exploration of SF
review.reviewText: Although situated on a busy street it was the lack of adequate sound proofing from the rooms of a noisy German couple as well as an Australian couple. The very loud German woman was a particular early riser.
review.negativeRemarks: Modernisation would cause the loss of some of the charm.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, shopping, China Town for a glimpse of a bit of history, cable car terminus five minutes walk.

review.title: Good central location
review.reviewText: Great for a short stay if you are a family on a budget
review.negativeRemarks: Air con was very noisy

review.title: Stairs within hotel.
review.reviewText: I have trouble with stairs. I found it difficult to go up and down from one level to the next.  There was a small elevator for wheelchairs. I attempted to use but could not operate.
review.negativeRemarks: Lighting in corridors needs improving, very dark.

review.title: Very nice comfortable hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: Every aspect of my stay was excellent except for the fact that the air conditioning in the room was not working well and the engineer just told me that it was working and offered me a fan.  Otherwise, very helpful desk help, beautiful room, very comfortable bathroom.
review.positiveRemarks: Excellent location, very upscale room appointments.
review.negativeRemarks: The room engineer could have agreed that the ac was really not working.
review.locationRemarks: More shopping than you can imagine.

review.title: Good value in the heart of Union Square
review.reviewText: Hotel is extremely well located.  We walked Union Square and Chinatown, near cable cars and lots of stores and restaurants.  The hotel was very busy (summer tourist season) but staff were friendly and helpful.  The hotel is aging, and decor and finishes were not top drawer.  Our bathroom was not clean when we arrived.  But the room was spacious by SF standards.  The hotel bar was nice, and the hotel was next door to a lovely little Irish Pub with live music.
review.positiveRemarks: The price was definitely right.  Location was perfect for our purposes.
review.negativeRemarks: Could use some updating; cleanliness.
review.locationRemarks: It's Union Square in San Francisco--so much to do and see.  Shopping, restaurants, sightseeing, bars, and lots of tourists.

review.title: Very nice hotel in not a nice area
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nicely furnished and the room was particularly nice. All of the staff were very friendly. It wasn't in a very nice area though and we didn't enjoy our stay in San Francisco.

review.title: Great central location
review.reviewText: Enjoyable stay. Union Square (where hop on hop off bus stops) virtually at your doorstep. Great shopping all around and close to several theatres. An easy walk to AT & T park for those who wish to experience a baseball game. For those who like being in the heart of a big city this is for you.

review.title: Over Rated.
review.reviewText: I will not be staying at this hotel again. First of all the rooms are overpriced. Do yourself a favor and pay a few dollars more to stay at the other hotels around Union Square. Front desk staff is unwelcoming. They never told me they were putting a $150 deposit on my credit card for incedentals. The elevators kept breaking down in the premier section, refrig in room was not working. All in all a very unpleasant experiece. My four day weekend was horrible. My room was prepaid so if I could i would have asked for my money back.
review.negativeRemarks: This hotel needs new ownership or management.
review.locationRemarks: It is located in Union Square.

review.title: Comfortable hotel in fantastic location
review.reviewText: Stayed for 5 night in August, Hotel staff are extremely knowledgeable about the local area and enabled us to make the most of our time in San Fran. Bar attached to the hotel serves excellent food and bar snacks. Good size room with large bathroom and the hotel has all the amenities you could want.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, staff local knowledge, free wifi
review.negativeRemarks: Room decor could be updated
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, Cable Car, Market Street, shopping

review.title: NIce Hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText: We were very happy with the hotel.  The rooms are very nice and it is very conveniently located.  If you have a car there is onsite parking.

review.title: wonderful location and generous sized room
review.reviewText: location is perfect- right next to union square.  room was very generous for san fran. some bell men were nicer than others- i think they were overwhelmed with the number of guests. housekeeping was very kind. parking was less than convenient- you actually have to go down to the lobby, maneuver through the building to another building and down the elevator (or a very comical trip down the stairs which leads you through 4 different doors saying "garage." only the last door is blank and it's actually the garage) OR walk around the block to the other side of the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: parking...much too time consuming and irritating. takes bellmen away from the front and i'm sure is a nightmare for them. valet though were wonderful

review.title: Very good hotel!!
review.reviewText: I loved this hotel, it is very well located, very comfortable and has amazing staff.

review.title: Great place/people/location
review.reviewText: This is the only hotel I've stayed at in Union Square that I would highly recommend. Very clean/comfortable/convenient.

review.title: Decent location nice people
review.reviewText: Had a good stay here. Good location. Nothing too special but good price
Beautiful room in the old historic part of the hotel.  Can't beat the location

review.title: The convenience of being close to union square
review.reviewText: The hotel is nice. The rooms are small but that's common in San Francisco. The staff was ok. You could probably book a better place around  the area for the price they charge here

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Our room was nice but looked out onto other wings of the hotel so was quite dim but we were out most of the day anyway.  We found it a bit noisy at night as we had our window open and all the air-con units hummed all night but we did appreciate being able to open the window.  Our room smelt of mothballs which we found a bit disconcerting.  Facilities were good, (the sauna was great) and the location very central.  Staff were helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: The location.  I also liked the contemporary decor and our room was a good size (we had 2 double beds).
review.negativeRemarks: I wouldn't want to stay in a room that had just been commercially cleaned.
review.locationRemarks: Beside Union Square.  The big department stores are all close;  Market St and the BART station are minutes away;  North Beach is a cable car trip away

review.title: Great location close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Great location, heritage building, room a bit smallish but otherwise no complaints.  Found a great deal on Expedia, when most of the big chains were quoting silly money.  Concierge was particularly helpful and I overheard many other snippets of wisdom being dispensed. Well located for the main tourist sights in that area of Frisco and also transport links to many others (Main station for Muni & Bart, Powell station is no more than 5-10 mins away).
review.positiveRemarks: Good deal combined with great location of what was obviously a misy weekend.
review.negativeRemarks: Smallish room but OK.
review.locationRemarks: Ride a cable car, shopping, Pier 39 and access to amny other Bay Area sights via good transport.

review.title: Perfect location and close to everything
review.reviewText: The Handlery is right off Union Square. This puts it near all the rapid transit lines including the cable cars. We were able to walk to our restaurant reservations four of the five nights we were in town.
review.negativeRemarks: Not much
review.locationRemarks: Everything

review.title: Small room but nice
review.reviewText: The room was smaller than expected and faced the busy street. The bar closes way to early but the staff were nice. The room was well kept.
review.negativeRemarks: Later bar hours.
review.locationRemarks: In the middle of all the action so very good.

review.title: downtown san francisco
review.reviewText: It's a very good city to visit; mild weather (in August) and relatively short distances made it great for walking almost everywhere from where we were staying (Geary and Mason Streets). There are excellent restaurants and some beautiful neighbourhoods. A lot do do and the hills made exploring the city a fun and a great workout (though not for younger children). Very happy to have discovered a city with a decent network of bike lanes and, for the most part, bike/pedestrian-friendly drivers.  lots of  very inviting parks, squares, outdoor cafes-- especially after a  couple of hours walking up and down hills.
review.positiveRemarks: desk staff friendly, very helpful and knowledgeable especially when it came to info about public transportation
review.locationRemarks: perfect location. close to shops and transportation. within walking distance of great neighbourhoods like North Beach, waterfront, Telegraph Hill...

review.title: Heart of Union Square
review.reviewText: Nice family owned hotel. My only complaint was that the food tray outside the adjoining room remained there for over 36 hours. It became a joke for us. It's still there...
review.locationRemarks: shopping, cable cars

review.title: In the thick of it
review.reviewText: The Handlery Hotel, on Geary half a block west of Powell,  is ideally located for shopping and getting around downtown San Francisco. Since I visited in August, the entire area was crowded with tourists and difficult to navigate or find a quiet place for a meal. I'd have enjoyed my stay more at another time of year.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff members I came into contact with were pleasant and helpful. My room was very clean, attractive and quiet.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Excellent location Central to shops, transport and restaurants. Rooms a bit dark. We moved after complaining about noise from lift and ice machine.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: Air conditioner didn't work, asked hotel staff to come and have a look to try and fix it.. No one turned up. They didn't replace any shampo or conditioner so we had to buy it by ourselves.. When we checked out I asked to speak to the manager to let him know this had happened.. He apologised and said if we didn't book through Expedia he would have given some refund.. He offered breakfast which was nice however we needed to catch a flight. He said he would follow up with the staff members to ensure this doesn't happen again, however I wouldn't recommend this hotel..
review.positiveRemarks: I really liked the location, however wouldn't stay here again. I would look at a different hotel and pay a little bit more.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything, it was very aged. Customer service wasn't great and didn't follow up on promised actions. The cleaners didn't do much either.
review.locationRemarks: Really central and easy access to some amazing shopping centers and cable car.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: Friendly and helpful staff; adequate amenities; great location

review.title: First Trip to San Francisco
review.reviewText: Stayed at The Handlery at the suggestion of a friend. Great location and nice to stay in a historic building downtown. Would have been happier with more amenities within the hotel.

review.title: Pretty fair value for the price (in San Fran)
review.reviewText:
Rooms are clean, reasonably well appointed and the location is great.   Also nice that they have the Daily Grill as their room service / restaurant - they have consistently great food.  Also the wifi is fast and free - which is nice.  

The hotel is a little dated and I had some maintenance issues in my room.  

Biggest complaint is the gym - if you're planning on having a workout you'll need to go around the corner to a proper gym and buy a day pass.  Nothing other than a couple treadmills and elliptical.  No weights.   

Overall it was good - but next time Im in San Fran I'll likely spend a little more and get something a little nicer.
review.negativeRemarks: Gym.  Also, (real nit-picking here)  why is the TV mounted so high up?
review.locationRemarks: Right at Union square - lots of restaurants and shopping.  Easy to get to from the airport with MUNI.

review.title: Nice hotel, great location, staff very friendly.
review.reviewText: Second stay at the Handlery, will return again, can't fault the service & amenities. With WiFi included free you can't beat this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Decor a little tired in some areas.

review.title: Second stay at Handlery
review.reviewText: First stayed with 4 children 14 years ago in original building. This time beside the pool. Was fab.
review.negativeRemarks: Taking luggage from reception to rooms at pool rooms
review.locationRemarks: Everything is walking distance

review.title: very central hotel close to union square
review.reviewText: lovely place to stay. quiet which was excellent as this hotel is right in the heart of San Francisco. room was clean and bathroom had good selection of quality toiletries. excellent restaurant on site too.
review.positiveRemarks: location, high standard of facilities, restaurant
review.locationRemarks: very central - easy walk to cablecars which gave access to whole city

review.title: Nice hotel, good location
review.reviewText: We only stayed one nt. No real complaints. We had one of the larger upgraded rooms. No view except into the window of the apt complex next door. The beds were very comfortable and it was very roomie. Not a fancy luxury hotel by any means but it met our needs.

review.title: Good location and very convenient.
review.reviewText: Great location right near cable cars and humming city centre - just avoid any travel through nearby Tenderloin area - very unsafe. Staff were great - Hermie was the nicest concierge I've ever met. Room tiny but well kept and serviced - fridge to store own food a plus. Overall a good stay for a few days.

review.title: Do not stay here!
review.reviewText: This hotel is located in Union Square, San Francisco.  The location of the hotel is the only thing good about the hotel.  The guest rooms look as if you are staying in the bates motel.  The air vents were blowing out dirty air and the circulation in the room was awful.  I have stayed at hostels nicer than this hotel.  San Francisco is a great city with so much to see and do; don't ruin your trip by staying at this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The only decent thing about this hotel is the location.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel needs to be completely renovated.
review.locationRemarks: There is a ton of shopping in this area!

review.title: Adequate
review.reviewText: The building smelled old. The room was tiny. The view out the window was of other hotel windows. But the price was good, and I guess you get what you pay for.
review.positiveRemarks: You can't beat the location on Union Square.

review.title: Great hotel, fantastic location
review.reviewText: Looked and booked online. Never know what you are going to get but we were very pleased. After a long flight (13 hours) we arrived before check in time but the hotel was very accommodating. Secured our bags, had a lovely cold refreshing drink available, and were able to direct us to a nice relaxing eatery.  The position in Union Square was ideal, close to lots of great restaurants. The staff were very helpful, and the pool was an added bonus. Would highly recommend.
review.positiveRemarks: Room layout, swimming pool, close to Union Square
review.negativeRemarks: Couldn't suggest any improvements
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square. Try the cheesecake shop on the top floor of Macys, fantastic. Just a quick taxi ride to Pier 39, and the Alcatraz tours.

review.title: Two different experiences.
review.reviewText:
We stayed 4 nights in a very nice room adjacent to the swimming pool. The room was well appointed and spacious which was in line with what we had paid for and expected. 
We spent one night away from the hotel and returned for another night. The room we were allocated was on the 8th floor, extremely small and uncomfortable  with chicken wire on the window and a very inconvenient bathroom setup- the hand basin was in the bedroom and not close to the toilet facilities.
We  paid what we believe  was excessive for this room.
I spoke to the Manager next day and she told me we should have requested a better room!!
The Concierge staff were excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: See above

review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is quite convenient, the price is relative cheaper than other hotels nearby. It is a real historical hotel.

review.title: BIRTHDAY CELEBRATION
review.reviewText: Great location to great restaurants and shopping. Pool at hotel a perk. Very quiet rooms for sleeping.
review.positiveRemarks: location close to everything we enjoy doing
review.negativeRemarks: new bed
review.locationRemarks: union square. shopping, close to cable cars and buses. great restaurants

review.title: Nice Hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText:
We checked in very early(9:30 am) and were happy to find we could get a room. The room was clean and comfortable but was less than ideal. The windows were "frosted" to prevent seeing out and there was a reason. The view was of a small roof top area and plumbing. We could have requested another room and I think it would have happened once one became available.  They did accommodate my early check in so I took what they had. I didn't come to San Francisco on vacation to stay in my room.
The staff was excellent, the hotel very nice and located close to everything. Ask about your rooms location and you will have an wonderful stay.

review.title: Nice Hotel but too close to tenderloin district
review.reviewText: The stay at the hotel was comfortable. This area, sadly to say, has a high homeless population and we were approached numerous times for money. Should you stay here, walking left out the door leads to an area called "the tenderloin district" but to the right there is good shopping and a park that often has art shows etc.
review.positiveRemarks: Very good restaurant in hotel, Daily Grind
review.negativeRemarks: Air condition
review.locationRemarks: Good shopping and a park near hotel.

review.title: Hotel with not good experience
review.reviewText:
This hotel is center of union squre and that is the only merit about this place.
Cleanliness of our room is excellent but i had to turn on the tv all nighrt long because I could hear every single movement of footsteps from upper room. I've rather had the tv on than being paranoid by where the upper visitor would move his step to.
Talking about its staffs:
They are not friendly at all from the valet attendance to front dest attences, and to the concierge ..
They were all taking their job in such a careless manner and making the image of this hotel as one star hotel.
I will not stay at this hotel again and wont recommend this place to my friends or family.

review.title: Nice hotel inthemiddle of union square
review.reviewText: Hotel staff were very helpful with everything we requested.
Hotel stuff are very helpful,  nice location, in the center of the city.

review.title: Excellent location--central
review.reviewText: Friendly staff, comfortable room, central location, convenient for cable car line, shopping, restaurants
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, Macy's, Saks, shopping mall nearby

review.title: No complaints at all
review.reviewText: Great location, very friendly staff, room was clean, comfortable and surprisingly quiet for being in such a busy area of SF

review.title: The hotel was very clean
review.reviewText: Great location however were disappointed that our 'standard room' only had a window that we couldn't see out of and couldn't open. Can't remember what star rating it was but in our opinion definitely only a 3. Room Service food was great - huge meal and I only ordered entree size. Pleasant enough to stay in if you don't mind not having any outside view.
review.negativeRemarks: possibly time for new carpet.
review.locationRemarks: Awesome proximity to Union Square, Powell Street and lots of restaurants near by.

review.title: Conveniently located
review.reviewText: Great access to restaurants, public transit, sightseeing tour buses.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The hotel room had been remolded since the last time I had stayed.  Very clean and quiet for being right in Union Square.  Comfortable and decent price.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square is ideal as a starting place to see San Francisco.  Many restaurants, art galleries, shopping, Giants Baseball, and close to everything.

review.reviewText: Quiet hotel. Close to shopping. Would stay there again.

review.title: Great Hotel Downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: We were in San Francisco for a friends bachelor party. The Handlery Hotel provided exactly what we needed, a good hotel right down town. Pleanty of shopping and things to do right near by. Everything else is only a cab or BART ride away.
review.positiveRemarks: One of best locations you could ask for.
review.locationRemarks: Great shopping and food within minutes of the hotel.

review.title: Business Trip to SF
review.reviewText: I liked the hotel a lot.  The concierge was very helpful.   The room was clean and quiet.   The bar/restaurant was a good place to unwind and watch the World Cup.   I still can't believe Portugal scored with less than a minute on the clock.  The hotel is centrally located.   The cable cars, BART to the airport and buses and subways are all near by.
review.negativeRemarks: I would not charge for the internet use of the computers in the business center, most hotels do not.
review.locationRemarks: I think I did this already, but you must take the cable car and hang on the side, really fun.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: My friend and I were having a girls weekend in the city. Handlery was in the perfect location, central to Union Square, blocks to major shopping and an easy walk down to the Ferry Building and Embarcadero. The hotel has been updated, so despite our historic room (the sink was in our room, not in the bathroom), we found we had sufficient space, and everything was clean and quiet. We were turned off by the parking fees (almost $50 per day), and its complicated getting from the parking garage to your room (up elevators, through hallway and outdoor pool area, down stairs, two hallways to second set of elevators and up to room), but that's probably by virtue of the hotels age, and adding on to the hotel.
