I would definitely stay here again. Also, the very very large window to our room, opens ALL the way...very dangerous (it was big enough to throw our bed out the window!) for children especially.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking fees too expensive
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location for shopping, restaurants, site seeing, etc.

review.title: Beware of construction
review.reviewText: On Sunday morning at 5:30 am we were awakened by very loud construction noises coming from an adjacent building across the street from our room. We loved hearing the street noises of the city but were not happy with the hammering, big crashing sounds and beeping of large trucks backing up constantly - especially on a Sunday morning. When I asked about it at the front desk they never apologized, said it must have been an emergency since they never work on Sunday. So please beware that rooms facing the street are subject to construction noises very early in the morning.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms were comfortable and clean and the location was great. Within walking distance from the Curan Theater and in the heart of Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: It would have been nice to have a disclosure of the construction activities.

review.title: Excellent location to Union Square
review.reviewText: All good with exception of hotel dining room. Large queues even for breakfast. Appears to be accessible for street traffic so we actually only had one meal in dining room.

review.title: Nice downtown hotel
review.reviewText: Great location half a block from Union Square shopping and BART station. Staff was very friendly and helpful, room for one was small but very clean and with all the amenities you would want. Area felt safe even in the evenings for a woman walking alone. Restaurant service was speedy, food was good. Would definitely recommend.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: Great hotel in the Union Square area. It was our anniversary and the upgraded us to a suite. Hats off to the bell boy who chased a taxi down, jumped in and made him turn around and pick us up...that's service

photos.caption: My dog Jacho resting peacefully after a 13hr drive from Tucson

review.title: Within walking distance to pier 39& great shops.
review.reviewText: I booked the hotel in last minutes for 2 nights passing by with my dog on our way to Seattle. Very helpful staff. Restaurant was great,

review.title: Very central
review.reviewText: Great location n neat. Also very close to the cable train that travels to the wharf. Definitely recommend this hotel n will stay there again if we travel to San Francisco

review.title: Cozy hotel only steps from Union Square
review.reviewText: Excellent location for visiting San Francisco. Our very first time.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Hotel easy to find, even for a first time visitor to the city. Parking on site although expensive.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to city centre, shopping, transport.
review.negativeRemarks: Room noisy - could do with some double glazing.

review.title: Great overall
review.reviewText: Room was a bit small, especially the bathroom. It's just an old hotel. but the place was clean and the hotel staff were friendly and helpful.

review.title: How can you go wrong?
review.reviewText: A block from Macy's, two blocks from Powell st. BART station and one of the few outdoor pools in downtown San Francisco. The pool is small but heated and welcome after a day of walking up and down hills. The beds are great with excellent linens. The hallways of this hotel aren't picture perfect but I would rather stay here than a chain. The seventh floor was quiet. My major objection was the noisy a/c. Luckily I could turn it off at night because it wasn't that hot but summer might be more difficult. Staff were lovely- restaurant attached to hotel Daily Grill a cut above the usual hotel restaurant. Great for a vacation away.

review.title: Comfortable family Hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText:
The room was as we expected with a queen bed and ensuite. The staff were generally very freindly and helpful. The hotel had some heritage but was very clean, with good amenities.
The Concierge was excellent. Extremely helpful with travel tips for SF.
We tried for a late checkout as our flight was for 9pm. None was available as our room was booked. The hotel stored our luggage all day and allowed us to use the sauna and shower to freshen up and change our clothes that evening before we departed.
Would definitely use the Handlery Hotel again as it was very good value for money.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient to the centre of town and good value.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: 20 metres from Union Square. What more can we say.

review.title: Nice hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText: This is a nice hotel if you want to stay in Union Square, with a slightly lower price point.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the room decor and comfort of the whole hotel
review.negativeRemarks: Adding a hot tub in the pool area.
review.locationRemarks: Starlight Room is a night club that features great views of the city.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel but venalation in restroom not good. Updates to restroom is needed

review.title: Nice, clean, historic hotel
review.reviewText: I stayed for one night on a work trip. As a female traveling alone, I found this hotel to be in a great location. I felt safe walking around the area by myself. You do not need to walk through more shady areas in order to get to the hotel from the main Union Square shopping areas. The hotel is also on a more quiet street, but close to everything Union Square has to offer (shopping, restaurants, bars, etc). The overall hotel was in good condition and of a more traditional style in the lobby but more of a modern twist for the in-room decor. I found the room and bathroom to be a good size in comparison to other hotels in various downtown city locations. The mattress was not the most comfortable and a bit bumpy. They could upgrade the mattresses. Overall, I had a pleasant stay at the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Union Square location (shopping, restaurants, bars, etc.). Tasteful hotel decor. Reasonable room and bathroom size for a downtown city hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Upgraded mattress. Better hairdryer. Some areas around the common hallways could use some paint touch-up.
review.locationRemarks: Ample shopping and dining around the Union Square area. Close to BART and trolley stop. Convenient to get to other areas of San Fran.

review.reviewText: The hotel was clean, had lots of charming atmosphere, and was close to great restaurants and attractions. Our room, however, had no view of anything except the windows of other rooms facing ours. Next time we'll request an outside-facing room.

review.title: Perfectly located in city center near Union Square
review.reviewText: Perfectly located near Union Square with cable car close to explore the city. Hotel is fine and rooms are clean but could use some updating.

review.title: Perfectly located in city center near Union Square
review.reviewText: Perfectly located near Union Square with cable car close to explore the city. Hotel is fine and rooms are clean but could use some updating.
The hotel stay was great. The location was perfect for our needs.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Hotel is in the perfect location right next to union square. Nothing special about the room but it served its purpose as a clean place to sleep. Bed was a little hard though. Overall I would say this is a good place to stay in San Francisco

review.title: Great location and comfortable facility
review.reviewText: Great location and comfortable facility, however the hotel is historic and the bathrooms are not very modern.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to the BART and very central
review.negativeRemarks: updated bathroom

review.title: Nice Hotel.
review.reviewText: Very relaxing and quite once inside your room. Easy to find the location of the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: USB outlets should be provided. Reserved additional pillow from the closet must be ready to use but the cover shows that it was used.
review.locationRemarks: Bars, eateries, Powell street (cable cars), Union Square, SoMa, etc.

review.title: 1 Night in SF
review.reviewText:
This was a quick overnight stay on a USA business trip on return to Australia.
Arrived at 9pm and left at 10am next day.
review.negativeRemarks: Some random loud noise during the night / early morning was a bit annoying and the only negative of the stay. Not sure if it was the hotel though.

review.title: I love this place, BUT
review.reviewText:
My two older kids live in the city.

I lived here years ago.

I've stayed here often.

Tips:

Great haircut downstairs.

Only complaint is lame cable TV. That should be simple, right?

Jeff
review.negativeRemarks: Cable TV

review.title: for the price ...unbeatable in downtown SFO
review.reviewText:
surprisingly good for the price ... I travel a ton and many hotels disappoint. Not so at the Handlery.
Did not get to try the in-house restaurant for breakfast as it was too busy ... a good sign ... and many breakfast spots nearby. Concierge service proved top notch too.
I'll be coming back
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing I can think of

review.title: Great staff
review.reviewText: We were allowed an early check in after flying all night. Our room was upgraded and we were treated very well. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.
review.locationRemarks: Close to good restaurants, shopping and the park at Union Square.

review.title: good hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: Clean, comfortable rooms with very helpful staff in a hotel located right next to Union Square

review.title: Loved it, close to everything.
review.reviewText: Staff was friendly. I wasn't too happy about paying $42 a day for parking, but I later learned that it's normal to pay when you're in San Francisco. Room was roomy and clean.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the location. You're in the middle of everything. We never had to drive anywhere.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel needs no improvement.

review.title: Great location, not great rooms for the money
review.reviewText: I guess with a lace like this you are staying for the location, for the price I paid I would have really liked to at least have the basin in the bathroom, rather than in the bedroom. But it's an old building so I guess it was never going to be perfect. A little noisy, but overall not too bad. Just wish the price was a bit cheaper.
review.negativeRemarks: Upgrade rooms.

review.title: Centrally located hotel
review.reviewText:
Two hotels in one. The historic side has smaller, older rooms. The premier side has rooms larger in size and updated furnishings. The outdoor pool (between the two buildings) is a nice retreat for families with children.
Checking in can be interesting because there is no identified area for unloading your vehicle. Hint, park in front of the doors, but watch the parking signs to avoid any tickets.
If you have a vehicle, parking is at the back of the building.
Also interesting is that they do not bring your car around. So, if you are in the historic building, you have to haul your stuff over to the premier building and down to the parking garage. Or, you can have the concierge hold it for you while you pull your vehicle around to the lobby of the hotel.
Nice hotel, just lacked the WOW factor . . . service is not #1 in their motto.
review.positiveRemarks: The premier side of the hotel is very nice. Up-to-date, roomy, comfortable beds and furnishings. The balcony is a nice touch.
review.negativeRemarks: I found it interesting that the hotel required a fee for internet access in their business area and printing off boarding passes.
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located to shopping, restaurants, buses, and trolly.

review.title: Great location but ask for one of the NEW rooms
review.reviewText:
Had a group with five rooms. The old rooms in the historic section of the hotel were okay and clean, no view. Some of the group got rooms in the "premier" section that had been completely remodeled. Those were much bigger, nicer and had views of the street and its shops and restaurants. They may have had more street noise but the rooms were so much nicer that I would have preferred to be there. We all paid the same rate.

The Daily Grill had really good food, good wine list, good service, and prices weren't bad considering the high quality of the food and service.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, nice rooms in premier section, good Daily Grill restaurant
review.negativeRemarks: Old/historic rooms need something to make them more appealing that could include something unique in decor and/or lower rates
review.locationRemarks: Wonderful location walking distance to Union Square, Macys, Bulgaria, & great shopping. Hop On Hop Off buses right there. Dozens of restaurants.

review.reviewText: Simple room for an expensive nightly rate. I was hoping for something a little more cosier but these seem pretty basic. I hope they'd include black-out curtains specially when they know their room is considerably brighter. Overall pretty basic, the Restaurant/Grill attached was lovely. The staff members were very friendly. Great location if you like shopping, you're right on Union Square.

review.title: Really expensive for the level of hotel
review.reviewText: It was nice and close to Union Square, the rooms were a bit noisy, old hotel, chicken wire on sealed shut windows, poor views, limited wheelchair access from the parking lot, should have included breakfast, coffee in room awful, not my best hotel stay for $399 plus parking at $42 per night!!!
review.negativeRemarks: read above
review.locationRemarks: Union Square

review.title: Handlery Hotel
review.reviewText: Personal at the front desk not always in the best disposition.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: A good hotel in a great location. Excellent concierge services, very pleasant staff.

review.title: A mixed experience
review.reviewText:
Location: excellent
Room size, condition, facilities: very good
Staff: generally pleasant

Downsides:
Food poisoning at the restaurant
Multiple early morning interruptions from housekeeping despite 'do not disturb' signs
Hotel lobby music playing very loudly from a speaker just outside our room (woke me up at 4AM, called lobby, music did not stop until I went down to lobby at 6AM).

Overall, this hotel has all the making of a great place to stay. Unfortunately, a few mistakes made our stay less enjoyable.

review.title: Great hotel. Easy location to get around
review.reviewText:
We had a great stay at the Handlery. Upon check in we received complimentary room upgrade and champagne to celebrate our honeymoon. The staff were always helpful with our questions.

Thank you Handlery!

review.title: Hotel is centrally located near main shopping area
review.reviewText: Handy to cafes, restaurants, cable car, and Union Square. Good value for money with sympathetic staff.
review.positiveRemarks: Good value for money, staff address any issues you may have quickly and efficviently
review.negativeRemarks: Some beds in small standrad rooms can be uncomfortable, and rooms lit by internal windows. Bit on the small side

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location. Surprisingly quiet. Old hotel with VERY worn furnishings (and we were in the "new"part). Comfortable beds and pillows. Very friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: We stayed in what was considered the "new" part, but it seemed very old and worn. The rooms could definitely use some updating.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square - endless possibilities. Close to all public transportation providing access to the entire city.

review.title: Great central hotel
review.reviewText: So much to see and do in SF and this central hotel allowed us easy access. Close to cable cars and buses. In the theatre district.
review.locationRemarks: Walked to Ferry Building, saw a play, bused to Golden Gate, de young and science museum.

review.title: Handlery Union Square
review.reviewText: We enjoyed the hotel and San Francisco. The rides on the cable car were fantastic. The location was in the centre of town, so good. The room was done every day for us. There was a 24 hour dinner up on the corner with the best breakfast. Absolutely outstanding.
review.locationRemarks: By union square and next to cable cars. Macey's near by.

review.title: We love this place!
review.reviewText: We have stayed here several times and find the staff very friendly and the place very comfortable and inviting! We love it.
review.positiveRemarks: The location, the staff and the room.
review.locationRemarks: You are in the middle of Union Square, dare I say more? It is wonderful.

review.title: Too bad from A to Z
review.reviewText:
Every things in this hotel are bad .it was the worst hotel I've ever been
The only best thing in this hotel the area , it's close to union square

review.title: Perfect location central to all of Union Square
review.reviewText: Perfect location right in the Heart of Union Square and all the popular shopping stores, restaurants and diners. The Powell St. train station and the trams were only a 5 minute walk away, which allowed us to see more of San Fran with less of the traffic fuss. The room facilities were a little bit dated, but I suppose this added to the character of the hotel. We stayed in a 2 double bed room and it was a little bit smaller than we expected, however it catered to us nicely and the cleaning staff were very friendly and helpful. If you're not looking for a fancy fare over the top hotel, and just need somewhere decent to crash yet still be in the thick of all the bravado of Union Square, then the Handlery Union Square Hotel is perfect for you!
review.negativeRemarks: The elevators need an overhaul, we were on the 5th floor, we ended up using the stairs most days. Install in some noise proof curtains or windows.
review.locationRemarks: Everything you needed is all within walking distance, even AT&T Park was a 25 - 30 minute walk to watch a Baseball game. Perfect location.

review.title: April 26th
review.reviewText: It was a nice hotel, the room did not have a nice view; we stayed in 308. When we first walked in, the place was fancy so that was cool. They charged my boyfriend a $50 deposit fee in case we ate anything which I found very annoying but if that was the worst that happened, it was not that bad.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were chill and professional.
review.negativeRemarks: The room set up. The queen sized bed was stuffed into this small little kid's bedroom. The tv wasn't facing the bed but the door which I've never seen
review.locationRemarks: It was literally right on Union Square on Geary and Powell. Shopping, bars, clubs, eateries, Westfield, the city Target, and the muni/bart station.

review.title: It was not worth what i had paid,
review.reviewText: I had very bad experience with expedia this time as i book the hotel after the payment done there was no option to cancel,first i have seen the the charges 169 and after booking copletion it reached to 250$ and also not not refundable which is not fair,i called expedia on phone and reply was that this is a vacation package so if i cancel no refund,non sense.
review.negativeRemarks: no comments
review.locationRemarks: good

review.title: Close to everything
review.reviewText: Very close to Union Square, shops and restaurants. Everything is within walking distance. Took bus #30 (bus stop right around the corner) to the Giants game. Some confusion on where to park our car when we checked in. But an overall good experience.

review.title: Hotel great! Beds horroble
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel was awesome. The hotel inside, beautiful. The beds were pretty used up. Not comfortable at all. When you sat on them they sagged. Like they are as old as my grandparents. That is a pretty important part of a hotel stay. Might think to invest in better mattresses.
review.negativeRemarks: Beds

review.title: Squeaky floorboards was very annoying
review.reviewText:
3 nights stay.
Did have to walk the streets looking for resturants
Walgreens close by which was great for breakfast and lunches
review.positiveRemarks: Central location Did like (although I didn't need) that they had ear plugs on the bedside table A safe in the room
review.negativeRemarks: Older style hotel, was good. Should have had brochures available for tourists, rather than just a map.

review.title: Great quiet hotel.
review.reviewText: Very accommodating staff. Good clean and super quiet since it was so close to Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: No complaints, would stay there again.
review.locationRemarks: Right by Union Square. Great shopping.

review.title: This hotel is due for an update
review.reviewText: This was probably a very nice hotel in its day but is now worn and tired. The ventilation system was so noisy I had to turn it off and then there was no air in the room...

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: We loved the location of this hotel. Within walking distance to a lot of activities. We enjoy cities so we didn't mind the thin windows but some people might. The balcony was great. The housekeeping staff were wonderful. The beds were not very comfortable Overall we got a great deal from Expedia so we thought the value was good but wouldn't stay again unless the price is right.

review.title: Union Square
review.reviewText: Easy check in, great view, comfy bed, lots to do super close!

review.title: Union Square
review.reviewText: Easy check in, great view, comfy bed, lots to do super close!

review.title: Perfect location and accessibility to public trans
review.reviewText: I picked this hotel based on location and other reviews. I wasn't disappointed. It's in the heart of Union Square and close to all the greatest shopping and restaurants. The staff were congenial, not overly friendly, but they get their job done. I don't need warm and fuzzy just get me checked in and on my way. The room service was expeditious and the food was pretty good. The Daily Grill next door is a cute little bistro type place and the servers and staff were all very nice. I will definitely stay here again. I even saw Mr Handelry himself.....twice.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, comfy room with a view, easy access from the front or the back of the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Check in was delayed by an hour. Not sure why.
review.locationRemarks: Shop till you drop and eat till you bust. Oh, and catch the cable car, BART, and/ or any other form of public transit within a few blocks of the hotel

review.title: Central hotel close to shops and trams
review.reviewText:
Central hotel close to shops, trams and plenty places to eat. Lefty o.doul,s and Johnny Foleys good places to eat and relax.

Rooms are good and a small but adequate gym in the premises. An outdoor swimming pool which is nice is also on the premises.
review.positiveRemarks: Location in Union Square is superb.
review.negativeRemarks: Less pushy bell staff.
review.locationRemarks: In the centre of Union Square. Trams, shops and resteraunts all around the hotel.

review.title: great Hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText: We had 4 girls in the room and there was plenty of room to get ready.Extra mirrors, good counter space and 2 full length mirrors. Overall a really nice room. It was a premiere queen room. I would stay here again

review.title: Close to Union Square-clean, quiet, well priced
review.reviewText:
Friendly and helpful staff - QUIET rooms unlike other "boutique" hotels that have paper-thin walls
Walking distance to many sights - to trolley line across town
Heated Pool - Sauna were very

Recommend it for sure!

review.title: Meh
review.reviewText: The staff was nice, and the location is excellent, but this is not a cheap hotel and I don't feel that it was worth the money. The room was small, sheets seemed clean, though scratchy. The bathroom was tiny, small shower stall, no tub. I was in the "Historical building", the hallways and my room smelled musty. The mattress was one of the worst I've ever had to sleep on, worse than a cot or a pull out couch. For the price of this room I could have done much better, I would NOT stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Musty smell of room and hallways, awful mattress, scratchy sheets

review.title: Great location and staff
review.reviewText:
I really enjoyed my stay at Handlery Hotel. It is a great location in Union Square.
I will definetely stay there again.

review.title: very nice
review.reviewText: amazing stay will return soon everything was perfect

review.title: Nice hotel for business or pleasure
review.reviewText: Convenient location and quick access to restaurants, shops, coffee, whatever you need ...

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great place being right by Union Square. It is an easy walk to the convention center and many excellent restaurants.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms are small, bathroom had a lot of mold, room wasn't very clean. Room hadn't seen a remodel in a very long time.
review.locationRemarks: Union square (shopping). Chinatown, convention center, cable cars. only ~30 mins to walk to the ocean. Recommend Bouche for fine French cuisine.

review.title: Good location but drab hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is very centrally located, but the hotel was disappointing. The room was very small and dark. The hotel is very dull and drab.
review.negativeRemarks: In need of a refurb

review.title: hotel in Union Square, S.F.
review.reviewText: We felt that the room was minimal...barely space to move in the bathroom...overpriced for the size of the room. The restaurant, Daily Grill, was ridiculously overpriced.
review.negativeRemarks: Move toilet away from bathroom counter. Provide more electrical outlets.
review.locationRemarks: Good location; close to everything. Lefty O'Douls is next door - a real winner.

review.title: Not worth the price
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is very good and it is very convenient to get from the airport via BART to the hotel. There are two separate buildings which make up the hotel. I imagine the new wing is nicer than the old, but the price is the same. My room was very small and looked out on a light shaft. The bed purported to be a queen, but seemed to be an old fashioned double bed. The heating unit was in the ceiling and was noisey. I thought it was entirely too expensive for what I received.

review.title: A stunning view to wake up to in the city
review.reviewText:
My brother and I who are UK / Hong Kong based took a trip from Vancouver to San Francisco, stopping en route. Having never been to San Fran before, I knew nothing of the city and hence followed the hotel reviews on line. I booked The Handlery and we weren't disappointed.
We specifically wanted to be in the heart of the city near Union Square and as I don't like being hemmed in I love balconies. Upon arrival the rooms were without balconies and when I mentioned to the reception that I liked them , The manager came across and said as it was our first visit to the city he would give us rooms with balconies on a higher floor with no extra charge. I felt that to be a most warm welcome! The rooms were spacious, well kept, clean with a hint a regency. THE VIEW WAS SPECTACULAR! I awoke each morning to brilliant sunshine piercing through the glass cascade of San Francisco, clad in my warm, soft Hadlery robe, enjoying my Earl Grey tea from the balcony. Perfect!
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were the hotel's crowning jewel. There was nothing they would not do and I felt comfortable to ask for assistance. So friendly and helpful
review.locationRemarks: The Hotel is located in San Fran's busy downtown district, just off Union Square. There are shops, restaurants, tram ways and sight seeing

review.title: Close to Union Square
review.reviewText: It was nice and close to Union Square which was handy to catch a bus tour and the trolly cars.

review.title: Good central location
review.reviewText: Convenient location close to everything, including shopping. Knowledgable and helpful staff. Room was a bit small. Would stay there again.

review.title: Solid hotel close to union square
review.reviewText:
This hotel is a nice option for those staying near union square. The price was reasonable for the area, they have a nice pool (warm enough to swim in mid-march), and the room had everything we needed. We had no problems staying here.

The only surprise was the parking fee - watch out for it! After researching I found that it's not abnormal for the area, but be sure to take it into account if you are driving

review.title: Hotel staff is very pleasant; room was very small
review.reviewText: Hotel is very dated and the room was very small. Bathroom window didn't close so there was a constant breeze and the street noise was overwhelming. Staff was very pleasant and the hotel is in a good location.
review.negativeRemarks: The quality of the room furnishings and the cleaning staff.
review.locationRemarks: Everything to do is nearby! Shopping, nightlife, easy access to transportation.

review.title: Way too Expensive for Nothing
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel is not bad, but everything is super, super expensive. For $400 a night, I thought I would at least have internet that works in my room. The place was clean, but that is the only nice thing I can say for it. To use the hotel's computers was $5 to log on and $.25 a minute afterwards. No breakfast was included, not even a coffee. I stayed at this place because I read it was a family owned hotel. The room was tiny, as in barely enough space to move around the beds. There was no cell reception in the hotel for T Mobile or Verizon (not sure about AT&T or Sprint). Right outside, everything worked fine. There are 2 elevators in the hotel. They are both tiny, and only one was working while I stayed there. I would summarize my stay as a total waste of money for nothing. There was nothing particularly nice about the place, and frankly, I do not know how they are still in business. There are far nicer hotels in this area for significantly less money. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.
review.negativeRemarks: They should have a more customer friendly environment. Do not charge for everything, and offer guests a cup of coffee in the morning.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square, not far from the Moscone Center

review.title: San Francisco vacation
review.reviewText:
The Handlery is a historic hotel, but it is very tired and needs a lot of tender loving care. Our experience started with the front desk where the staff appeared to be annoyed by our arrival, as if it was an inconvenience to serve us. They were abrupt and not helpful.
The room was small, and the bathroom was inconvenient for one and impossible for two. The grouting in the tub/shower was badly in need of replacement. The noise from the street at night was unbelievable, and the windows appeared to be single pane, so it was if the party was directly outside your window on the fire escape. We did expect some noise as we were in the downtown area, but it was far more than anticipated and kept us awake every night of our stay.
For the price that we paid for each night we stayed there (yes, I know we paid a lot for location), we would have expected for eg., a robe, slippers, a coffee/muffin for breakfast etc.
We had been looking forward to this mini vacation, and the hotel was a major disappointment. We will not be returning..
review.positiveRemarks: The location---close to downtown and the cable car.
review.negativeRemarks: The service from the point of entry to the exit from the hotel upon departure. We would like to see some amenities added (robes, slippers, for eg.).
review.locationRemarks: Location great. Close to cable car stops, shops, some good restaurants, art galleries.

review.title: The window make me feel bad
review.reviewText: I do not want to choose this hotel again, every morning , the sun make me wake up, but I want to keep sleep!

review.title: Not sure where these positive reviews have come fr
review.reviewText: I was expecting good things having read the reviews but pretty shocked when I arrived to see what I had checked into. Poky room with no real view and little natural light, dust all over the pedestal, a dripping shower, a dripping air conditioner and not the nicest bathroom amenities I've ever seen! I did ask to move on the first day but was told this would not be possible as it was an Expedia rate and I would have to pay more to move. Charming.
review.locationRemarks: The only good thing about this hotel is the location - could not have asked for better.

review.title: Perfect lication
review.reviewText: The hotel is steps away from several public transportation and to many restaurants (some 24 hours) and pharmacies (at least one 24 hours). The staff is very helpful and eager to answer questions and circle maps.

review.title: Good location for Union Square
review.reviewText: Hotel is very close to tram stops and union square. It is excellent for shopping. Rooms are a little bit dated but well suited to the price range. The restaurant is also very nice.

review.title: Nice hotel in downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: Overall, this is a really nice hotel. Its heated swimming pool is nice without efficient supporting facilities. We would certainly be glad to go back to this hotel. Its parking daily fee is rather expensive, but we understand it.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText:
We had a wonderful time at the Handerly. The room was great and the staff were excellent. The only shortcoming was the amount of water coming out of the shower, but considering the water shortage in California I can certainly understand that.

Thanks for a great stay and the great weather.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Best location in the city

review.title: Excellent Location, very nice hotel, easy parking
review.reviewText: Just stayed two nights, but excellent service from hotel staff, clean room, had an infant grandson and his parents with us and the cleaning staff went out of theri way to tidy up and clean the babies travel crib (ours)...just a nice touch
review.negativeRemarks: One elevator was a bit wiggy but all in all great hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Very near Union Square, close to shopping, dining, downtown, etc.

review.title: business center drawback
review.reviewText: The only drawback at this hotel is the charges incurred to use the business center. They are ridiculously high. I spent less than 10 minutes total on the computer, printed a couple of pages and got a $38 bill.
review.positiveRemarks: Good price, location excellent for my purposes
review.negativeRemarks: business center costs

review.title: Sf beer week
review.reviewText: It was a good trip. Hotel was at a great location for this visit. The conceirge was very helpf and all staff were polite and friendly. Weather was great and beer week was wonderful. This survey is asking for more info and i can fluff it up but i believe being concise is better. Still asking for more review...um walking distance to cable cars and streetcars. Best bet with heavy traffic is a cab. The cabbies were very knowledgable.

review.title: Great place to stay!
review.reviewText: I usually stay at an expensive hotel but due to rooms sold out I ended up at the Handlery. I loved it and will stay there again. It is an older building but super clean, great location and friendly staff. Marvelous restaurant too. Don't hesitate to stay here.

review.title: Very Nice Stay
review.reviewText: Our stay was great. The staff were always friendly and smiling. They have complimentary hot chocolate every day in the lobby and wine tasting daily. Just the little extras that make your stay feel special.

review.title: Good location, great staff
review.reviewText: Room is a bit noisy from outside sources. Hotel was very clean. Parking and taxes are very expensive
review.negativeRemarks: Noise reduction would be good
review.locationRemarks: Good walking distance to Moscone center and right next to Union square

review.title: Overall good Hotel
review.reviewText:
Room was good, although the flooring was old and creaked a lot as I walked about the room - that was somewhat irritating and I wondered if the noise transmitted to other rooms. Modern, nice bathroom.

Do not eat at the hotel restaurant, especially for breakfast - expensive and food was not flavorful.

review.title: Good location but room old
review.reviewText: Location was excellent but the room that I was in was small and needed updating. I had to move to another room but it was stil. Th same size as no other was offered. Staff were all pleasing but due to the room conditions, I would not return
review.negativeRemarks: Improve the rooms - the historic rooms mean old
review.locationRemarks: Cable cars are one block away and all main shops are on the door step!!

review.title: Good Accommodations for the Price
review.reviewText: Considering how expensive some of the hotels in the area are, the Handlery is a nice, affordable option. My room was not large, but it was quite sufficient for staying by myself. The staff were friendly and very helpful. The adjacent Daily Grill had good food as well. I found the accommodations were clean and well worth the price.

review.title: CANT BEAT THE LOCATION IN SAN FRAN...
review.reviewText: Comfortable, clean rooms and great value. Great location relative to Union Sq, Shopping, Art Galleries, Cable Cars and Theater district of San Fran.
review.locationRemarks: see above

review.title: Proximity to union square
review.reviewText: Room looked very tired. Could hear neighbors didn't smell nice. Not worth what I paid

review.title: Great location but a little worn
review.reviewText: Our family of 3 adults stayed in the Premier building in a premier room with 2 queen sized beds. The beds were very comfortable and the pillows to our liking. We had a large vanity area which was helpful for 2 women getting dressed, the only feature lacking was a towel bar for hand towels. We ended up putting the towels over the wall mounted magnifying mirror. Thank you for having 2 makeup mirrors in the room!!! The problem with the room was the really bad odor, which I can only describe as stinky shoes and socks, but perhaps dog?! This seems to be a common complaint at The Handlery. We did go out and purchase a room deodorizer, which coupled with opening the sliding door for periods of time helped a bit. Also we needed to use an extra blanket one night and the one provided in the room was horrible. It was a very old microfiber blanket which stuck together and we could not unfold it. Fortunately we all had bathrobes which we wrapped up in. The location is superb and with some really good refurbishing this hotel could be excellent. The staff very nice.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable beds, pretty quiet, good water pressure in the shower. make up mirrors
review.negativeRemarks: room to smell fresher, extra pillows/blankets should be fresh and new. this room has 2 queen beds, so extra 2 blankets and 2 pillows are needed.
review.locationRemarks: The city of SF is right out your door as well as transportation to the entire city

review.title: Great location, helpful staff, smallish rooms
review.reviewText:
I have stayed at this hotel before, and was happy to return to it. Its location is almost unbeatable - close to BART, cable car and Union Square.
The staff are extremely helpful and courteous. The restaurant, (the Daily Grill), while not cheap, is good. Fitness centre is very small and basic, but fine for a short stay.
The room was spotless; if I had any complaint to make, it was that the basic room with two queen beds was quite small. While I don't need a lot of room, this really didn't even have much room for more than one suitcase. The bathroom could have done with an exhaust fan. These are, however, small quibbles, because we don't usually spend a lot of time in our room.
Overall, a pleasant place in a super convenient location.
review.negativeRemarks: As above - the room was very small, nowhere much to sit except on beds, and
review.locationRemarks: Great for transport - buses, BART, cable cars; Macy's; lots of restaurants, shopping, small art galleries etc.

review.title: n/a
review.reviewText: The staff were helpful, the hotel was clean and they let us check in early!
review.negativeRemarks: larger rooms
review.locationRemarks: union square, walking to shopping, restaurants, china town, cable car

review.title: New Years!
review.reviewText: I love staying at the Handerly. It's near Union Square and has a convenient parking garage. The rooms are always clean and comfy. I highly recommend to stay!

review.title: Good Value Near Union Square
review.reviewText: We had a very comfortable stay in a lovely, quiet room. The concierge was very helpful. Location is terrific. We enjoyed the holiday decorations and bargain shopping around Union Square.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, décor, room size, HDTV, large bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square area includes great shopping and restaurants.

review.title: SUPER LOCATION
review.reviewText: A couple of steps to Union Square. The Powell-Mason street car stop just up the street and a cab ride costs just $10 to Fisherman's Warf. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful suggesting good places to eat and not to miss tourist spots. Our family will definitely stay here again!
review.negativeRemarks: The building is older. Rooms are clean but bring your travel size Febreze if you have a sensitive nose.
review.locationRemarks: This is a perfectly central location to everything tourists love about San Francisco

review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Staff was really helpful and friendly. In a great location. The bad thing was that there is a $42 parking charge, even if you're only staying one night plus another $6 parking fee. And the bathroom was tiny. Other wise the hotel was fine.

review.title: Dog friendly, comfortable hotel in downtown SF
review.reviewText: The only drawback with this hotel is the lack of view from the bottom 6 floors. Rooms surrounding the pool area are also surrounded by thoroughfares for other guests. We got 3 premier double queens to accommodate our 12 member family. We were not relying on having a view of the City so did not concern us, but the traffic on the floors during the New Year's Celebration could get a bit bothersome. Checking in and out was easy and swift. However one of the rooms next to both the others was overlooked by housekeeping and was cleaned late. No bother as we could congregate in the other rooms. There are a multitude of restaurants within a 2 block area to choose from with all the variety you need...from breakfast, lunch and dinner. Short 3 block walk to cable car on Market and across the street on market, plenty of shopping opportunities at the Westfield Mall and other independent stores. I used the K9 Playtime business located on Brannan Road to keep my dog during the day so he was kept happy while we enjoyed the sites and shopping. Rates were fair.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, location, location. Staff was very helpful and garage personnel were very pleasant.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect downtown location for catching the cable car and walking to shopping or even IMAX nearby.

review.title: Great location, small rooms
review.reviewText: Can't beat the location. Nice staff and good breakfast too. Rooms are super small though so brace yourself for being in a great location but in a very small room with a queen bed.

review.title: Great Location, Clean Hotel
review.reviewText: Have stayed at this establishment many times. Always very clean with friendly staff. Great location with a lot within walking distance. I would highly recommend this hotel!
review.positiveRemarks: Location, Location, Location, Clean, Great Staff
review.negativeRemarks: Can not think of anything
review.locationRemarks: Great location right off Union Square and next to Lefty O'Douls; can catch the Cable Car to the Wharf or walk to China Town

review.title: Decent hotel in prime location
review.reviewText: Everything about the actual hotel was fine but it was loud. I was there to enjoy the city and get a full rest at night (away from kids). I very much enjoyed the city with the convenience of the hotel's location, but I did not get ANY rest. The walls were thin and the crowds poured through the hallways (loudly) at all hours of the night.

review.positiveRemarks: Been staying here for almost 30 years. The convenience of driving into the parking area, location of Union Square and cable cars, ambiance.
review.locationRemarks: All the shopping at Union Square; Macy's, Bloomingdales, etc; cable cars; restaurants

review.title: We enjoyed our stay at the Handlery
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful 2 days at the Handlery, the hotel is central to everything and all the staff from management, front desk and cleaners were all friendly and very helpful. We stayed in a room that had 2 queen beds, they were very comfortable and the room was big for 4 persons in one room. We would definitely recommend this hotel to our family and friends. Thank you to the Handlery for making our stay so lovely.
review.positiveRemarks: We liked the fact that this hotel was in the center of everything. The room we stayed in was big and at the back of the hotel and very quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing, we thought this hotel was great
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is right on Union Square and central to everything in San Francisco

review.title: Convenient for my purpose
review.reviewText: For the business I had and its location, the hotel was convenient and the front staff was courteous. However, during the first day, the heating system in the room failed and I notified the front desk, who said they would take care of it the next day. However, their "remedy" for my remaining time was to simply put a noisy space heater in the room and to then offer an apology when I checked out.
review.positiveRemarks: It was convenient for my business purposes.
review.negativeRemarks: They most certainly need to be more accommodating to the needs of the guests.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel was near to Union Square which made it convenient to various restaurants, etc.

review.title: Surprise Gem near Union Square
review.reviewText: I was fairly surprised that the Handlery was as nice and welcoming as it was. There's lots of sub-standard hotels with cheap rates near Union Square that have great lobbies but terrible rooms. These guys had a modest lobby area with rooms that were comfortable and reasonably appointed. I would recommend if staying in the area that you check these guys out. You'll get a very decent room at a reasonable price in a great location. I'll be back to visit them for sure.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice, clean, great location, great price.

review.title: For the value
review.reviewText: For the location and price it's a value. Bed was too small for a queen.

review.title: Wonderful customer service hotel
review.reviewText: My husband and I really enjoy staying at this hotel when we go to San Francisco. The rooms are small, but very nicely appointed and very clean. We had complimentary wi-fi for a day, which was very good. Don't know what it costs otherwise. This particular trip the bed was a little soft for me and we experienced some early morning noise right outside our door from housekeeping that was a little annoying, but the staff is so nice, the rooms are very clean, and the location can't be beat. It is only half a block off Union Square, but the beauty is that it is on Geary, so you miss all the cable car and actual Square tourist foot traffic that is on Powell. The onsite restaurant is convenient and good also. Not gourmet by San Francisco standards, but good with great staff in the restaurant and the bar. Finally, this trip I inadvertently left a necklace of sentimental value at the hotel. I called much later that day to see if anyone had found it, and the wonderful woman in housekeeping ran right up to the room to retrieve it. The necklace was returned to me via priority mail a couple of days later. I am so grateful! We will definitely stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: We had a too soft bed that we wish had been better.
review.locationRemarks: Half a block from Union Square--Macy's, Saks, Tiffany's, DSW, lots of restaurants of all types and prices within walking distance, BART, busses.

review.title: Close to union square!
review.reviewText: Front desk staff was gracious and helpful..we were in the old part of hotel, rooms nice, but much easier to navigate.. Great! Bellhops were also very helpful. We parked at Stockton/Sutter garage, cheaper, and walked down to hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms were nice, elevators very quick, ice machine handy, and FREE bottles of water!
review.negativeRemarks: Can't think of a thing.
review.locationRemarks: Wonderful location..close to Union Square, Cable cars, macys! lots of great restaurants, in the middle of SF!

review.reviewText: We wanted a quaint hotel with all the modern comforts - and we got it! Great stay, great service, very comfortable and super convenient.

review.title: A little old but nice hotel close to union square
review.reviewText: The hotel is really close to union square perfect to stay in SF. Is a little old but is very clean and the beds are really confortables.
review.positiveRemarks: the hotel is very clean and the beds are really confortables
review.negativeRemarks: the hotel is a little old
review.locationRemarks: close to union square and is perfect for shopping. close to a lot of stores, cable car and is easy to go to many other places

review.title: Bathroom counter was small.
review.reviewText: Bathroom counter was small .furniture was modern.
Comfortable, staff lovely, way over-priced, although very convenient

review.title: Travel with Ease
review.reviewText: travelling with a 12 year old and a 18 year on my own could be quite daunting. Especially in a city we have never been in and being on the other side of the globe. But the friendly staff at the Handlery put all my worries at ease and their informative directions were most helpful. We had a short stay but it was action packed and easy.
review.positiveRemarks: The friendly staff, the location, and also the food!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Alcatraz, bike ride over the golden gate bridge, cable car to Pier 39 and back and dinner at a Diner. ALL IN ONE DAY. Amazing

review.title: Sewage backup
review.reviewText:
Sewage Plumbing back-up flooded bathroom but they were quick to fix, so believe its a common problem in this old building. Rooms cramped relative to their rating competitors & room rates. Better options elsewhere for same price we suspect.
Location central city good Sept2013.
review.positiveRemarks: 50 metres from Union Square was good. Rooms quite
review.negativeRemarks: Ensure no toilet flooding
review.locationRemarks: Excellent restaurant - The Cheese Factory - top of Macy's 60 metres away

review.title: Excellent location and a comfortable room
review.negativeRemarks: Some of the common area decore is a little dated
review.locationRemarks: Right in the middle of it with Union Square at the door step and everything that goes with it

review.title: Small, but comfortable
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Handlery for seven nights and overall, it was a good stay. The room was in the historic section of the building and was quite small. There was no dresser and only one chair, which wasn't the most accommodating situation for two people. However, we really didn't spend a lot of time in the room so it wasn't a big deal. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom, while small, worked for just the two of us. It was very nice having the mini fridge in the room as we were able to buy yogurts and milk for our breakfasts and have cold drinks. It was also nice that they gave us two coffees for the coffee maker instead of just one. We were in one of the inside rooms so we looked out at the windows of other rooms, but it was quiet which made it nice for sleeping. The free wireless also worked well. The central location was also nice as we could walk pretty much anywhere.
review.positiveRemarks: Central location, clean and comfortable bed.
review.negativeRemarks: A dresser and second chair in the room.
review.locationRemarks: A lot of shopping, walk to Chinatown, Telegraph Hill, cable cars. We even walked to Fisherman's Wharf, but make sure you wear comfortable shoes.

review.title: ok, I guess...
review.reviewText:
they originally gave a very small, dirty room, with a shower that had zero pressure.
I complained. They immediately switch me for a larger, cleaner room, still no pressure (both on the top floor...) but at least, the room itself was fine.
review.positiveRemarks: location is good. always cabs in front. free wifi.
review.negativeRemarks: nicer rooms.
review.locationRemarks: pretty decent couple of diners 1 block away.

review.title: Perfect location and value for money
review.reviewText:
After having read several reviews, I decided to book this hotel. I was really pleased as the location was ideal for Westfield shopping centre, Big bus tours and other tour pick up points near Union Square.

As for the facilities in the hotel, you get free wifi which is erratic during peak hours due to several business people using the facility but despite this, I was happy as it was free. I asked for a twin bedroom and this was catered for. The room and the toilet/shower were adequate size. You also get a fridge, coffee maker, hairdryer and ironing board. I found a coin-op laundry nearby and the Powel-Hyde and Powell-Mason cable car stops are nearby.

There is a restaurant associated with the hotel but I did not use it.

The reception and housekeeping staff at the hotel were very friendly and attentive. The Concierge and the Bell staff are knowledgeable and helpful. I would stay at this hotel again if I were to visit San Francisco in the future.

Transport wise, you can get Powell-Hyde and Powell-Mason cable car from Market Street which is near Westfield shopping centre. There can be long queues for the Powell-Hyde cable car as it goes to the top of Lombard Street. You can then come down that street on foot and walk down to Fisherman's wharf and get the F street car to Ferry Building Market and onwards to Market street.
review.negativeRemarks: Provision of wired internet
review.locationRemarks: I also did a 2 day bus tour with Deluxe San Francisco tours costing $30 and it covers 4 loops which includes a night tour of the city.

review.title: Close to central San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Able to walk everywhere from here. Trams easily accessible. Big City Bus tour and Alcatraz a must on the to do list, as was The Cheesecake Factory.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Staff were lovely and went out of their way to help make my stay comfortable. Allowed me to check in early after a 14 hour flight and then let me change rooms when I wanted a room with a view. They also moved all my stuff for me including clothes which I had already hung in the wardrobe.
review.locationRemarks: Right in the middle of union square. Close to shopping and public transport and restaurants. Perfect location.

review.title: Great Location but Rooms were disappointing
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a great spot, easy to find by car and perfect for walking the city. Our first night in the hotel wasn't a great room - you couldn't swing a cat in the room. Out of the 12 hotels we stayed in during our road trip this was the worst room in terms of comfort and space. The main issue was that the room faced onto the hotels plant/extract area and there was no sleep at all that first night. I spoke to the lady at the main desk at dawn and she was lovely, very understanding and moved us to another room which was better. We didn't really use any other facility in the hotel except the valet parking which was very handy but a bit expensive.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms facing the plant/extract area
review.locationRemarks: Its right on Union Sq - perfect for everything

review.title: good for near union square
review.reviewText: I like location near union square. I like clean room but parking assistant are worse attitude. Next time I do not parking there.

review.title: Great central location.
review.reviewText: Would definitely go back to this hotel - fabulous location, close to public transport, cables cars, shopping and lots of restaurants. The hotel was clean and the staff very friendly and helpful. The bed was very comfortable and the pillows were just right for us. We requested an upgrade to a premier room in the newer part of the hotel and this was confirmed before we departed on our trip. The Daily Grill restaurant was also very good (and very busy) and would eat there again.
review.positiveRemarks: The location and the friendly staff
review.locationRemarks: Two blocks from Market St and the Westfield Shopping mall. The Cheescake factory was one block away, above Macy's.

review.reviewText: Great location. Comfortable accomodations.
review.locationRemarks: Trolley. Union square. Shopping. Restaurants.

review.title: Nice Location, Old Hotel
review.reviewText: The location is perfect. Union Square is one block up and across the street. Lots of stores and restaurants nearby. The hotel is old and smells of smoke. The bathroom was small but very clean. Perfect if you only need somewhere to leave your bags. If you plan to stay in the room a bit, spend the extra money and do the Westin Market Street. I stayed at the Westin for 4 days and Handlery for one night to save money.
review.negativeRemarks: The carpet needs to be changed throughout the hotel
review.locationRemarks: Everything is nearby. Cable cars, union square, shops, restaurants. Great location

review.title: GREAT LOCATION
review.reviewText: VERY PROFESSIONAL AND FRIENDLY STAFF THAT ARE ALWAYS WELCOMING. THIS IS MY 4TH STAY HERE AND WILL COME BACK.CLOSE TO SHOPPING AND UNION SQUARE ALLOWING THE LUXURY OF TAKING BACK PURCHASES TO THE ROOM AND THEN GOING OUT UNENCUMBERED FOR...MORE SHOPPING.
review.positiveRemarks: LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION...STAFF ARE VERY GOOD AND VERY ACCOMODATING.
review.negativeRemarks: NOTHING
review.locationRemarks: UNION SQ SHOPPING,CHINATOWN AND MY FAV...ROSS!!

review.title: Nice hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText:
Overall the hotel is decent. If driving in with your own car, it isn't easy to get to the front desk. There is no stopping area out front. You have to drive around the block to the back side, park your car and take an elevator and a weird route through different buildings to get to the lobby. There are 2 buildings and it wasn't immediately clear which building had our room. We ended up going up/down 2 different elevators trying to find our room, which required us to carry all our luggage and belongings down a flight of stairs, which was a pain.

Otherwise, the room is fine - nothing special or spectacular. The bathroom was something you would expect in a motel 6. It was clean and comfortable. The cleaning staff clearly doesn't bend down to clean as I found several pieces of garbage within eyeshot just barely under a corner of the dresser.

The staff was fine. Nobody really smiled or seemed happy, but did their job. They seemed to just be going through the motions, forgetting they are in the customer service industry.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was good, if you're interested in being in Union Square. The room was quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: would be nice for the staff to smile and make you feel like they're happy to have you there. Cleaning crew could take it up a notch.
review.locationRemarks: Half block up from Union square. Trolly and shopping right out front door. Great restaurant right next to the hotel. Easy walk to/from ferry bldg

review.title: Excellent location for NWM this past weekend.
review.reviewText: The beds (full) were really small. The room was sufficient and the space was such that the beds could have been larger. I am surprised that they still have full beds in hotels. They are not much bigger than a twin bed and we had 4 adults staying there.
review.negativeRemarks: Bigger beds! and windows that open. Unable to check outside temperature for race day.
review.locationRemarks: The location is perfect. So much to do nearby, but we mostly participated in the NWM.

review.title: A Great stay on Union Square
review.reviewText: I was in San Francisco for a Convention at the Moscone Center. I chose the Handlery based on it's location-near Union Square, walking distance to the Convention Center, and price. I was a bit concerned about a bed bug report from last year on the internet, but that was a non issue for me and others staying there last week. It is an older building, but clean and well maintained. The staff was friendly and helpful. Internet was included. It is located 1/2 block from Union Square on Geary at Powell St. It is 2 blocks to Market St and the BART station and a 12 min walk to the Moscone Center. The location was perfect for me. There was a Daily Grill right next door and many restaurants within walking distance. I had a terrific stay and would return the next time I am in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice sized room, comfortable bed, great staff (and cleaning people), great TV, location and FREE internet.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Good restaurants, shopping and nearby BART station can get you to just about anywhere in the Bay Area.

review.title: Great location , close to union square antransport
review.reviewText: We extended our stay and the reception and back office worked hard to ensure we didn't have to move rooms . Room was huge was a seperate dressing table (marble)

review.title: Location excellent
review.reviewText: We were suitably impressed with the location as explained on web thank you

review.title: Centralised
review.reviewText: Our whole holiday was very nice and the proximaty of the malls, restaurants and transportation provided the convenience to go anywhere you wanted without any problems.
review.positiveRemarks: The Hotel was very clean and the staff were very helpful. The 2 queen size beds in our room were very nice>
review.negativeRemarks: It would be nice if the Hotel could provide drinking water(bottled water) everyday in the room.
review.locationRemarks: The Hotel was centrally located in the entertainment district and it was very easy to move around in theat area.

review.title: Nice hotel, small room
review.reviewText:
Check in and out were very smooth. and the people on the desk were friendly and knowledgeable.I It has been very nicely remodeled and upgraded, but my wife complained that the room was too small. Nonetheless, I thought it was a really attractive place to stay.

Staff explained how to use the cheap and very handy bus service to Balboa Park, which saved us quite a bit of money.
review.positiveRemarks: The remodeled bar and restaurant off the lobby are very attractive, good happy hour.
review.locationRemarks: liked the location of Handlery Square Hotel very much; it is next to the Gaslight district and handy to shopping.

review.title: Vintage style a stones throw from Union Square
review.reviewText: This is a good value functional hotel in a fantastic location. It is also an extremely busy hotel so sometimes there were not enough staff at the front desk to deal with people checking in, and the old lifts takes ages so there can be queues at peak times. Great little wine and cheese bar across the street!

review.title: Great location and comfortable stay !
review.reviewText: We stayed for a week, longer than originally planned but due to our Yosemite trip being cancelled , we stayed an extra 3 nights and the front desk staff were extremely helpful in booking the additional days. They made sure we did not have to move rooms. Wifi is complimentary and the room was spacious . We had a room with 2 queen beds. Very clean and well equipped . Will stay here again if I return for more of San Francisco one day.
review.locationRemarks: Union square

review.title: Breakfast/Dining facilities
review.reviewText: The hotel has about 350 rooms but contracts out the breakfast/dining area whichprobably seats less than 100. As a consequence non residents also use facilities for breakfast. Our experience was that it took a minumum of 15 minutes to get a seat and than about 45 minutes from ordering to receive a basic cereal breakfast. The service for this is appalling we we will not use the hotel again.

review.title: Excellent location half a block from union square
review.reviewText:
Really lovely hotel. Its old and a bit quirky. Room was a good size bed was comfy.
In such a great downtown location.

The air con is REALLY LOUD! & didn't cool the room at all. ( weather was unseasonally warm)

I found the staff at check in extremely rude. No hello or welcome. Didnt offer any conversation and made my mum & I feel very unwelcome. However the bellman was a pleasure and very informative.

review.title: Great Hotel right in the Downtown shopping area.
review.reviewText: Cable Car seconds away, Union Square next door. Great spot. Loved It.
review.locationRemarks: Cable Car seconds away, Union Square next door. Great spot.

review.title: Nice bed chamber. Dated bathrooms. Odd layout.
review.reviewText: Nice bed chamber. Dated bathrooms. Odd layout. Zzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzz

review.title: Close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Great location walking distance to shops, eateries and cable cars. Really comfy beds clean rooms and excellent service
review.locationRemarks: Close to Fisherman's wharf

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
Price is high
Great location
Friendly staff
Internet services is good

review.title: i wouldnt rush back to this hotel
review.reviewText: location is good but rooms are too small, dark and humed. Bathrooms too old

review.title: Good hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: Good hotel to stay one or two nights. prices room are cheaply.The breakfast it was non included in the room price.
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel clean, the bedroom was large with a good great bed. Beautiful bathroom. The staff was very amiable.
review.locationRemarks: it is in the center of SF, near Union Square and departures cable car routes. very easy to visiting downtown from hotel

review.title: 2nd visit was just as comfortable as the 1st.
review.reviewText: I stayed in this hotel about 15 years ago and had a great experience and decided to stay there again. The room was very clean and comfortable. The staff is very friendly.
review.positiveRemarks: The location is great. Rooms are clean and staff is great.
review.negativeRemarks: The tiny elevator makes me claustrophobic but I realize that it's a historic building.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square, Westfield Mall, theaters and the cable cars.

review.title: Hotel Location
review.reviewText: This hotel is idealy situated for access to shopping, restaurants and pubs. It is also ideal for picking up transport to the pier area (Fishermans Wharf) and parks.

review.title: Next door to Union Square.
review.reviewText: Great location two blocks from the BART train stop. Easy to get to from the airport and right in the heart of the shopping district. The hotel is clean, the rooms are nice with good A/C, bed and bathroom. Didn't notice any noise and we had a great sleep each night.
review.positiveRemarks: close to shopping, union square, quiet

review.title: Just OK
review.reviewText:
Hotel is old - Accomodations are old... bed was a FULL for double occupancy.
Hotel worked for what we needed but will look elsewhere when visiting again.
review.negativeRemarks: Update rooms. Very pricey for what you get....
review.locationRemarks: Location was awesome - Union Square. Tons to do around...

review.title: Small room and poor ventilation
review.reviewText: Room didn't cool efficiently and it was uncomfortable through the night.
review.negativeRemarks: Cooling
review.locationRemarks: Shopping

review.title: A lot of money for this experience
review.reviewText: Outdated, staff is mediocre at best. Disappointing.
review.negativeRemarks: Attention to the guest
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This is a centrally located hotel that is in an excellent location. The staff were friendly and helpful and the rooms were clean and comfortable. I would definitely stay here again next time I visit.

review.title: San Fran central location
review.reviewText: Check price 2 days prior to stay for price drop to be able to cancel/rebook. I would have saved $30/day! 1st time tourists. Fantastic location 1 block from Union Square where Hop on-off buses and Cable cars stop. Very good Irish, Japanese, Diner restaurants, Walgreens, H&M, Uniqlo, Macy's within a block of Geary or O'Farrell entrances. 3 blocks uphill on Bush authentic Chinese food at Chopsticks. Appeared to have popular nightspots for young adults with lines out the doors on surrounding blocks. 87 yr old grandmother, 30 yr. old grandson and 57 yr old mother all enjoyed sharing Premium room with 2 queen beds. Safe location with people out and about at all hours so homeless weren't bothersome as in other parts of the city. Suggest 48 hr Hop on-off all 4 loops deal with CitySightseeing. 1st day took Downtown loop to Fisherman's Wharf, caught Red & White boat cruise(excellent), ate at Boudin(great), downtown loop back to hotel, then Night loop(dress warm&sit upstairs!!!). 2nd day Downtown loop to wharf, Golden Gate-Sausalito loop(stayed 1 hr-caught next bus back), Golden Gate Park loop(stayed 1 hr at Conservatory of Flowers and Japanese Tea Garden, each $7 adult/$5 senior-both OK). Repeated night tour sitting upstairs this time, taking later 7pm tour to see the Bay Bridge lights!
review.positiveRemarks: LOCATION, classy, clean and comfortable. Free in room WiFi. Printer in biz center $10 for 20 min +50 cents/page! Fitness room clean, adequate. Pool.
review.negativeRemarks: Lighting in the room. Lacked ceiling lights, only 2 lamps which provided dim lighting. Can't open curtains for daylight with high rises all around.
review.locationRemarks: Tour bus stops, cable cars, dining options, shopping all within 1-3 blocks

review.title: Fast weekend trip
review.reviewText: We had a great time everything was nice. The only thing was we couldn't figure out how to use the thermistat and noticed that the lamps were dusty and we did not have a veiw and the pool closes too early. Other than that we had a great time.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the old fashion charm of the place.
review.negativeRemarks: I think the food at the cafe could be better and the staff can be more friendly!
review.locationRemarks: Location is GREAT!

review.title: Good Position
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a an excellent position, half a block to Union Square and great shopping. Our room was in the older section of the hotel and was a bit on the small side and had a window that looked out onto void that several other rooms looked onto. We could not see what the weather was like unless we went and looked out a hallway window. The pool was nice but the rooms that overlooked it were in the newer section and were more expensive.
review.negativeRemarks: Make the rooms slightly bigger.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square and the major department stores, and the buses and trams.

review.title: Central
review.reviewText: I stayed in Historic Building of the hotel. As a sole traveller it my needs of a basic room.
review.positiveRemarks: It was central to my activities.
review.locationRemarks: Hotel was ver central to downtown & Union Sqare was opposite. Major stores only 5 mins walk - Macy's, Bloomingdales, Saks 5th Avevue, Westfield

review.title: Good Location, OK Hotel
review.reviewText: Good/avg hotel, but location is key.....near cable car, shops, and decent restaurants.

review.title: Disappointed upon check in
review.reviewText: Staff was super!!!! From front desk to bell hop to Concierge. Room was disappointing, extremely small overlooking dark alley & hvac units. Very noisy heard every sound from street. For the price expected a little more. Should be listed as economical hotel and reduce their prices big time. Bathroom was tiny with a rubber bath math in tub-kind of gross & unsanitary. Not sure I would recommend to friends. The best part was the staff was extraordinarily helpful, friendly and courteous. Not one person was rude or not willing to help. Basically Staff is 5 star, Structure & Rooms is 2.5 Stars.
review.negativeRemarks: Update rooms, sound proof or otherwise reduce prices and classify as an economical hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Right in the middle of Union Square by shopping, restaurants, but also near all the night time noise and street musicians - VERY LOUD

review.title: hmmm..
review.reviewText:
the location is perfect but..
something smell in bath room and it's not good.
actually stink.
I moved to other hotel at last day and it was cheaper and cleaner than here.
well. this hotel is not new building. if you want historical building, then you found good one.
review.negativeRemarks: bathroom so bad..
review.locationRemarks: union squere, sephora, nice thai restaurant.

review.title: Noisy in the rooms facing the street
review.reviewText:
I paid alot for my stay (460 for two nights). Much more than I would normally pay. I had a room at the front on the 3rd floor facing the street. There is little if any found proofing on the windows so I was greeted with a one man drummer band intermittently until 1am; people leaving a local club throughout; police sirens; garbage collection and street sweeping.

However, I didn't complain until I left so you could argue it's my own fault. But you think when you pay alot for a room there is consideration to give you an equivalent value experience.

Overall I was very disappointed. As value for money it was very poor for me.

review.title: Fantastic Location
review.reviewText: Comfortable hotel right in the middle of the city, near shopping, eating and the interest and activity of Union Square. A lot of the other hotels are a bit of a walk (up very steep hills) to get to anything. The hotel was all it should be: having an outdoor pool was a bonus, and the location was just right.

review.title: Convenient location to shopping, cable car, buses.
review.reviewText: I was with my granddaughter and it was her first time in San Francisco. She was very happy with the hotel and we got a kick out of the self-operated elevator to the 2nd floor.

review.title: This is close to the visitor center !
review.reviewText: We arrived the hotel and wow that isn't seen to be good. But later it quite good and comfortable.

review.title: weekend in Frisco
review.reviewText: The Hotel is located in a great place, clsoe to walking distance of lots of things to do. I have stayed in Hotels across the USA as well as overseas and don't get caught off guard very often. The room was old and i knew that but the picture on the internet did it more justice then it deserved. The queen bed was hard, neither my wife or I slept well, the old sliding door into the bathroom was off track and it was just heavy enought that my wife could not shut it so she needed assistence closing it. (Women need their privacy) it was brought up but never fixed. The staff for the most part were very helpful, dressed well and polite, had no issues with them other than the door never being fixed. The valet parking was expensive as everyone knows but to top it off they have a parking tax so be ready. I am sure you will pay that anywhere you park. I have stayed in better Hotels in nicer places for cheaper so look around. I am usually very good at finding these Hotels.
review.positiveRemarks: The Staff for the most part.

review.title: best secret in San Francisco- WOW
review.reviewText: Friendly & Helpful. Great location. Would stay here again.
review.locationRemarks: Best location in SFO. So central to everything

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText:
Hotel had a really nice dining area and the food, although a little expensive, was outstandingly good. Staff here excellent. Room was very satisfactory although it did not have the best view and the air conditioning was a touch noisy.
Receptionist, although friendly, made a mistake booking us into the room (room number confusion) which resulted in us having to renew our keys the next day to get into the room. Other staff members excellent particularly those who helped with the luggage and the car park attendant was very pleasant.
review.negativeRemarks: Worry when checking in
review.locationRemarks: EXCELLENT FOR UNION SQUARE

review.title: High Quality hotel in great location.
review.reviewText: Quality hotel with very friendly staff especially Neymar the bellboy - nice resaurant on side. Great location for all central San Francisco attractions. Hotel parking available at a price.
review.positiveRemarks: The double queen room with balcony.
review.negativeRemarks: None.
review.locationRemarks: very well placed for sightseeing.

review.title: Close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Comfortable room, nice restaurant adjoining hotel, great location.

review.title: Perfect location in San Francisco
review.reviewText: This is a nice, pleasant, old-fashioned (in the right sense) hotel, one half block from Union Square. The staff - two excellent concierges, helpful bell boys, good front desk workers - are all first class. The room was clean but fairly small. Breakfast was good.

review.title: Great Location and Helpful Staff
review.reviewText:
Everyone was so helpful with any questions we had. We had a great room with a view of the city streets.
The location is excellent!! We loved staying there for two nights.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, cleanliness, helpful staff. We liked everything about it!
review.negativeRemarks: No improvements needed! Keep doing what you're doing!!
review.locationRemarks: Near shopping, Union Square, cable car, etc. Perfect location!

review.title: Great location. Very close to the Union Square.
review.reviewText: Great location close proximity to transportation, shopping and restaurants
review.positiveRemarks: Good location, room is clean. The staff was friendly and helpful.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, shopping and good choice of restaurants.

review.title: 2nd time around
review.reviewText: Hotel was right in the center of town, accessible to everything! The price was reasonable, the room was small, but very clean and the staff was wonderful.
review.negativeRemarks: other than the size of the room I was pretty satified
review.locationRemarks: Shopping was one block away or you could catch any one of the public transportation (bus, trolley, streetcar) or do the tour bus.

review.title: Unlivable
review.reviewText: The room was so small that you had to walk sideways to the closet. The 3foot square are conditioner blew duct dust on us all night. They put an adult and a 10 yr old in a double bed, even though we had reservations, but no disclosure. The worst.
review.positiveRemarks: It was next door to the Daily Grind.
