review.negativeRemarks: Are you kidding?

review.title: Very Helpful friendly staff....great location
review.reviewText: I can't say enough about the staff...A+ ! The concierge was amazing at helping plan daily adventures....a wealth of knowledge for the entire region. The location is perfect for exploring on foot....great shopping, close to China Town and the cable cars. If their is a down side to this place it's the size of the rooms/bathroom. It's also a bit confusing the way the place is laid out. Overall for the money it was perfect! Ask for a room with a view, if not you will be facing another building. I would stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: The Internet in the business center is .25 per minute....The computers should already have the latest programs installed...but did not :(
review.locationRemarks: Cable cars, Eno wine bar across street,

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, good location to shopping and public transportation. Nice bar, pool was small but nice when kids not there, very friendly staff
review.positiveRemarks: Very nice hotel, good location to shopping and public transportation. Nice bar, pool was small but nice when kids not there, very friendly staff
review.negativeRemarks: A jacuzzi would have been nice and lower prices for parking. A cheaper restaurant or a discount for the breakfast they push on your bedding each day
review.locationRemarks: shop, shop, shop

review.title: Good location, pity about the upkeep!
review.reviewText: Good location but very disappointing for the price. Upkeep is a real issue here.

review.title: Great hotel, Great Location
review.reviewText: Do not hesitate to book here. My wife and I had a great time during our brief trip to San Francisco and we were so glad we stayed at the Handlery. The room was on the small side, but that was all we needed. The staff was very helpful, the room was always immaculate. Great place.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was perfect. 50 feet from Union Square and the rail car lines. Plus the mall not very far away was great too.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing needed improvement
review.locationRemarks: Could not ask for a better location if you're wanting to see San Francisco. Do yourself a favor and take the F line rail car to get to Fishermans' W

review.title: Comfortable hotel stay.
review.reviewText: I stayed at this hotel alone and felt very safe. Great position, in walking distances of main shopping and transport. Would recommend to friends. Very comfortable.

review.title: Perfectly fine hotel
review.reviewText:
The hotel was fine for our trip. The room seemed quite small compared to the usual American standards but was perfectly adequate for our stay in the city. Our room was comfortable and quiet, at the back of the hotel with no view but its facilities were good and we were quite happy with it.
Its location was good - right in the heart of the city at Union Square
review.negativeRemarks: The room was quite small
review.locationRemarks: Right in the heart of the city on Union Square

review.title: San Fran
review.reviewText: Great hotel in a fantastic location. very central.

review.title: Comfortable and convenient
review.reviewText: The hotel is just up from Union Square, convenient to shops, restaurants and all the tourist buses. Helpful staff. The room was comfortable though the bathroom was a little small, but still ok.
review.negativeRemarks: None,we enjoyed our stay there

review.title: Clean and great location
review.reviewText: When we first checked in the desk clerk couldn't find our reservation, having booked through Expedia. After some time they figured it out and all the while he was very courteous and reassuring. All the staff were very helpful.

review.title: Handlery third year in a row
review.reviewText: This is the third year in a row we have stayed at the Handlery. The location is perfect for the tourist, only 100 meters from Union Square and the Powell St, cable cars. Found the people on the front door did not come across as welcoming as previous years and appeared as if it was only a job to them and the guest may make things a little inconvienent for them. We always stay in the older part of the hotel and there where some noise issues on the first night so they moved us to another room without any problem. We love to eat at Lefty O'dooles and it is right next door. Breakfast and dinner, the food quality is excellent and very cost effective.
review.positiveRemarks: Location & cost would be hard to beat
review.negativeRemarks: The service has dropped off a little bit
review.locationRemarks: "Perfect" close to shops, cable cars, tours & union square

review.title: Location , location
review.reviewText: Good location close to the cable cars and shopping , walked back from pier 39 bit of a hike.
review.negativeRemarks: Hot room temp
review.locationRemarks: Very handy

review.title: Older small rooms but great staff.
review.reviewText: Our 1st room had a king bed & we could hardly walk past each other. Asked for a larger room & got one with 2 queen beds. It was better, but still tight. Rooms okay for sleeping - clean, but no good for relaxing. Shower was weak. Staff from Bell Captain to Consierge, front desk & housekeeping were very nice. Favorite feature was a computer room. We could print boarding passes at no extra cost. Excellent location for shopping & trolley cars.
review.negativeRemarks: It's just an old property - could use major upgrades. Not sure how they can room size.
review.locationRemarks: Trolley cars terminus within a few blocks away, can take you near Pier 39 & Fisherman's Warf. Close to: Macys, Norstrom, Sonoma, DSW, H&M & others.

review.title: Excellent San Francisco Hotel
review.reviewText:
Very well located Hotel. The staff were very helpful . The room was clean with pleasant décor. The beds were very comfortable
Looking forward to returning to it in the future
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: It is great . very central being close to public transport and upmarket retail

review.title: Very good downtown hotel
review.reviewText: We were in the historic wing and found our room a little small but perfectly comfortable, clean and quiet. Excellent staff service and very centrally located.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
Lovely hotel, perfectly positioned near Union Square, keeping you away from the crowd at the same time. Lovely room, perfectly sized for me as a single traveller but could easily have housed 2 people comfortably. Lovely staff, very friendly and so helpful. Nothing was too much for them. Room cleaned quickly and efficiently. The only down side was the doors banging. I know that is down to the people using the room, but even I, who was so conscious about shutting my door quietly so as not to disturb people, found it a struggle to close my door without some sort of a bang behind me.

I would stay here time and time again
review.positiveRemarks: Location and staff are the top selling points
review.negativeRemarks: The doors do seem to bang behind you
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location, literally 1 minute from Union Square. Lots of shops nearby and a nice bakery/coffee shop around the corner

review.title: Convenient Hotel in the heart of SF
review.reviewText: The hotel is convenient and easy to reach, in the middle of the city. It's in need of renovation, but perhaps that's why it's pretty affordable. It had a strange dank smell all over the hotel and in my room. AC was a bit wimpy, too.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: My husband, two kids, and myself thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The room was very clean and the staff super friendly. Would definitely go back!
review.negativeRemarks: The appearance of the hallways
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located to everything!!

review.title: Pleasant stay
review.reviewText: Good location,close to sevices and good food. good quality comfortable hotel. Good price! Great service from concierge
review.negativeRemarks: Room size
review.locationRemarks: Ideal location for mid city position

review.title: Small room
review.reviewText: the room was very small with no outlook and quite noisy at night - for the price I'd expect better

review.title: Good Location ONLY
review.reviewText:
The location of the hotel was good but I was very disappointed with the room. I booked a queen room and we got a double room with the vanity (sink and mirror) in the bedroom. The bathroom (which was toilet and shower) was barely big enough to dry yourself. The overall size of the room was very small. It was not value for money, consdiering the nightly rate we paid.
I would not recommend this hotel to anyone I feel that you could get a better room for the same rate.
review.negativeRemarks: It would've been nice to get the type of room we paid for (a queen bed ) and a bathroom that had all the amenities in the one rrom
review.locationRemarks: The location was the only ggod thing about this hotel. It was near the cable car stop and half a block to Union Square

review.title: Great!
review.reviewText:
Great location, nice staff, comfortable rooms.

Only complaint was staff missed my wake-up call and cab reservation. But I suppose that can be forgiven.

review.title: great stay
review.reviewText: Great stay, staff awesome, rooms comfortable but the queen room is very small, pool great temperature, close to good food, transport and union square.

review.title: Worst US hotel I've stayed in
review.reviewText:
Reception staff disinterested and unfriendly. Out of courtesy I called ahead to say I would be a late check in due to a delayed flight, the staff reaction was like errr right ok.

I was billed 50 dollars for 3 days car parking. I found this puzzling since I don't have a car. When I queried this at reception they took it off, but couldn't explain why I had been billed in the first place. Felt like they were trying it on.

Hotel interior is just like Overlook a hotel in The Shining. The corridors are a very close resemblance in both appearance and decor.

Room was very small with a micro bathroom. I'm a petite guy and struggled to fit in the shower. Larger people may not actually be able to get in. My room had a weird old musty smell. I think this was due to the age of the hotel, not anything specific to my room.

Hotel location is good, but bear in mind if you are on a low floor, nearby construction work starts at 6am so no need for an alarm!

The plus points: the cleaning staff were friendly, complimentary wi-Fi.

Overall I was thoroughly underwhelmed withe hotel and hugely dissapointed with the staff. My experience in no way reflected the price paid.
review.negativeRemarks: Unhelpful and unfriendly staff. Tiny room . Hotel needs updating.
review.locationRemarks: Right on Union Square. 6am construction work noise not ideal.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: This is the 3rd time we have stayed at the Handlery & have found it to be a great place to stay each time. It is handy to restaurants, shopping, cable cars etc & would recommend it anyone

review.title: Aussies
review.reviewText: I had paid for a 3 person room but because 1 person couldn't come they downgraded us to a 2 person room for the same price.I thought we would still get the bigger room.Was quite disappointed.The location was great.
review.negativeRemarks: Room was a bit small
review.locationRemarks: Able to get to a lot sightseeing things

review.title: Great Hotel in shopping District.
review.reviewText:
This is a great hotel in the middle of the shopping districts. If your fit and healthy, a fast half hour walk will get you to tourist districts, or take a tram or trolley bus.
Undercover parking to keep you car safe.

review.title: Great hotel & great location
review.reviewText: We stayed for 6 nights and had a very pleasant stay. Staff were keen to help in any way and the Concierge followed up a request message, whilst we were away on an all day tour, to see if my wife's glasses she lost at the Cable Car Museum had been found. We collected them the next day. I did notice the background noise from the hotel air conditioner when trying to get to sleep at night.
review.positiveRemarks: Good bed & shower; Free printing of airline boarding pass & check-in; Kettle provided when requested.
review.negativeRemarks: Had to pay for WiFi

review.title: Grad. Trip with Grandma.
review.reviewText: Friendly staff. Great location. Noisy neighbors. The concierge was most helpful. Would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff, most especially the concierge.

review.title: Great Place!
review.reviewText: I had a great experience at the Handlery. Nice clean and close to everything! I'll stay here again.

review.title: Nice and cozy hotel in the hear of union square.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Rooms are very clean and has all the amenities. Nice location. Everything is accessible from this location. Highly recommend it to all. We loved our stay.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location for pretty much all including shopping, restaurants, cable car, tour buses, and etc. very nice location. Loved it:)

review.title: Business Trip
review.reviewText: We used this hotel for one of our employees to stay while in the area working on a project. It was fine for this purpose and I wish it would have had a solid 3 stars, because I was hesitant, but it turned out to be ok for what we needed. It's not fancy, but it works well for just a basic place to stay.

review.title: Handlery Union Square was outstanding experience.
review.reviewText:
Staff was especially helpful and friendly- very attentive and responsive to our needs. Concierge 9both) were outstanding. Entire staff was great.
Excellent restaurant- well prepared and presented.
Need to get rid of the riff-raff on the street near hotel.
Great weather. Nice people all around.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was especially helpful and friendly- very attentive and responsive to our needs.
review.negativeRemarks: Need to get rid of the riff-raff on the street near hotel.
review.locationRemarks: It was central to many things- restaurants, entertainment, shopping, all transportation modes.

review.title: Well Placed, Pleasant Hotel
review.reviewText: The Handlery is a fine older hotel, well appointed, and conveniently located downtown a few steps from Union Square. During our stay a number of German and Australian visitors were prominent among the guests, lending a pleasant international presence. The lobby staff are friendly and helpful. We will definitely stay again.

review.title: nice hotel for couples
review.reviewText:
great location, good services, nice pool....
good food in the restaurant...
review.negativeRemarks: needs water cooler in the lobby
review.locationRemarks: best location for everything

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: Great value for the money compared with hotels in San Fran and its location, the only disapontment was the air conditioner was noisy and had to turn it off to sleep, not a problem in May but could be an issue in the middle of summer.

review.title: Nice hotel and convenient location
review.reviewText:
My friend and I just came back from San Francisco and we stayed at the Handlery. It was such a convenient location, on MUNI or BART everywhere we went wasn't more than 30 min away (which coming from NYC makes it really convenient. The concierge and bell hop were great! The room was always cleaned, but not vacuumed (but that could be because we had everything on the floor). We decided to share a queen bed since it would be cheaper than a two twin room and we ended up getting upgraded to a king size! The bathroom wasn't very big but it suited our needs.

The ONLY thing would be that it's really close to an area where the population of homeless people is really high, so you might not want to walk the area called the tenderloin at night. We didn't really have any issues because the transportation we took always left us in places where there was a lot of people walking around. The homeless around Union Square were harmless, they were pretty greatful when I gave them some of my left over dinner or snacks.

review.title: Smallest room ever.
review.reviewText: This hotel was old. It was not updated. Smallest room I have ever seen. Considering I paid more than a months rent on this little room it does not worth it. There was no space to move around in the room. Bathroom was old. It was a dark room with an single window looking in to a dark alley. Had to spend an hour in the shower since the shower head did not have any pressure. Bad hotel. Union squire area is also dirty with lots of homeless people in the streets at night. The only plus this hotel has its proximity to the transportation in the city, most places are walking distance. I had to do a last minute reservation and did not have much time to investigate. If I did I would have stayed elsewhere.
review.positiveRemarks: The only plus this hotel has its proximity to the transportation in the city, most places are walking distance.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleaner and bigger updated room. Better bathroom. Working shower head with some pressure.
review.locationRemarks: All locations in SF is in walking distance.

review.title: Very pleased with our stay at the Handlery
review.reviewText: We were advised by friends who had previously stayed at the Handlery to request a room in the modern section at the rear as it would be quieter so we did and were a little disappointed at how small the room was. However we asked for a room at the rear and that's what they gave us and it certainly was quiet. In every other aspect we could not fault this hotel, staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Hotel was very clean and comfortable. Didn`t use the restaurant or bar so cannot really comment on this. Central location of the hotel right next to Union Square was great for seeing San Francisco and very easy to get to from the airport using the BART with just a short walk from Powell St station. Would definitely recommend this hotel. Stayed here for a week in May 13.
review.negativeRemarks: Air conditioning in the corridors could make them a little cold at times
review.locationRemarks: Very good for seeing all of San Francisco. Easy access via the public transport system to anything you want to see or do in San Francisco

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Friendly staff and clean hotel room. The location can't be beat! We took the BART from the Airport to Powell Street. It took about 40 minutes. Once we arrived we walked two blocks up Powell towards Union Square and we were there. It was so easy. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone going to San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: Noisy street-facing room. No big deal because we expect that in the city
review.locationRemarks: Perfect!

review.title: Small but good for solo travelers
review.reviewText: Good location near Union Square. No complaints. Actually has vending machines, which is nice.

review.title: Very nice hotel with superb location for traveler
review.reviewText: Superb location just 2 blocks north of BART station and surround by Muni bus system.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: Great location and exceptionally friendly staff. Very relaxing stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to cable cars and great shopping.

review.title: Top Hotel
review.reviewText: Fantastic location to the shopping area and cable car to go down to Fishermans Wharf. Clean and comfortable and a good size room for 4 adults with lots of luggage. No guest laundry but a coin operated laundry 3 short blocks away. Fantastic staff. We unfortunately left a couple of things in the room after we checked out and didn't realise till we were half way to Monterey, I called the hotel and made arrangements for our forgotten items to be posted back to Australia. The hotel housekeeping staff were very obliging and our items arrived the day after we returned home. Thanks!

review.title: Fab location
review.reviewText: The gym is very basic, great location and concierge is very helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Gym size
review.locationRemarks: Location was amazing, would recommend if you would like to be close to union square

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Good hotel in great location for tourists, heated pool great for tired kids at end of the day

review.title: Great location and hotel
review.reviewText: There was ample room in 804 (top floor). It was a quiet hotel for sleeping and only 1/2 block from the heart of Union Square. We were able to get a rollaway bed in a nook of our room without any issues. This made it simple for 3 of us to have our own beds. Staff was friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay at this hotel again if I need to be in the Union Square area.

review.title: city of everything
review.reviewText: the staff knew how to make you welcome, look after your needs, offer great advice to shop and visit attrations, i have stayed in 5 hotels in sanfran this is the best yet, ile be back.
review.negativeRemarks: the near by drummer
review.locationRemarks: great to be in the middle of everything

review.title: Comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: Our room at the Handlery was clean, roomy and close to lots of public transportation and shops. The beds were very comfortable. The staff was most helpful with travel advice, especially the best route to get from here to there. On staff advice we returned our rental car to Dollar Car Rental half a block from the hotel rather than making a trip to the airport. San Francisco is a difficult town in which to drive and park and we appreciated the hotel's valet parking despite its cost.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was very clean and roomy with lots of small extras, such as robes and a bathroom scale. All staff members were friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Lighting for reading in bed or in the lounge chair could be better.
review.locationRemarks: There are numerous restaurants & bars, chic shops and large department stores. Union Square Park is a good place to relax and people-watch.

review.title: Handleryr hotel
review.reviewText: Rooms small and pokey and awkward for two people to walk in at the same time.toilet clogged up, bath clogged up standing in shower- bathroom door didn't open properly
review.negativeRemarks: Most everything else
review.locationRemarks: Good and central

review.title: Happy with the Handlery
review.reviewText: They upgraded me to a nice, large room with large bathroom. The room was comfortable and the location excellent. The staff was exceptionally kind and helpful. Hermie is the best! Thank you.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked coffee in the room, the location, the food, and the friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Decor is a little faded and sometimes it took a while to get a cab. Would like to see CNN Headline News as one of the offered t.v. stations.
review.locationRemarks: Everything is at your fingertips. Location could not be better!

review.title: Worth the stay
review.reviewText:
The room was a little smelly? Not sure what it was but a little off putting. The staff were helpful and as fas as we were concerned the location was fantastic. I don't think t
He air-conditioner actually worked but then again the weather was great, apparently SF is not used to heat like that at the time of year. There are a lot of people who use this hotel because of the location and relatively low price, however it does need a refresh.
Over all our stay was pleasant and the connecting restaurant was good.

One real negative was the drunks arriving back to their rooms in the wee hours of the morning, but I supposed you can't blame the hotel for guests bad behaviour.
review.negativeRemarks: Noisy patrons
review.locationRemarks: Great location, just what you are after.

review.title: Review
review.reviewText: Beds a little uncomfortable but hotel in a great central location ! Room service very quick and delicious
review.negativeRemarks: Older style
review.locationRemarks: Very central

review.title: Excellent value
review.reviewText: I had been tempted to economise by staying at a less expensive hotel but I was so pleased that I didn't. The Handlery was excellent value for money and the staff were extremely helpful. I appreciated being offered a choice of a room with the view of the street or one of the courtyard. I took the courtyard, which I'm sure was much quieter than the room facing the street. The location is superb.

review.title: Location!
review.reviewText: Lobby very spacious and welcoming. Rooms a little dated. We had booked a room with 2 double beds and a rollaway and I had checked that this was possible. When we arrived were told a rollaway wouldn't fit in that room, so had a room with 2 mini double beds, don't know their correct term, but certainly smaller than a double! But at least we weren't charged for rollaway. But room very comfortable and clean, and well serviced. Check price of parking before you stay, we didn't and got a shock with the price! But we were staying very central so worth the price. Great location. Pub next door great for breakfast. Would definitely stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Bedding set up.
review.locationRemarks: Ideal.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
Con: The rooms are very small and some even have the sink IN the room.
Pro: amazing location with walking distance to all the shops an restaurants. Beds very comfy.
Very nice staff and the adjacent Irish pub does amazing omelettes for half the price of the hotel.

review.title: Handlery Inn - a good place to stay
review.reviewText: Very helpful and friendly staff - excellent position
review.locationRemarks: Couldn't be better

review.title: Great location and loved our stay....
review.reviewText: We stayed at The Handlery for five nights on our first trip to SF. When we arrived late morning, our room was ready straight away, we were asked if we wanted a street view(noisy) room or a quiet room and we got an upgrade to a larger room; all greatly appreciated after 24 hours of travel! This hotel is in an excellent location to explore the city. The rooms are clean and while the bathroom is very small, it was adequate for us and was not a problem. We found this hotel to be great value and I doubt you could find better value so close to Union Square. The rooms were so quiet and dark and they are very comfortable. It has a bar next door which was good (and busy) and there are some great restaurants very close by. We had the most wonderful stay and we wouldn't hesitate in going back.....the only thing I may change is to book a room with a queen bed not doubles.......but it was clean, modern and comfortable in the best location in San Francisco. Unbeatable value and friendly, helpful staff!
review.negativeRemarks: Bed size
review.locationRemarks: Very central, a great location to explore this vibrant city.

review.title: Good place to enjoy SFO
review.reviewText: Great location. Confusing layout. Comfortable, great to have in room Wifi. Overall a good and convenient place to stay and enjoy SFO.

review.title: Great for active travellers.
review.reviewText:
I had an great stay for the price. Close to a lot of the things I wanted to see (baseball, cable cars, shopping) and the staff was very friendly. My toilet was runny, but I fixed it myself.. I can see less handy people giving the hotel a bad rating for that. It was a bit noisy for people who are light sleepers AND take naps in the day because of the cable cars. BUT if someone wants peace and quiet, getting a hotel in downtown san francisco isn't the best idea.

The elevators were slow so I took the stairs mostly.. My view wasn't great but I was outside most of the time. It's a good place for active travellers who want the best of metropolitan travel, and sightseeing. Lots of homeless around, but thats a fact most travellers should know about SF before coming down.
review.negativeRemarks: elevators that were too slow
review.locationRemarks: close to powell station if you enjoy using public transit.

review.title: Disappointing for the price...
review.reviewText:
Hotel has Character and good location but is like a maze inside. Rooms tiny and I barely fit in the shower (I'm 160lb...)
My room had no view and backed onto the air-con outlet for the building next door which made a constant noise.
In room heating very noisy / old fashioned.
Doesn't look anything like the pictures.. Disappointing compared to other places I've stayed on SF.
It would be a great hotel at $60-80 at $170, not so much.... ;(
review.negativeRemarks: Small rooms, no view at all.

review.title: Very nice location for shopping
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean. The staff was very courteous. I liked how the rooms were updated and kept up. Not like some older hotels that feel run down. It was nice that they have plenty of parking but I thought $47.00 for a guest to park overnight seems too expensive.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking fee
review.locationRemarks: Great downtown location. Close to food, shopping and the trolley.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: Rooms are extremely small and outdated. Too expensive for what you get.
review.negativeRemarks: The charge
review.locationRemarks: Convenient

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText:
The Hotel Location si perfect. The BART station is few blocks from the Hotel.
The cleanliness was good.
About the room we got, maybe it was a little small, but not a big issue for a two stay days. The only issue was the bed, it is not very comfortable. We woke up with backache :(
The staff was very pleasent and courtesy.

review.title: Fun Trip
review.reviewText: Overall great experience. Cost of parking at the hotel would make me not stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking Fee

review.title: Fantastic Stay
review.reviewText: At the last minute my cousin decided to go with me, when we arrived the room had one small double bed so we asked for a roll in bed and instead they provided us a new room with 2 single beds without any additional cost. It was fantastic. I've stayed at various hotels in the Union Square area and street noise is always an issue so I wasn't surprised or upset with the street noise. I would definately stay there again - the location is great the restaurant is convenient and the hotel is clean and safe and the staff is super friendly. The only issue was the parking fee - I was told of the $42 charge but the additional $6 for taxes was a surprise.
review.positiveRemarks: Teena at the front desk was so helpful and kind.
review.negativeRemarks: Cost of parking
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic

review.title: Great hotel for a night on the town.
review.reviewText: The hotel location cannot be beat. The service was very good as everyone was very friendly and helpful. The only downside was the noise of being so close to the bus stop and Union Square. Overall, I would stay here every time I am in SF.
review.locationRemarks: Perfectly located

review.title: Visiting Schools in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Our room was on the busy street, and along with the city noise we had the glare of the Hotel sign in our room every night. If we had a different room in the hotel I think I would have given it a 5. The staff was accomodating, and we loved the location.
review.negativeRemarks: glare of Hotel sign at night
review.locationRemarks: close to union square, shopping, and transportation.

review.title: Decent hotel all in all, uncomfortable bed&pillow
review.reviewText: Everything was Okay except the uncomfortable bed and pillows. To me hotel is a place of a rest after long day of business or trip. For this, I wouldn't recommend this place to people I know, but if can't find any other decent hotel within a budget, I'd consider it in the future.
review.negativeRemarks: Uncomfortable bed & pillows
review.locationRemarks: Good

review.title: Great location, comfy room, and awesome service
review.reviewText:
When I checked in, Matthew was kind enough to observe that I am rather tall, and proceeded to ensure I had a room with a large enough bed to accommodate me which I was grateful for.

The layout of the hotel is quirky. I had to walk down a hall, walk up a flight of stairs, then find an elevator to get me into my room which overlooked the pool. It turns out this facility used to be two separate hotels that merged under the Handlery name.

I was a bit disappointed in my room at first because the only windows faced directly into the pool area outdoors. But gradually, this layout grew on me - it had a Melrose Place feel to it with rooms on the 1st and 2nd floor facing the pool area which felt like a "community".

The room, as it turned out, was a very good size and very comfortable. Plenty of amenities including a shoe buffer, iHome Dock, Free WiFi, and wonderful Bath products.

The Manager (Jack I think?) printed some spreadsheets for me and had an employee run them up to my room one night when I needed.

My two disappointments were that the exercise room was under-equipped (the bench was broken and small weights) and the walls between hotel rooms are a tad thin. There is plenty of room for a larger all-in-one exercise machine which I hope they buy and replace the existing workout bench.

Overall feelings: the room was comfortable and well appointed, the layout of the hotel grew on me, the location is EXCELLENT, and the staff were OUTSTANDING. I would stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Exercise room, Slightly thin walls
review.locationRemarks: Half-block from Powell and Union Square. Best SF location I've stayed in yet.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Room was clean, hotel is a bit old and tired, Generally the staff is helpful, Concierge was a bit abrupt. Location is fabulous-- very centrally located in Union Square

review.title: Happy guest.
review.reviewText:
This is a clean comfortable hotel with helpfull freandly staff ,the concierge was very knowledgable ,the location to all transport especially the cable car is great.
Hop on hop off busses half a block from the hotel, (DO NOT USE DELUX TOURS.)
Great Irish bar three doors down,
I would stay here again on any future visits to SF.
review.negativeRemarks: Size of bed,only a queen.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location convenient to everything

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: Staff wasn't very helpful nor friendly when checking in. Over priced restaurant and poor quality food. Room is below average and over priced. Would not stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Too many to list
review.locationRemarks: Nice location

review.title: Mixed bag
review.reviewText: The room was small. Apart from the closet and a nightstand, it had no storage, which for me--not the neatest person in the world--was very inconvenient. Also, the hotel neglected to advise me of two phone messages, one of which was canceling an appointment! Staff is pleasant. A very nice restaurant is attached to the hotel. Location is great.

review.title: Cheerful and friendly
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a really central area. We were upgraded from a double room to a family suite - a nice surprise...two adjoining rooms - so had privacy. The beds and decor were lovely and sleeping was very comortable. Minuses - the bathrooms are a little old fashioned but certainly very functional. The heating/AC unit is very noisy, especially at night. The staff were extremely cheerful and friendly. I felt really at home. Also there was still plenty of original features such as the gorgeous wooden staircases and the lobby mailbox (see photo).
review.negativeRemarks: Noisy heating/AC unit
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic location right at Union Square.

review.title: Average
review.reviewText: The airconditioning unit was in the room and was drumming out such a loud noise you couldnt here the TV and couldnt sleep at night. So we turned it off and found another noisy external unit outside the window. The lobby was gorgeous but the rooms were below average and had a stale smell when you go in.

review.title: Overall OK
review.reviewText: Parking is almost $50/day (overnight). The parking entrance & lobby are quite a distance, so checking in without valeting your car is difficult. The bathroom was very small. Otherwise, we were happy w/our room & stay. The Daily Grill next door has great breakfasts and wonderful Bloody Mary's!
review.positiveRemarks: central to union square & downtown shopping
review.negativeRemarks: layout & parking

review.title: Great place to stay.
review.reviewText: Staff were very friendly and most helpful with all enquiries.Very willing to offer assistance and most polite and not in your face.Location ideal to the action in San Fran and well priced accommodation.
review.positiveRemarks: Location to the shopping area and bus sevices,cable car.Restaurants all near by to select whatever you wish to eat.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms perhaps could have been larger,but then we were out all day so it didn't matter too much.
review.locationRemarks: Great place to be is in Union Sq.-you dont need upmarket Hotels and their costs,this great Hotel.

review.title: Excellent hotel in all aspect
review.reviewText: I tremendously enjoyed my stay. The room and linen smells good and clean Feels really like home

review.title: Great spot
review.reviewText: Great location in the middle of union square, shopping district is a min walk, cable car at the corner so you can access everything from this spot. Clean and comfortable.

review.title: great deal and courtesy
review.reviewText: very nice, great location, clean, only downside is the room on the inside court are really in front of each other's window and you must keep blinders closed at all times, blocking the light from coming in. adding see thru curtains would be of help, so that we can have natural light in without putting up a show...
review.positiveRemarks: the room had everything a room should have
review.negativeRemarks: inside court places the room around facing each other, must keep shades closed most of the time, non-black out curtains would be nice
review.locationRemarks: couldnt be better

review.title: Nice hotel and location
review.reviewText: I was in town for a short time. The staff was great at check in. The trip from the parking area to the lobby is a bit weird, but not bad. Nice looking pool area.
review.locationRemarks: locations is great, right in the middle of it all

review.title: Handlery Hotel
review.reviewText: I had booked a room for 1 adult and 2 children and found that the rooms were too small especially when you have 3 suitcases in the room. The suitcases had to be closed and upright for you to be able to walk around the room comfortably. The hotel is in a ideal location for the cable cars, Union Square and shopping. Unfortunatley the size of the rooms detracts from the positives.
review.negativeRemarks: Size of the room
review.locationRemarks: You couldn't ask for a better spot, Union Square at your door step and close to cable cars and shopping.

review.title: Good
review.reviewText: Suited our needs to see the city.Comfortable & practical. We would stay there again

review.title: Ok, not really as expected
review.reviewText: Our room was small, had a queen bed with a good mattress, a small fridge, and a very small bathroom with a small sink counter that didnt have any room where to put makeup and hair products. The closet was small but ok. It's an old building but is very well taken care of and maintained, and its very clean everywhere. They had our car taken and parked by valet, which was nice, but it cost us $42 for 1 night stay. Very close to shopping, mall, Union Square, restaurants, and more! All of that is in a walking distance so, we really enjoyed our walks, there. I would stay at another hotel for this price, I expected more comfortable, romantic, relaxing, and pleasant room, but it was very plain, not as shown on the pictures. But this info is only about our room, I don't know about others.
review.positiveRemarks: The location of the hotel and image.
review.negativeRemarks: Not comfortable and relaxing room
review.locationRemarks: I think it is one of the best locations if you are visiting SF and want to know about more!!

review.title: Horrible experience with this hotel
review.reviewText: Very cold, unfriendly and unreasonable staff. There are many other hotels in Union Square that have much more to offer. We were so dissatisfied that we left a night early and they even refused to refund us for the last night. Regardless, we didn't go back and are not going to.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff is so horrible that we left a night early.

review.title: Great location. On site restaurant/bar.
review.reviewText: Great location. On site restaurant/bar is nice. Friendly staff. Fair value.
review.negativeRemarks: AC/Heat controls not working.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Great location with convenient parking and helpful staff. Daily Grill is great adjoining restaurant. I will definitely recommend this hotel to others. I also suggest that visitors attempt to reserve an inside room facing the pool. Outside rooms are very noisy.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise from street and night club lines
review.locationRemarks: Convenient parking goes with great location

review.title: Nice hotel for a weekend away
review.reviewText: We stayed 2 nights and on the first night our room was very cold. We played with the thermostat on multiple occasions but it just blew cold air. The next day we informed the check in desk and they sent someone to repair, but instead of fixing it we were left with a portable heater. It helped, but it would have been nice to have a heater in our room that worked. The portable did nothing for the bathroom which was freezing at the end of December. The hotel was very nice and our room was clean and comfortable. If it had had a working heating the room would get a 5. Great location and easy to walk everywhere.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Great location, staff very friendly and efficient, DailyGrill barand restaurant surperb

review.title: last minute help
review.reviewText: I had to check in at last minute and I had 2 adults and 5 kids. The man at the front desk took 20 minutes of his time to show me 3 rooms and upgraded me to a larger room at no addtional cost to help with my last minute hotel needs.,The kids loved staying there and we will go back and stay again!
review.locationRemarks: the location is great!

review.title: Best location!
review.reviewText: We always come into the city during the Holiday Season and always stay at the Handlery! We were out and about a good part of the day and when we returned to the Hotel it was like we returned home! So convenient!
review.positiveRemarks: Great location. Outdoor pool and surrounding tables!
review.negativeRemarks: Can't think of anything!
review.locationRemarks: Right in the heart of Union Square! What could be better!

review.title: Very convenient hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was very good and most convenient which was important to us. The only problem is that the parking rate given to me by Expedia was less than what they actually charged. When I asked about it, they stated "Expedia needs to update their records."
review.negativeRemarks: Parking charges
review.locationRemarks: Within walking distance to most of the places we wanted to see.

review.title: About the petite room
review.reviewText: Due to low budget I stayed at the petite room. It was, as promised by its title quite small, but will do just fine for a solo traveler or a young couple. The view was of a wall, and the AC was too loud, but because the room was not facing the main street it was relatively quite. In terms of cleanness (which is to me by far the most important criterion) it was perfect. The petite room is exactly what I paid for - no luxury but everything else you'd expect from this sort f hotel. I will definitely return!
review.locationRemarks: Amazing. Just 10 steps from Union Square!

review.title: great location great people
review.reviewText: I have visited this hotel in the past and I always get great service
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: fantastic location

review.title: Quaint, historic room
review.reviewText:
We stayed in an "Historic Room" so it was clearly old and not updated, but it was clean, roomy and comfortable. The bathroom was quite small, in keeping with older styles. The hardware, fixtures, and windows (which actually opened even though we were high up) were all old-style. I rather enjoyed this.

They do have a modern wing too.
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to Union Square; small boutique hotel; friendly staff
review.negativeRemarks: Confusing route from parking garage to front desk and when taking the stairs instead of elevator.
review.locationRemarks: Half a block from Union Square. Perfect if that's where you want to be.

review.title: Not a place to stay if you need sleep!
review.reviewText:
All night long, both nights I was there, I could hear a band playing and people laughing and cracking up until 2am each morning. It sounded like they were partying outside my room and I had the windows open. I was there on business, traveling for nearly 12 hours and with a 3 hour difference, this was so frustrating. I thought this noise would just be the first night, not realizing it was BOTH nights. I was so exhausted during and after my time there. When I checked out, nobody asked me how my stay was, or I would have told them.

We had to get up and leave at 3 am to catch our flight. Going to our car that was parked in the garage, me and my co-worker were just talking when a lady from the hotel "Shhhhhh'ed" us. I could not believe that she did this like we were screaming or something. We were dragging our bags up the stairs to where the pool was to get to the garage. Our suitcases rolling on the uneven ground made more noise than we did. Not a pleasant ending to our stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Severe Noise. Old rooms with very old windows. You can hear everything outside and in the halls from your room.
review.locationRemarks: Great location.

review.title: Great Location; Tiny Room; Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Our room on the 6th floor with a queen bed was surprisingly small, and had a window view of an internal hotel shaft. At first, we were shocked when we opened the door. However, we didn't have much luggage and we fit just fine. It was quaint, cute hotel. The hotel was clean and did the job, awesome location, nice staff, the elevator was relatively quick. Parking garage requires stairs to get into the hotel. Overall though, great stay.

review.title: A great hotel on Union Square
review.reviewText: I have been coming to the Handlery Hotel for quite a few years, with my husband and my adult daughter. The staff is very welcoming and helpful. The location is perfect for our needs - right on Union Square where this great shopping, good restaurants, close to the cable car and the BART. At Christmas time the hotel is always decorated. This hotel is always my first choice for a place to stay in San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: Not a thing!
review.locationRemarks: It is within walking distance to shopping, Union Square, transportation.

review.title: Service
review.reviewText: Good service. What a hotel for the price and location.

review.title: Black Friday
review.reviewText: Our stay was great. Loved the location in the middle of all the action.
review.negativeRemarks: The very tiny bathroom
review.locationRemarks: Perfect. Right close to union square.

review.title: Character in San Fransico
review.reviewText: I liked this hotel it is an older hotel and has character, the rooms were clean, the bed was comfortable and the staff was friendly and helpful when called upon. The location was great only half a block to the trolley cars. Everthing we wanted to do was easly accessible from this location. Excellent pub couple of doors down from the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Two TV's and only one remote control
review.locationRemarks: I thought the location was excellent

review.title: mediocar
review.reviewText: Got stuck in elevator for one hour. Apperantly they didnt have key tro open doors.
review.negativeRemarks: gettting stuck in elevetor
review.locationRemarks: very close to Bart, trollies, and f train

review.title: Front rooms too noisy!
review.reviewText: Rooms fronting onto Geary street incredibly noisy for a Thursday night ! They leave you complimentary ear plugs on the bedside table and still it felt like I was sleeping in middle of street. Complete with a drugged up prostitute fighting 4 policemen and later at 4 am fire trucks. Staff is very nice and did move us next night to rooms in the back. I would stay again if assured a back room.
review.negativeRemarks: Too noisy in front rooms
review.locationRemarks: Good location near union square if can get quiet room

review.title: Great Location..Awesome staff
review.reviewText: Great location. Staff very helpful. Air conditioner a bit noisy..but overall great experience.
review.negativeRemarks: Street noise

review.title: The Hannnnnlery (for those of your KNBR listeners)
review.reviewText: Only complaint was the bed was as hard as a rock but that's a hotel. Also, the parking is a little more expensive than some other surrounding hotels. Other than that they were great.

review.title: Just ok
review.reviewText:
A great location, but let down by age and lack of speciall touches.
We had no complaints, but would not be in a hurry to stay again.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is a huge tax
review.locationRemarks: Careful where you go when leaving hotel, many beggars nearby.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Nice clean hotel, good service, very well located.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenience of location and very good service.
review.locationRemarks: Just off Union Sq convenient to Market St.

review.title: Handlery's new is great, the old needs updating.
review.reviewText: The Handlery is a wonderful hotel for the most part. The rooms in the older part of the hotel have a noticeable musty smell, which probably has something to do with the ventilation system. The older rooms also have older mattresses that are not as comfortable as the beds in the newer part of the hotel. The staff is always exceptional!

review.title: Just ok
review.reviewText: NO water pressure in bathroom. Bad air conditioning.
review.locationRemarks: Good

review.title: I'll be coming back again
review.reviewText: Great location in lively area, independent hotel, genuine friendliness and helpfulness of staff at all levels, from concierge and front desk to housekeepers and maintenance workers. I'll definitely stay there the next time I'm in San Francisco!

review.title: Great value.
review.reviewText: This hotel is quiet (although in a busy area), clean, well run, with pleasant and helpful staff. Housekeeping is of a very high standard. My room was a good size, with a comfortable bed,and a spacious desk with a good desk lamp, Wardrobe space was good. On top of all these points is the location - it is superb. A safe location, too. Close to bus routes, cable cars, Union Square, ten minute walk to Market street and BART Station (Powell St). Nearby are coffee shops, small restaurants, etc. Great value for money.
review.locationRemarks: Great, especially for first-time visitors to SF

review.title: Too expensive for what it is
review.reviewText:
Do Not get a petite double or a standard double. If you have a choice. Way too small for 2 people. ok for one person though.

I didnt have a choice as I booked an unpublished hotel and ended up paying the king price for a double room. Beware
review.negativeRemarks: price
review.locationRemarks: 1/2 block from union square

review.title: Happy family and would visit again
review.reviewText: We are a family of 4 ( 2 adults & 2 children - 9 & 7 yo), the hotel was a convenient location for us. We felt safe and although in an inside room (no view etc) it was quiet and light - we were on the 7th floor. The room was large although the bathroom a little small but adequate. We really enjoyed our stay here and would recommend to others.
review.negativeRemarks: Size of bathroom
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Convenient.

review.title: great find in the heart of union square area
review.reviewText:
our room was nice,quiet and well maintained
wonderfully located in the heart of union square district
review.locationRemarks: in the middle of everything in union square

review.title: Eh...
review.reviewText:
It is in a great location but the room I had was beyond tiny....i mean bedrooms are bigger. It was a nice vibe older hotel but you could tell the room I was in was falling apart.

If location is all you care about...this place is worth it. Other than that... check out Marriot or Hilton. They have to be better and are not that far away.
review.negativeRemarks: Condition
review.locationRemarks: Amazing. Dead Center of where you want to be.

review.title: First trip to SFran, perfect hotel choice
review.reviewText:
Perfect central location to everything you need when visiting San Fran. Friendly staff, that had the patience to talk me through complicated directions to me, while I was driving a rental car in the city for the first time. I called back a second time, more help, did not get impatient, and all was good.

Had a room with a fire escape about 2 floors up but wasn't disturbed by much noise. Very good view. The windows were unlocked though, which I found peculiar, so make sure your windows are locked since the fire escape is, of course, accessible.

Great experience overall.
review.locationRemarks: Location is very dense, very downtown, and during rush hour it can be daunting if you are driving in from out of town. Lot's of annoying one-ways.

review.title: Good central location but its bare and functional.
review.reviewText: I only saw the standard rooms but they were very old and tired. My window ( single glazed) looked onto a brick wall however this did not stop the constant noise coming through the gaps. The first thing I did was unplug the fridge due to the noise and there was no cupboard to store clothes, just a hanging rail. It is a good central location however the cost did not reflect the rooms however if you do want this hotel then I strongly recommend you consider the upgrade.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms
review.locationRemarks: Just off Union Square, just a few minutes from everything and its own car park.

review.title: Awesome
review.reviewText: Loved it! Great location, and great views from our room

review.title: Review of the Handlery Hotel San Francisco
review.reviewText:
It was very inconvient not having freee Wi Fi in the rooms or the hotel. Most hotels now offer this service and I think it would benefit the Handlery to offer it.
Staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms were quiet and clean. Location was fabulous for shopping to take tours or to go out in the evening.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and standard of the hotel and the efficiency of the staff
review.negativeRemarks: not having free Wi Fi available to enable easy communication to my office and family
review.locationRemarks: great for shopping and tours and nightlife

review.title: An ok stay
review.reviewText: The hotel is very dated and needs renovation. The rooms are very dull and dark and quite small. The location is about the best thing with this hotel.

review.title: Very friendly staff in a hotel with good locationn
review.reviewText: Rooms are well kept although functional as is usual with this type of hotel. Th thing that sets it apart is the attitude of the staff. Without exception everyone is friendly, helpful and seems very proud of their hotel and the city. Nothing seemed to be too much trouble and they were very willing to give tips for places to visit.
review.negativeRemarks: Not easy to spot, set back a little from the road so not as prominent and easy to spot as other hotels close by.
review.locationRemarks: withing walking distance of most of the main attractions

review.title: A lovely central SF hotel.
review.reviewText:
We visited this hotel as part of our West Coast Tour and we were very pleased with our choice. It is located very centrally and the room was great. We were originally put in a tiny room with a small double bed but when we asked to pay for an upgrade, we were upgraded to a larger room free of charge. It has a great pool and gym and the staff were brilliant.

The concierge has fantastic recommendations... listen to him!

review.title: Great Hotel for the Money
review.reviewText: The Handlery is a clean, efficient hotel,in downtown San Francisco. It is an older building, but it is kept up well, and offers a good value for the traveler. It is not the most expensive, or the most up-scale hotel, but it is clean and the staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are a little small by todays standards, but the TV's are flat screens and the bathrooms are clean and functional. The cost is less than most of the other hotels downtown. It is conveniently located and car rental garages are very close-by, and the cable car and trolly to Fisherman's Warf are less than a block away.
review.negativeRemarks: Older rooms are small by today's standards
review.locationRemarks: In the middle of the downtown scene

review.title: Good hotel in great location
review.reviewText: Front desk staff seemed uncaring and distant. No smiles, no warm welcomes. Bell staff experience pretty good. concierge good. Cleaning staff good. Breakfast at Daily Grill was overpriced and average food. Temp control in room hard to get right. Shower water pressure very low. Great location to get anywhere around SF.
review.negativeRemarks: Front desk staff unfriendly
review.locationRemarks: Excellent

review.title: Great Location, right off Union Square
review.reviewText: This hotel is a good value for the money. Old, but well maintained.
review.negativeRemarks: Small room

review.title: Good
review.reviewText: I liked the hotel and location. Could use free wireless internet.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs wireless intternet standard.
review.locationRemarks: Love the location and the city.

review.title: An Excellent Choice
review.reviewText: Great hotel, great location, wonderful staff, will stay again. Petite room was, as name suggests, small, but perfect for my needs, single business traveler. Recent renovations, allowed this older section to shine as the more modern flair balanced with the old world charm met in perfect harmony. Staff was wonderful, polite and dedicated to providing the best service. Made me feel significant!

review.title: great for business travel
review.reviewText: I was staying in San Francisco on business and this was a great location. The hotel itself was very comfortable. I did ask for a room off of the street which they were able to accommodate despite my checking in late and a busy conference being in town. The staff were lovely and helpful with every request. The Daily Grill was a fine default for food when I was too tired to go looking for a really great restaurant of which there are many in the neighborhood. The room was modern, nicely appointed and very comfortable. It was a queen room with one bed which might have felt tight for two but was generous for one. The neighborhood was lively with art galleries, lots of shopping, museums and good food all in walking distance. Cable cars and the BART system around the corner. And a great concierge if you need advice about tourist sites or dining. Much nicer than staying at yet another Marriot.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect!

review.title: Central location although older hotel
review.reviewText: An older hotel... rooms could do with some updating. Expensive for what you got, our room had no view rooms are either looking over street on one side of hotel or like ours looking over the utility pipes on the other side so be sure to ask for street view if this is important to you. Actually our room despite having no view was on the quiet side of hotel which suited us fine . Very central in union square walk able distance to most places or close to public transport to all attractions.
review.locationRemarks: Great if you want to be in union square
review.userLocation: Newcastle Upon Tyne, Tyne and Wear, UK

review.title: Great central SF location, a bit long in the tooth
review.reviewText: Excellent location. Rooms a bit worn, with basic pillows and blankets, no comforters. Friendly pleasant staff, excellent location.
review.negativeRemarks: Blanket instead of comforter. Less than super pillows
review.locationRemarks: It doesn't get any better.

review.title: Ideal for couples.
review.reviewText: Great place to stay in a really first class location just off Union Square. For many first time visitors to San Francisco like us (active and in our sixties) the alternative location would be Fishermans Wharf which is a tourist honeypot - but a definite must visit especially using the nearby cable car. The hotel has a good restuarant which in relation to the local competition is fairly priced and used by many people not staying in the hotel. Travel to anywhere in SF is easy and staying here you are within easy walking distance of all the major shops and stores. Macy's is in the next block on Union Square with it's top floor restaurant (called the Cheesecake Factory) - great for coffee and cheesecake or an outdoor lunch!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location- right next to Union Square. Not a bad price for the location. Hotel is a little dated and room was pretty small but clean and comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Outdated
review.locationRemarks: Right at Union Square

review.title: " Location, location, location! "
review.reviewText: Location is awesome. Union Square one block away. Daily Grill and Lefty O'Douls right next door. Everything is within 10 min walk or 10 min cab ride. Staff super nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Shower pressure

review.title: Could do with modernisation!
review.reviewText: Before booking this hotel we checked it out on the Internet, photos of the rooms and read reviews but upon arrival were very disappointed. The reception was dimly lit and shabby, in need of modernisation. We were given a room on the 3rd floor at the back end of the hotel. The rooms are just as bad as the lobby, dimly lit, carpets worn and could do with secondry glazing to keep the noise out from the street below. At night we were kept awake by the loud music and late night customers from the Irish bar and woken by the noise from the traffic. On the plus side the hotel is in a great location, in the heart of Union Square district.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: Great position close to everything, very friendly staff. Large room no view but very comfortable
review.negativeRemarks: My room had no view
review.locationRemarks: Premium

review.title: The Handlery is a great place to stay!
review.reviewText: The Handlery was centrally located and well appointed. My only disappointment was that there was no free wifi available, which might be a problem for business travellers. Overall an excellent hotel. The hotel restaurant was also good.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and the Concierges were most helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: No free wifi!
review.locationRemarks: Very central. Easy to get around the city. Most tours pick up from the hotel.

review.title: GREATgreatGREAT place 2 stay
review.reviewText: Great Hotel in an excellent location, right next to all the shopping on Union Square...will defo return 2 stay again....thank U
review.locationRemarks: SHOPPING.....

review.title: Anniversary
review.reviewText: Stay was awesome. The staff upgraded my room to a king for free....Yey also sent up a complimentary bottle of champagne for free since it was our anniversary. Very happy with hotel. We booked two rooms for New Years Eve before we left.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking was expensive
review.locationRemarks: AWESOME

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The perfect location to explore San Francisco ! Hotel staff were great and we would stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Smallish room, but cosy
review.userLocation: Austral Ct, Canning Vale WA 6155, Australia

review.title: Great staff
review.reviewText: The staff was great. A longstanding strike against a nearby hotel made our first room quite noisy a couple of times a day. The staff found a way to move us to a quieter room. Both rooms were great other than that.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect, central location

review.title: Petite Room
review.reviewText: A petite room is more like a large closet with a bed. I know hotels in cities have small hotel rooms, but this was much smaller than any I've stayed in in SF before. My wife said it was charming and cozy. I say it was overpriced for the little uncomfortable double bed we got. It would be one thing if they put a larger bed in the room, but since the room is little more than a closet with a shower, you are better off upgrading to a full size room or a different hotel.

review.title: Tired but decent
review.reviewText: Tired hotel but fairly clean. Lobby not much to write of.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Great Union Square location. We were in one of their "Petitie Rooms" which was fine. The mattress was awful, soft and worn out.

review.title: Cozy space, felt like home
review.reviewText: Loved it! My room was the perfect mixture of an at-home comfortability and the luxury of staying at a hotel.

review.title: Great
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, close to everything. Clean and inexpensive hotel.

review.title: Clean, Close-In Moderate $
review.reviewText: rooms small but spotless, w/ new bathroom. a/c in our room welcome. Concierge John Wood extremely well-informed & helpful. Adjoining restaurant, Daily Grill, convenient for breakfast & moderately priced. Location terrific, central to many SF sites.

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: Close to Union Square and tour stops. Walking distance to food, towns, etc.

review.title: Room with no view.
review.reviewText: We were given a room at the back of the old section of the hotel on the third floor. The room was small but well maintained the down side was that we looked mainly at a brick wall with only a small peep of the newer section of the hotel at the back through the top of the window. The staff were friendly and very helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Small room and view from window blocked by a brick wall.
review.locationRemarks: Extremely handy to restaurants, transport and shopping.

review.title: SF summer of 2012
review.reviewText: Front desk personel were excellent, doormen/greeters about the same but the concierge were a liitle bit cranky, could use some freshing up in that department! Close to BART if you are flying in and don't have a lot of bags take the BART $16.50 for 2 one way and 30 min from the airport - get off at the Powell station and you are 2 blocks and around a corner to the hotel. Wifi was very quick and worth the charge - thats how we found out what was going on and what to see and do. Very clean and well kept hotel in general. The parking fee may seem steep but really it is not as you may come and go as much as you wish. The car allows you to get out and see many of the sights that public transit would be difficult to get to, ie Santa Cruz, Gilroy outlet mall, half moon bay, Oakland and the wine country! Daly city area we found okay for shopping as well!. Tons of taxis around watch out for the hop on-hop off buses (S.F. Deluxe sightseeing), they state 30 mins at every stop. Absolutley NOT true, we wasted almost 2 hrs getting from F. Warf to the Handlery. Tons of info from the drivers tour wise and otherwise a good buy, plan your 48 hrs and it will pay for itself! We may stay on the newer side next time it looked very nice!
review.positiveRemarks: Ecellent location, pool looked really nice but we were to busy! We walked for an hour each night in all 4 directions from the hotel and saw lots.
review.negativeRemarks: 1 of 2 elevators not working over the weekend. Pool closed to early - 8 pm? No time for a late night dip if you were out sightseeing late!
review.locationRemarks: Excellent. Can be noisey on the protest mornings overlooking Geary. But hey no need for an alarm. Really not that bad. Lots of eats and drinks close

review.title: Family friendly
review.reviewText: My husband and I traveled with our two boys 7 and 9. The room was clean. We really only came to the hotel to sleep. We were in the 4th floor facing the street. It can get a bit noisy even though we were in the fourth floor. It is in the heart of downtown so expect a lot of movement. However, it was well situated. The hotel is only blocks from catching the famous historic Cable Cars, busses and munis. That was a fun experience.
review.negativeRemarks: The beds were too bouncy.

review.title: Great hotel location
review.reviewText: Great location to Union square shops, short cab ride or tram to Fishermans wharf to go to Alcatraz or hire bikes to bike the bridge, Short walk from Hotel to train station, We took the train direct from the airport to Union square for under $10 under half an hour. Certainly not a new upmarket property but location and friendly staff made stay pleasant.
review.positiveRemarks: Central location,close to train station for airport,Union square shops. Free Wi-Fi. Excellent helpful friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Older property
review.locationRemarks: Excellent, walking distance to shops and train station to airport

review.title: ozibar
review.reviewText:
The room was very small and did not have any opening window
But the location was great

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean & in a great location. We had a Petite room which was ok for the 2 of us but it was definately on the smaller side. Probably not great for a long term stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean & Quiet. Derby Grill Resturant is wonderful!
review.negativeRemarks: Receptionist were not as welcoming as I am use too, but they were pleasant once you took the initiation to go to them.
review.locationRemarks: Great Location

review.title: Wonderful- will return!
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed for 4 nights beginning-mid July. We were in town for our anniversary and made sure the hotel knew we wanted an extraordinary experience via special request (and reminder calls). When we arrived we found parking to be extremely easy and valet staff to be helpful and friendly. We were early for check-in but the front desk staff saw our special request and got us an ugraded room with no wait! Our room was FANTASTIC! The bed was comfortable, bathroom spacious, and the view to die for! After our first night on the town we were surprised with a bottle of sparkling wine and snacks, this definately shows the Handlery staff cares and are willing to go the extra mile to make guests feel welcome. The next day Mr. Handlery himself left us a personal message welcoming us. Overall this hotel could not have been better: great location, friendly and helpful staff, clean accomodations, and tons of ammenities (I used the business center to print off our return flight boarding passes for free)!!
review.negativeRemarks: nothing!
review.locationRemarks: center of shopping district, right by transit

review.title: Would definitely stay again!
review.reviewText: I had a great time staying at the Handlery Hotel. The staff were very friendly and they would give me tips on various sites/locations/food recommendations. My room was a bit small, but it was very comfortable nonetheless. The bathroom was much bigger than I thought. I stayed in the back of the hotel and my room did not have a very nice view, but it was less noisy. I thought the room was very clean and I had no problems. I thought it was a bit cold in my room so I called downstairs and the engineer of the hotel called me back right away to fix the heating problem. They were very prompt. The bed was comfortable and they offer a lot of pillows. I thought the shower head did not have enough pressure and that was my only grip. I enjoyed the small gym, but I wished they provided fresh towels at the gym because I forgot to bring mine. I did not swim in the pool, so I don't know much about that. Overall, I had a great time because this hotel was next to a lot of central locations and transportation to BART and MUNI buses.
review.negativeRemarks: The water pressure in the shower
review.locationRemarks: It is next to great cafes and restaurants

review.title: We are definitely coming back!
review.reviewText: We enjoyed being so close to Union Square, theatre, great restaurants and easy access to public transportation.

review.title: Nice and convenient hotel.
review.reviewText: The hotel has a convenient location, just in downtown. Its personnel was very attentive. Concierge very helpful and knowledgable. Price is reasonable. Would stay again.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom was extra mini small, reminds me of a cruise.
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic location in downtown San Francisco. Near everything, including cable car and buses stops.

review.title: love this hotel
review.reviewText: Great location. Beautiful building. Lefty O'Douls next door!

review.title: Good San Francisco Experience.
review.reviewText:
Nice hotel right in the middle of Union Square's shopping and night life. Excellent location, good feel to the hotel that makes it feel like it is part of San Francisco. Rooms are a good size, very well kept and overall we do recommend staying here.

However, there is a hotel strike in the hotel across the street and it has been going on for sometime and doesn't look like it will end soon. Ensure you are not located right in the front on Geary street otherwise there is an excellent chance you will be listening to a very loud, very long chant at 7AM. The staff must be aware of this and the ear plugs placed on the night stand confirms it... and believe me, these do not work at all as the windows are single pane. The staff moved us immediately, but it was still very irritating for our first night in the city.
review.negativeRemarks: Street noise.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent for the night life and central location. Homeless people in the area is a little surprising.

review.title: Great hotel, service, and location
review.reviewText: Originally was asked if I wanted a quiet room away from the street. Of course, said yes; but had problems with the GPS devices that I brought that needed to download information from the sky for the presentation I was making the next day and needed a location that would satisfy the need. The front desk lady, Shirley, arranged a room change in a snap and had a bell man help move me to my new room. The staff provided ear plugs and apologized for the noise, which didn't bother me a bit; and I slept like a baby. I had dinner at the attched City Grill and it was EXCELLENT!. This hotel is a great deal and in a great location. I will be back.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything was good: people, location, restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square; walking distance to Market Street and the Powell Avenue cable car line.

review.title: Right in the heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText: What a location right in the heart of th shopping centre, right in Union Square!!!!! Restaurant were great hotel staff gave us great advice on where to eat and what to see. Would recommend this to anyone. Can't wait to come back to San Francisco again.

review.title: Extremely central location
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a great location and that's basically what you pay for.
review.negativeRemarks: It was fairly old so you could hear the floorboards creaking from the room above

review.title: STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL!!!
review.reviewText: We were given 2 rooms on the 5th floor by the street. At 7AM, there was a LOUD protest from the strikers of a hotel across the street - that lasted for 1.5 hours. You could not sleep at all. The staff could care less and only told us that we might experience some noise in this room. They had no other rooms to offer us when they warned us of the noise.

review.title: What title, it was a hotel
review.reviewText: Good location, overall had a very pleasant experience.
review.locationRemarks: excellent

review.title: Reills
review.reviewText: Well located property, clean & friendly. Would stay again. Free internet - we had to ask for an access code.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: The staff was nice and polite. The bed was comfortable, even the pillows were comfy. We were so busy that we never got to the restaurant or pool! The protester's were loud, but we were up by that time due to the sun. The location was perfect! To catch a tour, a trolley, eat lunch in Union Square, shop, catch a cable car.....
review.positiveRemarks: It had a bit of character. Friendly staff and a nice door man! And the location
review.negativeRemarks: The protester's and a king sized bed on vacation would have been a better choice than a queen!
review.locationRemarks: Great! Glad we didn't stay down at the pier, even though we did go down there alot, the travel was always fun!

review.title: Had a great time!
review.reviewText: Had a great time in SF. Great location at Union Square. Tons of shopping an near all transportation.
review.negativeRemarks: Very small bathroom. But clean.
