review.title: small but perfect
review.reviewText: of course all the hotel rooms in SF are small but the location couldn't be better. I've stayed several times and it's always a great experience.
review.negativeRemarks: size
review.locationRemarks: perfect

review.title: Fine to stay at if you're not expecting too much..
review.reviewText: This hotel is half a block from the Macy's building. The shopping was easily done, the difficulties lie in the parking - valet parking in the back of the building. After driving by the hotel 3 times, we finally called the front desk for valet parking instructions. The hotel itself is older and as such; outdated: the rooms were small, the bathroom cramped, the walk in shower just a sliver in the wall and the air conditioning unit - incredibly noisy. To make matters worse, there were protestors picketing/yelling from blowhorns in front of the Frank Hotel (right across the street); nothing beats waking up at 6am to unwanted ruckus while on vacation.
review.negativeRemarks: The outdated styling, the inconvenient parking and the protestors across the street.
review.locationRemarks: Half a block from the Macy's building.

review.title: Quick Stay, Good Price
review.reviewText: It was a quick overnight stay. For the price it was perfect. We had our 9 & 6 yr old boys with us. We arrived around 7pm and promptly left for dinner after checking in and checked out by 8:30 the next morning. We were offered a larger room with queen beds and no view. Definiately, not a room if you wanted to look out because they meant NO view but for our needs the room was very large with a sitting area and sofa/bed. The bathroom was small but everything was very clean. If on a budget and needed the space would definately come back. Staff was friendly as well.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel is old but I really can't say that was a problem. Elevators were small but everything was well maintained and clean.
review.locationRemarks: Only about 100 ft. from Union Square. Very good location.

review.title: Very Happy
review.reviewText: Great location on Geary street right in the heart of Union Square. We had a king suite that was very good. Great bed. Quiet. Good bathroom. Happy to stay there again. Staff all helpful and very friendly.

review.title: the best value in SF
review.reviewText: Fantastic staff who went out of their way to be kind and generous and friendly, as has been the case on previous visits. Perfect location, great rooms, comfy bed. Will come back again and again.
review.locationRemarks: just a few metres from Union Sq and up the street from the BART and streetcar; short walk to Chinatown and Rasputin (for the record collector)

review.title: A Happy Solo Business Traveler
review.reviewText: I was in San Francisco for business and this was my first time at the Handlry. The staff was very helpful and accomodating, the room was small (as expected - it was advertised as a petite double) but quite comfortable and very quiet. There was no view, but given the boisterous nature of the location (Union Square) I was happy to forgo scenery for silence. All in all a happy hotel experience! I will be booking with them again.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevators were very slow, but that's a minor thing.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square on Geary Street - centrally located for business and shopping. Trolly stop just outside the door. Short walk to Chinatown.

review.negativeRemarks: Just the lifts and hallways are looking a little worn

review.title: Handlery Union Square Hotel review
review.reviewText: A nice hotel in a very convenient location -- adjacent to Union Square, the trolley lines, Chinatown, and the Geary Street bus line. The adjoining "Daily Grill" restaurant is elegant and the food's OK, but the service was very slow. The desk staff and concierge were, in general, curt. Not unpleasant, but certainly not welcoming or friendly.

review.title: Great place to stay

review.title: Great Value
review.reviewText: I thought your hotel was a nice place to stay when in San Francisco. You provided an affordable option to an otherwise expensive market. I did appreciate the overall experience and will recommend you to colleages as they travel. Thanks.
review.positiveRemarks: I enjoyed the value of the room with the proximity to the conference center.
review.negativeRemarks: I really disliked the number of panhandlers in Union Square, but that is not a hotel thing.

review.title: Handlery Hotel San Francisco holiday stay
review.reviewText: Everything was fine from arrival to departure staff were willing to assist and the hotel had all the amenities we needed. Best of all though was the location, in the heart of San Francisco
review.negativeRemarks: There was nothng really
review.locationRemarks: Great, right in the central location with easy access to transport if required

review.title: Great Value!
review.reviewText:
Great experience. The room was great - clean and comfortable. I read a lot of reviews that complained about the size of the room. I couldn't disgaree with this more! You're exploring the city, not remaining in the hotel room. It's perfect for a few nights vacation.

Hotel location is perfect. Literally a block away from Union Square. Public transportation spots with in 2 blocks max.

Conceriege staff was VERY helpful.

Restuarant attached the hotel had good food and was perfect for a quick breakfast but was a bit pricey.
review.locationRemarks: Location was great!

review.title: Fun, but not so relaxing.
review.reviewText: The staff was really nice and helpful. Elevators were out, that was inconvenient. Our room smelled like cologne, we thought the smell would go away, but it lingered. The stench would be present every time we stepped foot in the room. What would San Francisco be without protesters? I know San Fran is known for having protests, but waking up at 700a every morning to the sound of chanting and bullhorns really put a damper on our stay at the Handlery. We were forced out of our room every morning, because you couldn't sleep through the protest, even with the earplugs provided by the hotel :-/ Overall great location and friendly staff. Protesters at 7am, boo!
review.negativeRemarks: PROTESTERS

review.title: Location, location, location
review.reviewText: The Handlery has a *great* location, just minutes from Union Square. It is also a close walk to the nearest BART. We stayed in a 'petite' room in the older part of the hotel - the room was clean and fine for the price we paid. Top tip - you can get free WiFi at Macys and Starbucks, so you don't need to pay for this at the hotel. We would stay here again and recommend it to friends.
review.negativeRemarks: Small room and stayed in the older part of the hotel
review.locationRemarks: 2 minutes walk from Union Square

review.title: A+++
review.reviewText: great price for a very nice hotel. staff were really nice & very helpful too.
review.positiveRemarks: the service & the comfort of the room
review.negativeRemarks: size of the room
review.locationRemarks: central to everything... shops, bars, cafes.

review.title: Location, Location, Location
review.reviewText:
My husband and I frequently spend one night in San Francisco to see a show or dine with friends. The Handlery is the perfect, centrally located place for that. It's one block from the Geary (ACT) and Curran theaters, as well as right in the Union Square shopping area. You can walk to some of the best shopping in the city, major art galleries, and great restaurants such as Zingari, Fresh Crush, Scala's Bistro, and Kuleto's. A couple of blocks away you'll find shopping and dining options in Chinatown, or across Market St., SOMA restaurants & museums.

Our room was small, but quite adequate. The queen bed was comfy and the flat-screen TV provided a way to keep up on the news. The bathroom was spacious and completely remodeled. The hotel has a swimming pool (yes, in San Francisco!), a fitness room, and a nice restaurant, The Daily Grill. We had a glass of wine in their bar that evening, and a nice breakfast there the next morning. The dinner menu leans toward comfort food and is not particularly expensive considering its location in the heart of the city. Do tell them you don't want the room next to the soda and ice machines. Someone woke us up at 2:00 a.m. Otherwise, a wonderful stay!
review.negativeRemarks: Room next to the ice machine. . .
review.locationRemarks: The best possible!

review.title: Had everything we needed.
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel for four nights in late March 2012. I had read that it was all about location and this hotel is in the right place! We were able to jump on the cable car to Fisherman's wharf, walk to the shops and to China town and grab a cab out the front of the hotel. The rooms were very clean, spacious and comfortable. The kids loved the heated pool, and I was pleased the outdoor heaters were on, so I could sit on the lounge read and check my emails, while they swam. A great place to stay.
review.positiveRemarks: The kids would say the heated pool
review.negativeRemarks: The stairs, particularly after a long day,
review.locationRemarks: Perfect!

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: We only stayed one night and it was everything we wanted. The only downer was that the parking attendant was very rude when we asked to get something out of our car.
review.negativeRemarks: parking attendant
review.locationRemarks: right next to the trolley lines

review.title: Nice hotel near Union Square.
review.reviewText: Great location with easy access to cable car stop, mass transit, and easy walking distance to major shopping (Westfields Mall, Macy's, etc.) and nice restaurants. Starbuck's was just across the street from our room on O'Farrell, as well as a great Irish pub that had dueling pianos on Thurs. night. One of the few hotels we found that offered one room with two queen size beds which was a must for this tall family of two adults and two teenagers trying to keep costs down in the expensive city by the bay.
review.positiveRemarks: Location. Friendly and efficient front lobby staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Our room was right next to the elevator, so the noise was a factor. Housekeeping came by at an irritating 8:30a.m.

review.title: Nice feel.
review.reviewText: Very nice feel. Old on the outside but very comfortable and new on the inside.

review.title: Great bargain for location
review.reviewText: Hotel was way niceer than I anticipated considering location right in union square. Parking pricey, but what's new in s.f. Only complaint was the bed was a little hard, & hips were stiff in morning! we stayed at a competitor down the street, & rooms were smaller & really in need of an upgrade.(did include parking, though). We stayed in the "premier" side, so I have no idea if the other side is as nice.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location for shopping & dining. Staff very helpful.No problem to leave luggage there while you shop & eat after ck out.
review.negativeRemarks: the bed. too hard.
review.locationRemarks: See above

review.title: Nice Place to stay in downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: Staff were very helpful and pleasant. Our accommodations were very nice. We were very pleased with our overall stay.

review.title: Handlery has a great location
review.reviewText: This hotel is just in a great part of the city. Very easy to Bart, Muni, Cable Cars, just blocks away. If you don't want to dine in the hotels restaurant there is a restaurant next door that has all kinds of delicious food that I'm sure would please the pickiest to the biggest eater. The bathroom is tiny but the hotels location makes up for that. I would've given the staff and service a 5 but was alittle disappointed in the consierge. He seemed he didn't want to be bothered and being a newcomber to the area he could've given better bus directions than he did. Overall we had our best hotel stay in a three city stay at this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The public transportation was all close
review.negativeRemarks: The Consierge
review.locationRemarks: Location was great. Three blocks from Cable Cars, BART and Muni, all of which you can use to get around the city and BART to/from the airport.

review.title: Great location at a good price
review.reviewText: Great location in SF at a good price. Room was clean and the staff very friendly. Restaurants nearby are great...if you like mexican food..eat at Calibris and get the mole sauce
review.negativeRemarks: bring extra cash because Macy's is less than a block away

review.title: Very pleased.
review.reviewText: Pleasant experience in all regards: The surrounding, the quality, the size (not a huge hotel, but not small), the service (very cheerful and helpful). Don't forget to look in on the pool; a great place to hang out.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent .

review.title: Luxury at an Affordable Price
review.reviewText: Our room was perfect. It had a very modern, classy feel to it. I appreciated the vanity area with the make up mirror. The staff was polite and efficient from check in to check out. I would definitely stay at the Handlery Union Square hotel on my next stay in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: My favorite was the room itself. It was clean, classy and comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: My least favorite? There was nothing to complain about. It's all good.
review.locationRemarks: The location was very convenient. It was located very close to Union Square.

review.title: A little disappointed
review.reviewText:
The rooms are average. The windows are not sound proof and we were woken up several times at night from the noises from the street. To top it, they don't have curtains on the windows, so the light hit us in the eyes at sunrise and obviously there was no sleeping after that. The blinds do not keep the sun out.
The shower was bad too. There was hardly any pressure.
They have a good property at a great location. I suggest to spend some $$ and make it more comfortable for the guests since they charge almost the same as The Westin, St. Francis next door.

review.title: No free wi-fi
review.reviewText: Room was loud. biggest complaint = no free wi-fi. come on, really? it's 2012 and you're a hotel in the high-tech capitol of the world and you want me to pay for wi-fi?
review.positiveRemarks: that I had my iPhone with me so I didn't have to pay for wi-fi.
review.negativeRemarks: that they wanted me to pay for wi-fi.

review.title: handlery
review.reviewText: Great location, big bathroom for a San Francisco hotel!
review.negativeRemarks: had to check out at noon
review.locationRemarks: near union square

review.title: Hotel was great, amenities need work.
review.reviewText:
I dropped the overall to 3 because they lacked free internet service. San Francisco is the hub of the technology sector and when much less expensive hotels are offering free wi-fi service, it is very disappointing when the more upscale ones don't. They also charged to use the business center unless you were printing boarding passes.

The restaurant attached to the hotel seemed nice but the prices were a bit ridiculous. Breakfast prices were a bit high for simple dishes such as the typical 2 eggs, toast and bacon for 13 bucks. A few doors up was a decent diner with much more reasonable prices.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable bed, close proximity to downtown San Francisco and the friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Lack of free internet.
review.locationRemarks: Location was great. Less than a mile from the conference center and plenty of good eats nearby.

review.title: Perfect for me.
review.reviewText: The hotel ranks with W and Marriott but at about $100 cheaper per night. I love the fact that the premier rooms have balconies. The location is great as well. This is the 2nd year that I have stayed at the Handlery while attending a Conference at the Moscone Center.

review.title: Handlery is the place to stay and price is right

review.title: Great hotel for the money

Great location half a block from Union Square.

review.title: decent, older hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: This is a decent, older hotel in a great location. 1/2 block from Union square; 10 min walk to Moscone Convention Center. The double-bed room I was in was small, but clean with a nice bed. Room service was very good the one time I ordered.

review.title: A pleasant stay at the Handlery hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was very easy to find as it was just off Union Square (very close to Macy's). It was in a good location for sightseeing as it was close to a BART and Muni station and the cable car passed close by. The hotel itself was clean, tidy and quite nicely decorated. The staff were pleasant and knowledgeable. All in all, a pleasant hotel to spend a couple of nights.
review.negativeRemarks: Being on the eigth floor meant that I didn't get a lot of road noise, but I could still here it.
review.locationRemarks: Very near Union Square in San Francisco

review.title: Pleasant!
review.reviewText:
The Handlery in Union Square is a comfortable, cozy place. The staff is very accommodating, pleasant and polite. We stayed in a room in the historic section of the hotel facing Geary St. with great big windows, and it can be quite noisy, as it was when we were there. There were workers from another hotel on strike across the street and they started chanting shouting promptly at 7 a.m. both mornings we were there (this was on a weekend!), but the kind woman at the front desk had warned us about this and had supplied us with earplugs, which reduced the noise from the strike to a murmur that was barely noticeable.

The hotel is situated in the perfect spot! Many attractions are within walking distance from it, and it's surrounded by all the great shops, restaurants, bars and clubs in the Union Square area, and it's close to a couple of Bart stations.

review.title: Very good!
review.reviewText: We had a very good stay there. The hotel is in a great location (1 block from Union Square) and there is everything you need right there for you. The room is very clean and comfortable and the service from the hotel staff is very good. The only negative point I can think of it is that you have to pay to use the internet, but besides that, it was a very good stay. I would recommend. Thanks.

review.title: Great location but...
review.reviewText:
Staff are very helpful and courteous. Lots of good restaurants in the area. A few blocks walk from the Moscone Convention Center, close to Union Square (1/2 block) and 2 blocks from BART. Also bus, trolley and cable cars very close. Good parking at the hotel and leave/return anytime without extra charges. Rooms have flat screen TV and coffee maker. Pool for kids and exercise room for adults. Barber shop on the premises. Free WiFi. What's not to like?

1. It's an old hotel and hasn't been upgraded for awhile. Wood floors (under the carpet) creak loudly. Bathrooms could use a bit more cleaning attention.
2. Room was quite small for 2 people (queen bed) barely room to find a place for one bag, let alone two.
3. Stuffy ventilation - couldn't cool the room enough at night even with AC at lowest setting in January.
4. Hallways are a maze and getting to the garage requires stairs, elevators and many turns. Might be a good idea to let a bellhop help you with your luggage.
5. Garage was pricey - $39/day.
6. Even though this is considered an historic hotel, I felt the price for the room left much to be desired.

review.title: OK, but that smell...
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was congenial. The fitness center leaves much to be desired; a few tread mills and some dumbells. The location of the hotel is good - close to many restaurants. Biggest complaint was that the hotel has a musty smell throughout, and in the rooms.

review.title: bad taste
review.reviewText: Everything was good, except that when we ordered room service, we placed the original order and called a couple minutes later to add one orange juice to it. They charged us a second service fee on top of the regular cost. The orange juice ended up costing $9.54 because of that second fee. That really left a bad taste in our mouth, so to speak... Otherwise everything was nice.
review.positiveRemarks: Very nice room for the price.
review.negativeRemarks: room service fees
review.locationRemarks: very nice location

review.title: Don't stay here
review.reviewText: This was not the romantic getaway hotel that has been advertised over and over on the radio. Thin walls, floors cracking, and you can hear everything!! Party was allowed to continue all night, security came back and back and nothing was done. Needless to say my wife and I got no sleep or felt like there was privacy. So disappointing. Complained that night and during checkout and just a simple ok..... Where has customer service gone!!!

review.title: Great location, mediocre rooms
review.reviewText: small, noisy room didn't allow for any movement or relaxation in the room, but ok if its only a place for resting. will probably try another hotel next time.

review.title: Value for money, basic hotel, not glamorous but practical and in a good location for a short stay.
review.reviewText:
Had 2 days in San Francisco and wanted a cheaper hotel in a good location.
This hotel met that requirement.
review.locationRemarks: Union square is a good central location.

review.title: Close to union square
review.reviewText: Simple hotel but decent price close to union square shopping and cable cars. but not very luxury. the air conditioning kinda sucked. old part of hotel better than newer part.,

review.title: Disappointed at the Handerly in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Old hotel and it felt that way. Also, too expensive for the condition of the hotel and parking was about $40. If you can put up with the drunks and the smell of weed in the area, you might enjoy the local shopping. I will not stay at this hotel or area again.

review.title: The world's tiniest bathroom! AVOID ROOM 210!!
review.reviewText:
I had stayed here in 2008 and loved it. So, when planning this year's trip I considered staying at the Handlery again. When my first choice (The Orchard) didn't fall within my budget, I decided to return to the Handlery.

First, you can't beat the location. It's on Geary just off of Powell, so you have good access to cable cars (NEVER call them trolleys!), buses, shopping, taxis, and restaurants of every stripe. Chinatown is a few blocks away and you can walk to North Beach and even the Wharf if you are ambitious.

Second, the staff is gracious and pleasant. There were a few hiccups (my feather free room still had the down comforter on the bed when I arrived, and I had a devil of a time trying to get a knife so that I could slice some cheese when I wanted to have dinner in my room one night) but the room was clean and the front desk staff very helpful.

My chief complaint--and it's big-- was my bathroom. I had stayed here before so I knew the room was small, and in many old fashioned hotels the bathrooms are not very big, but THIS WAS OUTRAGEOUS. The shower was so small I could not turn around under the water without being up against the curtain. I do not see how an average sized adult male could shower in there.

For a 5 night stay, this was VERY uncomfortable. 3/4 baths are NOT mentioned on their website. It was a case of "stick it to the Expedia Guest."
I doubt I would ever go back.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, because it is centrally located and well populated regardless of the time of year. If you are unfamiliar with the city you want to have good access to every thing and be able to be on the sidewalk after dusk. Union Square is ALWAYS busy!

review.title: Convenience to shopping good
review.reviewText: Room was extremely hot. I reserved king bed, got a double.

review.title: The surprise GEM!
review.reviewText:
We loved our stay at the Handlery. The room we were given was sooo large it actually felt like a two room suite compared to most in the city. The kids had their own area and we had ours, each with our own tv's. The hotel was very quiet and a perfect location for food, shopping and the tree lighting. The pool was actually heated too at the end of November. The hotel is older though but well kept. It actually has character and some unique things to explore for kids.

The only drawbacks...small bathroom and the view. We hardly spent time in the room though so I really didn't mind.

Our room number I will keep secret though because I will request this room on every return visit:) We were very happy and we will be back.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square

review.title: would definately book again at the Handlery when in San Francisco!!!
review.reviewText: the Handlery is very CLEAN and EXCELLENT location!! everything within "walking distance" , nightclubs, union square, restaurants/coffee, shopping, china town, the trolley and F train that both take you to Fisherman's Wharf and boat tours for Alcatraz and Golden Gate bridge also a bus stop that takes you to Candlestick Park aswell, all this so easly accessable from the Handlery!!!!
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown is the closest to the Handlery , lots of shopping , massage/foot reflexology to end the evening and on the other side of shopping strip is the market strip which is nothing but locals and has the best authentic chinese food !!

review.title: Great hotel great location
review.reviewText: The room size and location were great - I had heard the hotel rooms in San Francisco were small but ours was big enough for both of us and our two teenaged sons. The room we had faced the pool area, which I would recommend if possible because the city is very noisy. The service was very good and all the staff extremely friendly. When we asked about a corkscrew they immediately sent someone up to open our wine and also provided us with two wineglasses. You can't get much closer to Union Square and the shopping in the neighbourhood.
review.locationRemarks: Highlights of our trip were biking over the Golden Gate Bridge and also the trip to Alcatraz. For a family with young children a hotel closer to Pier 39 and all the activities in that neighbourhood may be a better location.

review.title: Great location but very tiny rooms.
review.reviewText: The location is fantastic. This hotel is right smack in the heart of union square. Excellent for those who plan to do a little shopping while on their trip. However, the rooms are a bit cramped so be prepared. We didn't spend much time in our room though so it wasn't a huge concern. Not far from cable car and bus stops. I would definitely stay there again.
review.locationRemarks: I recommend spending time on Fisherman's Wharf, going to Alcatraz Island and going on a Napa Valley or Sonoma Valley wine tour.

review.title: Old, outdated hotel with incompetent staff
review.reviewText: Parking was a nightmare. Was told 3 different things by 3 different staff on parking charges for their garage. Let me just tell you, they surprise you with a 'small print' of extra charges. Front desk was rude and unfriendly, rolled their eyes when I check in/asked for help. Concierge was rude and not helpful, this being my first time in SF, I had a lot of questions. Isn't that what a concierge is for? Doorman never helped with the door, he was preoccupied .... gossiping with other staff.

review.title: SF weekend
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our stay,however it was a little noisy. Overall, it was pretty good.

review.title: excellent service, efficiency, courtesy
review.reviewText:
Small room but completely adequate. Excellent staff.
Daily Grill-affiliated for reliable room-service or restaurant meals; steps from Union Square and my conference a few blocks away.

review.title: Location, Location, Location
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel was key. It is a full service hotel with some modern updates but it is older and slightly outdated. We stayed in a petite room and were pleased with our accommodations. There was everything we needed in the room including a mini-fridge. The carpet and furniture were newer which was really helpful. The walls and the bathroom were outdated but accomodating. The bathroom and room were generally clean but there was some hair in the shower - which I hate. And the bed only had two pillows, a few more would have been nice. They were able to check us in early, which was great and our room was very quiet. The front desk staff were very nice.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Very clear and comfortable hotel in a great neighbourhood

review.title: what more could ou want for the price
review.reviewText: The main plus point of this hotel is its fantastic location. Right on the doorstep of Union Square yet my petite room was extremely quiet and comfortable. This hotel is what it says it is - a large family run hotel. Clean, comfortable with sufficient mod cons. As a single female I felt very safe in the hotel. I would strongly recommend unless you are looking for 5 star plus which is hardly worth it in a city such a San Francisco where you are hardly in your hotel room - there is too much to see. This is my second stay here and I will be back! The staff were always helpful and friendly.

review.title: Weekend in San Fran
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel, very conveniently located. There is a fabulous restaurant attached that offers good breakfast options, great happy hour and wonderful dinners. The location couldn't be better for easy access to and from BART, shopping, theaters and Union Square. We love how easy it is to get around this area and down to Fisherman's Wharf and AT&T ballpark. The staff was very helpful and very friendly. It was a hot weekend and our room was a little warm, but SF isn't hot very often, so this probably isn't an issue too often! We had an awesome weekend with family and occupied three rooms, all different and all were very nice. We will definitely stay here again.

review.title: Brilliant central location to Union Square
review.reviewText: Could not ask for more centrally located hotel BUT if you are visiting San Fran for leisure and plan to do activities around the Bay, suggest you are better off staying closer to Pier 39. This is a great location for business or serious shopping at high end stores. Bathrooms and hotel overall tired. No fridge in room, no laundry facilities, paying for internet usage. Staff helpful. Recommended to me as "old world charm" - we were allocated to the "modern" section at the back of the hotel which must be circa 1970. Room decor updated recently but bathrooms dated. Beds were very comfortable. Central city location means lots of noise. Very central to range of great eateries as well. Not a cheap accommodation option for leisure travel and could do better.

review.title: acceptable hotel so far
review.reviewText:
I and my firend like the hotel.
The manager was nice and helpful since it was our first time to there.
I will live the same hotel if we travel San Fran again.
the location is good for transport.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The staff at the the Handlery were friendly and helpful. The location was convenient for public transport users. My room was clean but the linen quality wasn't great.

review.title: A bit dated, but clean and comfortable. Great location.
review.reviewText: This quaint older hotel was clean and comfortable just 1 block from Union Square. A bit dated in decor, etc and the bathrooms need upgrading, but it suited our needs well and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it. They could use drapes on the windows though as the room never got completely dark and if that would bother you, as for an interior room. The pool area with the heat lamps was cute and having it's own parking garage (not included in the price of the hotel room) was convenient but still a schlep from garage to lobby.

review.title: Good Hotel, A little dated
review.reviewText: Rooms were great, beds comfy, a little dated. My room was ground floor by the pool and could be loud with passer-byers with rolling luggage on the pool tile.

review.title: Lovely Hoel with one drawback
review.reviewText: Handlery is a lovely hotel; great location just off Union Square. One drawback was restaurant was too small to accommodate everyone staying there who wanted to eat in. But there are loads of diners and slightly more upscale restaurants in the neighborhood for breakfast, so as long as you are willing to walk a short distance for breakfast, a really good deal.

review.title: Geat Location
review.reviewText: The Handlery, although not the newest hotel in the area proved to be a great choice. The staff was obliging and courteous, the hotel was close to major shopping, retaurants, and theatres and the action around and in Union Square was always entertaining.

review.title: TINY room for "2 adults"
review.reviewText: We books the "unpublished" rate room for "2 adults" and they put us in a room with a double bed... really...a double? besides the bed, the room was like 10' by 10' total. The shower was this tiny triangle you couldn't hardly get into. The only reason I reccomended this hotel is that they upgraded us the next night to a normal sized room with a queen bed. Then the stay was very pleasant.

review.title: Good place to stay
review.reviewText: I was pleased with my stay. The hotel room was clean and had a walk-in closet and a large bathroom.

review.title: Great location!!
review.reviewText: Spent 4 nights at the Handlery. Just by chance we met Mr. Handlery upon our arrival and our departure. A true gentleman. This hotel is very clean and the staff are very helpful. The location is outstanding. The cable cars are just down the block. We bought a $27 Muni pass that's goos for 7 days. On our last day we gave it to another couple who has just arrived so they had three free days of travelling with it. We used it for the cable cars, the 'F' train and the regular transit buses. Normally a cable car is $6 one way per person. Lefty O'Douls is next door to the hotel and is very economical and delicious food. Had our breakfasts there every morning and supper once. Be sure to do Alcatraz, Chinatown and walk the Golden Gate Bridge (about a 40 minute walk one way). The transit buses will take you right there (#38L and then transfer to #28). Found ourselves at Fisherman's Wharf 3 of the 4 days. For a great seafood supper at the Wharf, go to Scomas. Chinatown is a 15 minute walk from the hotel. Don't catch the cable car at the final stop. The lineups are very long....walk to the first stop a block away and you'll likely get on right away. Lombard Street is about a block or 2 before the Wharf. The cable car goes right by it. Do the walk up or down the street. We were quite exhausted after 4 days but managed to see everyhting we wanted.

review.title: Nice place!
review.reviewText: However, internet connection should be free of charge

review.title: In the heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Handlery Hotel is centrally located with easy access to all major landmarks. Situated in an up-market part of town, near art galleries and stores such as Saks. Plenty of restaurants in walking distance. Although be aware that car parking is not cheap and neither are their continental breakfasts (if ordering for more than 2)

review.title: In the heart
review.reviewText: Great hotel! Great location!

review.title: Excellent Union Square Hotel
review.reviewText: My stay at the Handlery Union Square Hotel was great. The staff is helpful and kind, the room was comfortable, and the location is wonderful. Highly recommended.

review.title: Cant wait to get back to San Fran for this hotel!
review.reviewText: Handlery Union Square Hotel Has a lovely atmosphere. The staff were very accomodating, and could not of been more helpful. Great location, and wasn't overly priced. Beds were super comfortable also.

review.title: Will definately stay again
review.reviewText: right in the heart of union square!

review.title: Great location, but tiny bathrooms
review.reviewText:
We were only there for 1 night, and maybe that's why they gave us possibly the worst room in the hotel. It was on the fourth floor at the end of the corridor, with a winding staircase beside. It looked like maybe it had been an after thought or where a much larger suite had been divided. The room was small, with a view of a brick wall from the window, but very clean,with a flat screen TV, great bedding and bed, and granite in the bathroom. Unfortunately, the bathroom sink area was so small that when you brushed your teeth, your elbow hit the side of the shower (no, I'm not kidding) No tub, just shower.
It's in a great location, right across the street from Union Square, and the hotel itself was very nice, especially the pool, courtyard area. There were rooms located around the pool with patios or balconies, but I guess we didn't pay enough to get one of those. I'd recommend it for a 1 night stay, but not any longer.
Tip- Try the Irish restaurant next door, Lefty Odoul's. Great food at great prices.

review.title: Handlery Hotel
review.reviewText: Nice downtown hotel, central location.

review.title: Great on a dry day
review.reviewText: Everything was fantastic except that the windowsills are coated in metal and makes a very loud noise when it rains. We we not able to get a good nights sleep as a result. Otherwise, it's a great place for the money!

review.title: convenient, noisy at front
review.reviewText:
Very convenient location to Westfield, tram cars + general, be wary that rooms at front are very noisy to road, we arrived to room we requested not available even booking 6 months ahead due to conference, but could accomodate next day, we took a room at front thinking that king size bed + tiredness would overcome front noise....no dont get fooled.
We were eventually provided room next day but annoyed that missed sleep, staff were very helpful.
Still would recommend.

review.title: Priced high for room we stayed in.
review.reviewText: Room was clean but very small for the price. We booked for three and was hardly room to walk with all of our luggage and we each just had one carry on.

review.title: Will definitely stay again
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed my stay. The location was amazing and the service was awesome. I will difinately recommend this hotel to anyone.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: This little hotel is great. It's older yes but has everything you need and is in a great location to shopping restaurants etc.. If you are looking for a hotel where you can get a good nights sleep and is in a great location then this hotel is right for the money. The room isn't huge but for 2 people its good.

review.title: Pleasant stay for more reasonable money at San Francisco's Union Station
review.reviewText:
I booked because the hotel had a good location and seemed to be a good value. That was what I experienced and I would book it again.

Room was ready when I checked in a little early in the afternoon. I was in a petite room was on 7th floor. It didn't have much of a view, but it was neat and clean. The room was made up well each evening when I got back. Street ambulance noises could get a little loud at times, but otherwise, quiet, stately old hotel room with modern updated furnishings. .

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText:
The reason I chose this hotel is at the time I was searching for my 8 nights stay, this was one of few hotels which had room available. In addition, it is on perfect location and 'good' cleanlinees on traveler's review.

My intention to visit to SF was to take care of my daughter who was sick (she is an international student at a university in SF).

The room was clean, bathroom was perfectly clean. Cleanliness is always my first priority in choosing a hotel to stay.

The building was an old one, however room has been renovated, wallpapers looked new, beds were comfortable. Room carpet was starting to wear out. Mobile phone signal was on-off in the room (room 341), even if it was 'on' it was a weak signal. It was not the case outside the room.

On the second night, the fire alarm went off at about 2 a.m. and it turned out to be a false alarm (after being checked by firefighters). It was a traumatic experience to me.

Overall, if cleanliness and location are priorities (with relatively good price) then I would recommend this hotel.

review.title: "Very nice hotel in a great location"
review.reviewText: Our week's stay at the Handerly Union Square Hotel was a positive one. The staff was excellant and friendly. Our room was very clean and comfortable away from any traffic noise. We were close to easy transportation about the city either by foot or by trolley or bus. I would have liked a room with a more attractive view but we had all the important features which I mentioned . The resturant that was part of the hotel was also attractive and our food was delicious. I would definitly recommend this hotel for a nice stay on a vacation or business trip.

review.title: Great hotel in downtown SF
review.reviewText: Convenient downtown location, spacious and clean room, friendly stuff

review.title: Great location and a very good value
review.reviewText: Room was clean and comfortable, and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Great location, and a good value for the price.

review.title: Handlery was awesome!
review.reviewText: The Handlery hotel in SF Union Square was wonderful. It is very well situated, the staff were very friendly and helpful, and our room was nice and clean and comfortable. I would recommend it highly to anyone visiting SF.

review.title: A great hotel in a great location.
review.reviewText:
We were pleasantly surprised at how updated this hotel was. Our room was in the Premier Wing...a little walk from the Lobby but well worth it. The back entrance was even closer to the Powell St. Bart for our ride to the airport.

We were disappointed that there was a charge to use the computers in the business center. Many hotels include this as part of the rate. Also, the Concierge booked us a restaurant reservation but used his own Open Table account rather than ours (and bragged about it as a way to visit restaurants he recommends) which seemed a little "tacky".

In general the staff was friendly and accommodating.

review.title: Good modestly priced hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText: Nice hotel in every respect; easy access, parking was handy. The next door grill was good for breakfast each day -- quick service and good food. Being at Union Square was convenient, and it was nice to have a modestly priced hotel there.

review.title: Michael & Janis
review.reviewText: Lovely old hotel, rooms are smallish but we love it. And nicely renovated!

review.title: Wonderful
review.reviewText: Perfect

review.title: Best at unión square
review.reviewText: I left my hart there!!!

review.title: Great location, comfortable beds, warm room temperature settings
review.reviewText: Good location for easy access to cable cars and tour buses. Rooms were good sized and had comfortable beds. Only complaint I have is the room temperature. It wouldn't let me adjust it below 68 degrees and that was too warm. I like sleeping in a very cold room. The staff was very professional and accommodating.

review.title: Great location but just a bit tired around the edges
review.reviewText:
We stayed at the Handlery Union Square for four nights in mid January 2011. We found the hotel front desk very welcoming and helpful and they were really obliging with moving us to a new room when we found our original room very noisy. If you are seeking a quiet room I suggest you request a room in the newer part of the hotel and facing the pool (as opposed to the street). While in this newer section of the hotel, our first room faced onto the very busy Geary Street and was also right next to the lifts and vending machines.

The hotel location can't be faulted - it's just a few steps to Union Square and all the shopping/theatre district, and many other San Fran attractions/neighbourhoods are in walking distance.

The hotel itself is looking a little worn now. The original part of the hotel is very old (I can't comment on the rooms as we didn't stay in this section)and even the so-described 'new' section would have been built in the sixties or seventies. The two rooms we had were extremely clean and comfortable - but just a bit tired - little things like leaking toilet cistern and slightly worn carpet. I may just be being picky, but if you're expecting upper end quality, you may be a bit disappointed.

Overall, however, I would recommend this hotel for a clean room at relatively reasonble cost in a handy location.

review.title: Great Location, but noisy and uncomfortabe.
review.reviewText: Hotel is in great location to shops and restaurants, but the rooms are noisy and the beds are very uncomfortable. Road noise is extreme in rooms facing roads. Hotel was generally clean and staff was friendly and attentive.

review.title: Will definitely come back
review.reviewText:
The rates were very reasonable. Proximity to Union Square, BART, cable car, Muni trains/buses made travelling and sightseeing very convenient. The service was great, from the doorman, front desk to housekeeping.

The room was very spacious, well maintained and quiet (even though we had a room facing the street).

The only bad experience we had was the shuttle transport to the airport. We booked via the hotel, and I suppose they are using a third-party service. The driver was the WORST. We should've just taken the BART or a cab.

review.title: San Francisco Downtown
review.reviewText:
** Location fo Hotel is amazing if you want to be downtown.
*** Good access to Cable car, trolley and Bart
*** Parking in area is brutal - don't rent a car unless you are prepared for $40.00/day parking fee.

Concierge was less than helpfull to us for tour/event planning. We ended up doing all research on our own.
Room was adequate but it is an old building so be prepared for that.

Again the location is excellent and I will go back just because of the location to shopping, downtown and public transportation.

review.title: Geat location, Great service, Great hotel
review.reviewText: I have stayed in this hotel 3 times now and find it convenient, friendly and value for money. I am single and travelling for pleasure, it is such a great location. The renovated rooms are obviously better, just take a little longer to get to. I will look forward to returning to the Handlery Hotel.

review.title: Average Hotel
review.reviewText: This was an average hotel. On the plus side it is very close to Union Square, which also means the neighborhood is not the greatest. Condition of the hotel was adequate.

review.title: Old Hotel, but Great location!
review.reviewText: Best word I can use to describe this hotel is, "cute." Our room looked exactly as picture #1 (single bedroom) on Expedia's website. The room was small, our windows faced other room windows-not so happy about that, but the natural lighting that entered our room was fantastic. If you didnt keep your blinds shut (including in the bathroom) another guest across could easily see you. Decor did a good job of making the room look contemporary/modern, as long as the squeaking wood floors didnt bother you as you walked down the hallways of the hotel.Did see the pool-small, but heated-seemed to be a fav of guest's kids. Loved the fact that there is a restaurant-"The Daily Grill" connected to the hotel (you will get room service from here)-just a few feet from the lobby. Seemed to be a popular spot for locals and guests since it was never really empty. And probably the best thing that could be said about this hotel is its LOCATION-right next to Union Square-lots and lots of stores to shop, easy access to public transportation, and easy to get a cab-even though I was told by the bell man that some cabs will refuse local service (they prefer trips to the airport)-the taxi drivers were a bit "rough" with their driving. Considering the price we paid for the hotel stay and its location-well worth it. If you're looking to not spend a fortune, not expect a luxury stay, but rather a comfortable stay-choose this hotel.

review.title: Hotel with great location!
review.reviewText: The Handlery was in a great location with easy access to shopping, restaurants and transportation. It was an old hotel, yet clean and updated very well. We would definitely stay there again. The room and bathroom were a little small, but clean. It was also good for us to have a refrigerator.

review.title: HSF
review.reviewText: This hotel was in prime SF location. Friendly staff. Great SF Style restaurant in the hotel.

review.title: Perfect Location....Perfect Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was extremely close to everything you might need. It's a few minute walk to the BART and a couple minutes away from shopping! The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The heated pool was a nice bonus feature for the kids. The rooms were a little small, but worked. We didn't have a view (we were looking straight into other rooms) but we also didn't have the noise of the streets. Overall great hotel and perfect location! I would stay again!

review.title: A hotel worth giving a chance too
review.reviewText: The room was very nice with two beds and very comfortable. A lot people complained about the bathroom size? Yes it's smaller compared to new modern hotels but the fixtures and eveything else was top notch.

review.title: Wonderful small hotel with a terrific location
review.reviewText: My daughter and I had a wonderful "getaway" at this hotel. The concierge, especially, was so helpful. We would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText:
The hotel was very central in the shopping and gallery area. The staff were very coureous and helpful. Rooms were comfortable and spotlessly clean, although the veiw form the window was of a air duct and brick wall! Bathroom was tiny but clean.

I would definately reccommend this hotel and would go back.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Handlery Union Square Hotel was fantastic! It's located just minutes from Union Square, Starbucks, Niketown, Bart Station, Cable car, great restaurants,etc. The staff was courteous and friendly. The room was very clean and tastefully decorated. if you plan to visit San Francisco, I would highly recommend staying here.

review.title: Great Stay at the Handlery Union Square Hotel
review.reviewText: Everything about the Handlery Hotel made the price such a deal. The Handlery was quiet and peaceful. The room was beautifully decorated, adding to the joyful comfort of just sitting in the room and reading. Will stay there the next visit to San Francisco and recommend it to everyone.

review.title: Very central, clean and comfortable.
review.reviewText: Very quiet, comfortable, clean, central and the staff are very friendly and helpful.

review.title: location, location, location
review.reviewText: Perfect location, pleasant quiet room overlooking air shaft, excellent beds, very pleasant service, slightly down at the heels elevators, excellent rates. Overall, excellent value.

review.title: low profile, high value
review.reviewText: This is a classic urban hotel, a well maintained older building with a good amount of character. Rooms are smaller as typical of this era, reminds e of the former Gramercy in NYC. Furnishings, TV, etc. high end and modern. Nice bar and restaurant in hotel, many others within a very short walk. Five minute walk fro Bart, which takes you right to the airport . Expedia prices made this a very good value and solid place to stay.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel was perfect and the staff was friendly. The only complaint would be the comfort of the room as the room temperature was too warm and we had the A/C running the entire time.

review.title: Lovely spot, spot on
review.reviewText: I booked a petite room, which was the perfect size (and price!) since I wasn't going to be spending much time in it, anyway. The bed was comfortable, the window opened (wide!) ... everything was just great.

review.title: A great little hotel in downtown NYC
review.reviewText: We loved our stay here! When we arrived the staff were so friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean, linen was lovely and beds were very comfortable.

review.title: Great Hotel and Great Location !!
review.reviewText: Central to so much and hotel staff was wonderful and the staff always had great recommendations on where to go. We upgraded to a suite, highly recommend that...it just made that much difference for living space, even though you think you are not there much...it made a difference for us. Beds were comfortable and room was very clean, two flat screens in our room. The only complaint we had was...we could not seem to get our room to cool off enough for us. But, not enough of a reason to not go back, we would stay there again.

review.title: A nice hotel in a convenient location
review.reviewText:
If you plan to visit San Francisco without a car, this hotel is in a very good position as you can walk your way to downtown or take a cable car to get to the hills and fisherman's wharf (the cable car station is only a couple of blocks away). also, you are right in the middle of the shopping area and the BART station is close.
The rooms and the service are neat, so I'd definitely suggest to pick this hotel for your San Francisco stay!

review.title: Excellent place to stay
review.reviewText:
All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful from the moment I arrived. The hotel was very clean, and the room exactly as described. Ideal for a single traveller. This Hotel is also very close to the O'Farrell street Hire Car return garage which many companies seem to use and therefore idea for those arriving or departing for a road trip.
The Hotel was within easy walking distance from everything you need and close to transport links to take you every where you want to get in San Francisco. I would use this Hotel again when visiting the City.

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: Had a renovated room. Small but perfect. Will definitely stay here in the future.

review.title: great experience
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice and conviently located within walking distnace of union square. The staff were very helpful and accomidating. I would definitly stay here again.

review.title: Good location in SF down town
review.reviewText:
nothing to say hotel was very good, very well located , pool is Ok not very large and after 6.30pm, it is a little cold. buit the watrer temp is very highg so ...

for the car park try to negociate, otherwise you cn find cheaper one close to the hotel (not so much)

review.title: Great location, amazing concierge but small room.
review.reviewText:
The concierge Dale was amazingly helpful. We contacted him before our visit and his advice was outstanding. Thanks, Dale.

Location was perfect for our 3 night stay.

review.title: well done
review.reviewText: very impressed........................unlike any other SF hotel

review.title: great location, nice hotel
review.reviewText: very nice and affordable. perfect location, right in the epicenter of union square. would recommend if you want to be close to shopping, theatre, and good restaurants.

review.title: Good location, convenient
review.reviewText:
The only dissapointment was that there was no WiFi available. The hotel computers required a fee to use by an outside vendor.
No provided breakfast. There was a restuaraunt attatched by a hallway to the hotel.
The windows from our room looked upon other room windows of the hotel, forming a type of square courtyard or something down below - we were on the 5th floor. So no view of the city.

review.title: Good hotel, great location
review.reviewText:
The hotel is very nice and clean. The room was smaller than I expected, but it was fine. The A/C didn't work very well. It was a warm weekend in SF and although I set the temp lower when we arrived, by the time we left the next day the room was still quite warm.
The location is excellent. Very close to Union Square, the cable car line, theatres, and many resturants.
I do plan on returning to this hotel.

review.title: very nice SF hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent stay, heart of the shopping area with great access to transportation to take you anywhere in city.

review.title: Great location, Friendly staff!
review.reviewText: Excellent location. One block from cable car stop and the opentop sightseeing buses. Close to shopping and several places to eat. The hotel was clean and comfortable and very easy to get around. Staff was helpful and very friendly especially the concierge.

review.title: Satisfied and would return.
review.reviewText: The staff was very polite and attentive. The rooms were fairly small but nice and clean. Great location being in the middle of Union Sqaure. The hallways can be somewhat eerie with a slight haunting due to its old history. Enjoyed out stay here, would come back again.

review.title: Best Place, Best Location, Best Value
review.reviewText:
Second time in this hotel, excellent location, friendly staff and good package deal. Will definitely book it again.

One block away from Cable Car stop and department stores.

review.title: That's Frisco
review.reviewText: the only thing that I didnt care for was the noise at 2am on the street below, they were picking up the trash and cleaning the street and our room was kind of lighted from the outside lights, even with the curtains drawn. oh yah, had problems with the AC, it wouldnt get cold enough so I opened the window

review.title: Unexpected pleasant surprise.
review.reviewText: Closer than we thought to Union Sq. just doors away. Decorated nicely for the holidays, friendly staff. a bit of a walk to the new section and stairs, but freight elevator was ok, for handicapp. just 1 floor. sheltered from the street noise which is great, but if you want quiet, don't go into the new tower too high, stay on north side of pool away from Restaurant fans if you want to open your windows. rooms have a balcony in new section, so you can sit outside and breath. private. huge room, lots of pillows. we didn't need our down pillows. restaurant was a bit hi for breakfast, but good, and convenient. Garage is handy, beneath the backside and elevator direct, rather than a walk for other hotels. we'll go again, and room rates were much better than others, being on sale in December.

review.title: "Wonderful San Francisco Location"
review.reviewText: This was our first trip to SF. Handerly is conveniently located right at Union Square. Very close to shopping, food, trolley's. Would definitely recommend this hotel. Location, Location, Location. Staff was always very helpful in booking tours for us. Can't say enough about our experience.

review.title: cant wait to go back to san francisco again
review.reviewText: the best

review.title: Ron
review.reviewText: decent hotel

review.title: Cozy Stay
review.reviewText: My husband and I had a short get away for our anniversary and we stayed at the Handlery. The staff were great, the room was clean and cozy (petite room) and the location couldn't be better. I'd recommend it to anyone.

review.title: Will most definitely come back!
review.reviewText: Excellent location. Perfect for a pleasure trip. My mother and I enjoyed our stay. Will bring back our spouces and stay at the Handlery Union Square Hotel.

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: This hotel was nice and is right in the middle of Union Square, close to BART and all modes of transportation. The Daily Grill Restaurant bar down below is great for a night cap!

review.title: I'd go again and request the same room
review.reviewText: I had a lovely art-deco room overlooking Geary street, 4th floor. A live band played music on the street corner on the weekend evenings and they were good, so I could sit on my bed and enjoy live music. If one didn't care for that, request a room toward the back or away from there. The street is lined with art galleries, and good places to eat are abundant. I highly recommend Cafe Mason, at 320 Mason Street, just a block or so away around the corner. My hotel room was lovely, the housekeepers were exemplary. I had to go down a floor for ice, but couldn't remember to tell the hotel staff, so it didn't matter to me. I loved the place.

review.title: nice place to stay-conveniently located
review.reviewText: clean and convenient

review.title: Great for walkers
review.reviewText: Great location! Price is right!

review.title: Great for price
review.reviewText: I had the petite room and it was tiny, but perfect for my needs. The hotel is very close to Union Square and shopping. I would go back in a heartbeat. Staff was friendly and accomodating.

review.title: Very Pleasant Stay
review.reviewText: I loved the Handlery! Location was great. No need for a rental car if simply touring the city. Public transportation is cheap by comparison and this hotel is right in the center of all of it. The only problem we had is we couldn't get washclothes replaced by housekeeping unless we called. Didn't quite get that but it was the only issue we had. The staff was great. The room was great though a bit small, but hey, we weren't running track or anything in it. We would return without a second thought.

review.title: Location, Location, Location!
review.reviewText: This hotel location could not be any better,the staff was kind and helpful, we totally enjoyed our stay at the handlery.

review.title: Our new go to hotel
review.reviewText: My wife and I and two kids loved the hotel. Originally we had booked one nights stay and enjoyed it so much we extended for an additional night. The location was perfect and we were able to use public transit or walk to every thing we wanted to see. In fact, we enjoyed it so much we are now looking into staying at the San Diego Handerly in the near future.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Everything is close to this location, no need to be driving around. The televisions are outdated though, and the pool closes at 8:00pm. But overall the stay was enjoyable.

review.title: Uncomfortable beds and no A/C.
review.reviewText: My Fiance and I stayed here for Labor Day weekend. The room was clean but very uncomfortable. We kept waking up in the middle of the night with back aches because of the bed. Also, the rooms A/C wasn't working and kept the room uncomfortably warm. The hotel gave us a fan but never offered to switch rooms. However, the hotel was in the middle of downtown. Shopping, cable cars, and restaurants all within walking distance.

review.title: Brilliant Location
review.reviewText: Location of the hotel was brilliant. Right in Union Square. Excellent for shopping and eating. Close to Tram. Great spot to stay

review.title: Very Central
review.reviewText: The number one reason to choose this is hotel is because it is very central. Yes it has a pool - which was OK...although leaves from the trees were sometimes in the pool for a day or two before it was cleaned. But the big problem I had was the exorbitant charge for parking in their garage. More than you would pay in London, New York or Seattle.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Stayed here for 4 nights with family in one of the Club rooms. The room was good and ample space for all 4 of us. The hotel staff were all very helpful and friendly. The location is perfect for the shops and restaurants around Union Square and also very near the stops for the streetcars and cable cars to travel around the rest of San Francisco.

review.title: First Visit to SF
review.reviewText: My first time in San Francisco was such a wonderful surprise - the staff at the hotel went out of their way to make my stay as pleasant as possible. My room (Petite) was very comfortable for one person. Room Service was very efficient with polite friendly staff. The only bad spot was that people appeared to be using the pool after 8:00 p.m. (closing for pool activities) and were noisy. I didn't like to complain. Overall I would definitely stay and the Handerly Union Square Hotel again on my next trip to SF.

review.title: Very nice European style and great location
review.reviewText: Our family really enjoyed our stay. The rooms are small but very comfortable and clean. The TV is small, but while in S.F. we had very little need of watching it. The location is great! Very near shopping, lots of restaurants, galleries, and to public transportation. Great city experience to step outside your hotel and be in the middle of everything. There is a pool located in a nice quiet courtyard, and it was just barely warm enough outside to use it in August. The hotel staff were very helpful and nice. Would recommend it for families or couples.

review.title: Close to shops
review.reviewText: Close to Union Square. Walking distance to shops and cable cars. Our room wasn't ready so we had drinks and a snack paid for in the restaurant. Front desk very apologetic but it didn't take too long and by the time we had eaten the room was ready. Nice clean room.

review.title: Great hotel, good price and awesome location
review.reviewText: This was my first time to San Francisco and the hotel was recommended by a friend. It was a great hotel, very large rooms and very reasonable price. It was right off Union Square so close to shops as well as trains and cable cars. Was a good base to explore San Francisco, definitely recommend this hotel to any visitors, especially with the reasonable price.

review.title: Feel at Home
review.reviewText: Over the last 16 years, I have been back to this hotel many times, and with each visit, it feels right at home. I just love th location, and the fact it is very close to Macy's.

review.title: San Francisco is a great city !
review.reviewText: We loved our stay in San Francisco. The location od the Handerly Hotel was very good. We stayed in the older section onthe hotel and I do not recomend staying in this section. From what I understand is the newer section is better, however we had to upgrade with a cost to change our room.

review.title: Will return to this one!
review.reviewText: Near everything, breakfast, lunch or dinner within 1/2 to 3 blocks with all kinds of different restaurants; very comfortable beds, great room, clean!

review.title: Nice location and very helpful staff
review.reviewText: Within walking distance of Main shopping area and China town and very convenient

review.title: 2nd time I've been there in would go back in a heartbeat
review.reviewText: Friendly Vewry clean Convenient location to shopping, food, and entertainment Good service

review.title: Extremely Satisfied
review.reviewText: We spend four nights at the Handley Union Square and were extremely satisfied. The room was small but very neat and clean. We make the reservation on line at a very good rate. We could have had a larger room but elected not too. As we spent very little time in the room. Everyone we came in contact with was very friendly and helpful. We worked with two of the concierge and both were very very helpful in setting up several trips for us. They did a super job and did not mind how many questions I had for them. When we return to Sanfransco, we will be sure to return to the Handley. Rudy & Jean

review.title: Golden oldie
review.reviewText: The Handlery is housed in an old building, and the woodwork is layered with generations of paint, and the elevator rattles. But it is comfortable (especially the excellent beds), and very conveniently located half a block from Union Square. We have stayed there before and will stay there again next time we visit SF.

review.title: LOCATION WAS PERFECT!!
review.reviewText: Talk about a great location, i am 20 years old and wanted a romantic getaway, and lets just put it this way... i got one! The service at the hotel was great, always a pleasure to talk to.

review.title: Top Notch Service, Not Amazing Rooms
review.reviewText: I booked my stay at Handlery through Expedia. As I was traveling myself, and price was a consideration - I went for a petite room. The location is amazing, just half a block from Union Square, some 3 blocks from China town, 3 blocks from BART station and Market St. The rooms are pretty basic (and petite...) and lack free internet, but they are quite clean and welcoming; The only problem is the noise. The first room was right behind the elevator shaft, which banged continuously, accounting for a bad night. Next day I asked for another room, and they were nice enough to find me a similar, but more quiet room, and did so with a smile. Got to give them credit for that!

review.title: Handlery Hotel Union Square
review.reviewText: Although this is an old hotel, it is very well maintained. Location is great for shopping.

review.title: Happy Traveler
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Handlery for 4 nights April 14-17, 2009. The staff was very helpful and friendly and the room was comfortable with everything you would need in a compact space. Only problem was the room had a musty smell since it was in the Historic part of the hotel and the bathroom could have been cleaner.

review.title: Excelent location
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, good service

review.title: Great staff!
review.reviewText: Everyday of my 5 day stay was consistently pleasant. The staff took care of everything that I needed as quickly as possible. It's not fancy but my room was spacious had everything that I needed. The location is great! Right near Union Square, Market Street and the Cable Car turnaround.

review.title: Reasonable boutique setting
review.reviewText: This hotel has character-- the room I was in wasn't your typical hotel setting in terms of decor. It was simple, perhaps a little old fashioned, but had all the essentials. The staff was very good.

review.title: Great hotel in central location would recommend to others.
review.reviewText: We loved the Handlery it was clean, comfortable and in a great location. The hotel staff were very pleasant and helpful. We particularly appreciated an early check in following an overnight flight. We would really have appreciated a kettle and some fresh milk in the fridge. Tea drinkers are not really catered for, they did bring us kettle when we asked but we ended up going to the local shop for milk. Room service wanted to charge $6 for a glass. The only other small issue was around the swimming pool, there were no robes in the room or changing facilities around the pool, if you wanted a swim it meant dripping your way back to the room. But these points are only minor issues and points for improvement. We were more than satisfied with the hotel and its amenities and would have no hesitation in recommending it to other travellers.

review.title: Quiet, comfortable, and centrally located
review.reviewText: I was assigned a room on the 4th floor overlooking an inner courtyard, which meant that the noise of Union Square was entirely filtered out. This is always a plus for me, as I don't spend enough time in hotels to enjoy a view; I just want a good night's sleep. The hotel staff is courteous and friendly, and food at the Daily Grille is excellent.

review.title: Pass on this
review.reviewText: I got what I paid for. I thought this hotel had great prices but the old saying proved true. The room itself had been smoked in although it was marked as a none smoking room. The walls were partially painted as if a quick fix had been made. I ordered room service for 9:00am. I called the front desk at 9:30 and they were clueless. An incorrect order finally showed up at 9:50. Although I had a 12:00 check out, the maid came to my door twice to see if I was still there.

review.title: Location, Location, Location
review.reviewText: This hotel was in the best possilbe location. Shopping like no other. Food everywhere was to die for. Easy to get to all area's and close to other transportation. The staff was over the top helpful. Give us great suggestions and help booking tours.

review.title: Needs Upgrade
review.reviewText: The staff was excellent and the bed had been upgraded but the rest of the room was dated and the TV was a complete joke. It was a tiny old set that discouraged use. No one would pay to watch a movie on that old piece of junk. The location is obviously the best feature. Parking is ridiculous at $38 and then they add tax!

review.title: Better than expected
review.reviewText: I really liked this hotel and found it was better than expected for the price.

review.title: great location and more
review.reviewText: The hotel is non-smoking which is a great plus and the beds are comfortable.

review.title: Very happy with Hotel, will definately reccommend!
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Handlery for our final few nights in America (of a 4.5 week trip!) in a Club Suite. We found the hotels location to be perfect, very close to shopping and very easy to navigate to other areas. The cable car stops virtually out the front of the hotel which is fantastic. All meals we had in the hotel restaurant and room service were fantastic, they were also very well priced. This hotel is extremely well priced and suited to families although we are a young couple with no children, we still enjoyed our stay. This hotel is very good value for money!

review.title: very convenient and pleasant
review.reviewText: We really appreciated the convenience of being close to so many things and public transportation- which is great in SF. The hotel was pleasant tho our room was on the street side so there was some noise. Several good restaurants in the immediate area as well as the ACT theater.

review.title: Three nights in the Handlery Union Square Hotel
review.reviewText: A comfortable hotel in an excelent location, if a little pricey considering we stayed out of season.

review.title: a good hotel to stay at downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: clean,nice room, good service, but no good window view, no free internet service

review.title: Old Favorite
review.reviewText: Ive stayed at this hotel a few times, as I love the location and the charming atmosphere of the hotel. The only issue is the street noise at night, try and get a room above the 3rd floor. The hotel management should consider sound proofing the lower level floor windows; that would not be too difficult to do.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: The Hotel Handlery is a nice, older hotel. It has a perfect location just off Union Square. The rooms are nicely renovated and it has an outdoor pool so it is a great place for families.

review.title: Extremely good hotel in good location
review.reviewText: Could not fault this hotel.

review.title: Fantastic staff, comfortable rooms, right in the heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText: I had a great time in San Francisco from the moment I stepped foot into the Handerly. The staff there are friendly and will go out of their way to make your stay memorable and pleasant. We had a room with 2 queen beds and it was super comfy and roomy! On the day we checked out, Supershuttle came early to pick us up to take us to the airport. The supershuttle guy threatened to leave in 5 minutes and the lady at the front desk got the concierge to tell the man, that was no way to treat guests!! She got the bellman to help us get our baggage down quickly. In the end, supershuttle waited, and we go to the airport fine. I have no hestitation in recommending this hotel to my friends and family. If I were ever to go back to SF, I would definitely stay at the Handerly again.

review.title: Impressed with this hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel had great service; it was very clean, the staff was friendly, and the room was very comfortable. The only concern was how much the valet parking was; they don't have the option of self-parking.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: hotel in great location, staff great and very friendly,rooms very comfortable and clean. would without hesitation stay at such a nice hotel and would highly recommend

review.title: Overall, though, great room and great stay!
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel for a conference and originally specified 2 double beds as my preference. Then I found out that my fiance was going to visit me. So upon checkin (I was dressed poorly), I asked the Front Desk worker if I could change to a room with a king bed. The worker was not at all accommodating and treated me as if I was wasting his time. Later that night (while dressed up), I decided to ask again, but this time the front desk Manager was working and he told me that I did not have to wait until the next day and that he could get me in a king room that moment. Well, this was the exact opposite of what the other worker had told me earlier. When I moved into the other room that night, it was a huge suite and was beautiful! Other issues: the bell staff did not offer to help me with my many bags during checkin. The bathrooms were never cleaned properly. When I checked in, shaved stubble was all over the sink and the cleaning never got better. The room was always cold, even though the heater went up to a max of 74. Do not get a room on the 2nd floor if you are a light sleeper, it was so loud! However, a room with a view on 4th floor was much better (even though the garbage trucks woke me up around 1am and did not stop until 2:30am). One of the main reasons why I chose this hotel was because of the heated pool. However, the pool was not warm enough to go swimming in the cold SF weather, since it was slightly luke warm.

review.title: Stay here often . . .
review.reviewText: This is my hotel of choice in SF-very close to the theaters, shopping, Chinatown and BART. I have always had excellent service and the rooms are always very clean. The only reason I gave comfort of the room a 4 on this trip was because I was alone and chose a smaller room. The bathroom sink was outside of the bathroom--on the opposite side of the room. I don't know why, but that really annoyed me. To be honest, it is probably just me being too picky, lol. Other than that, for one person my "small" room with a double bed did not seem too small at all.

review.title: Great Hotel in a terrific location
review.reviewText: I stayed here for 4 nights. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Room was small, but very comfortable. Pool was nice. Food was good. Just a block from the Powell/Hyde cable car stop. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in San Francisco.

review.title: Great Location....Tiny Room
review.reviewText: If you are looking for a great Union Square location and dont plan on staying in your room that often, then I would recommend this hotel. The room was old and very cramped, we could not watch TV from the bed without having to strain our necks due to the poorly placed furniture, and we had to move heavy furniture around to get to the electrical outlets. However, the location was perfect, the hotel is steps away from great shopping, restaurants, bars and trolley/bus stops. I dont think I will stay here again, but others may like it.

review.title: HoneyMooner satisfied
review.reviewText: Was very impressed with the space they created in the cozy rooms. Very clean decorations and classic feel. Loved everything about our stay and would return to the Handlery in future visits.

review.title: Central Location and close to Union Square
