review.reviewText: This hotel was clean and tidy and the staff were friendly as well. The room we stayed was at the back of the complex and a fair walk from the front enterance. There was a lot of road noise at night with garbage trucks and delivery vans but this was to be expected in a large city. The location was real close to the cable cars and Union Square and would stay here again.

review.title: An Aloha Experience in San Francisco
review.reviewText: From Manny at the front desk to Dale, our concierge, a feeling of hele mai or welcome that I was born with, it was like being home away from home. And to the immediate area off Geary, from the local eateries, theatre & shopping all in walking distance to famous Union Square, mahalo or thank you to the City by the Bay!

review.title: the building was nice
review.reviewText: The bed was not really clean

review.title: Good Value in Perfect Location
review.reviewText: I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to experience San Francisco -- close to shopping, restaurants and within walking distance to many attractions. Very comfortable beds and quiet at night.

review.title: A REAL San Francisco Treat!
review.reviewText: I was going to SF for a fun and casual weekend and had arranged for a standard room. When I had arrived they had run out of standard rooms and upgraded me to a king size suite for no extra charge!!! The service at the front desk was excellent. They made sure that I was well accomidated, comfortable, and always gave great directions to the MUNI and BART. I can't wait to book with them again!

review.title: So, so
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was nice on the outside. The hallways looked fine, but once I arrived inside the room it was a little shocking. Not bad mind you, but it was just small..the bathroom was nicer than the bedroom! It was also bigger! Had a view of the rooftops next door. None of this really bothered me too much since we only slept there, but I just had a eerie feeling inside the room. Outdated. Great location though! Upon leaving I noticed a sign on the right door stating something about staying in this hotel may cause cancer!?! I suppose it has to do with the materials the hotel was built with. I never got around to ask anyone about this as I was in a hurry to the airport. Probably wont stay here again.

review.title: Lovely and cosy hotel
review.reviewText: I liked the hotel a lot, the staff is extremely helpful, smiling and discreet! The rooms are very clean and comfortable, the bathroom is great and large, thing that I did appreciate....Fab location, loved the heated pool and the sauna :-)

review.title: Nice older hotel, but right in the middle of everything!!!
review.reviewText: Happy with the service,Daily Grill restaurant connected to hotel is wonderful. Would go back in a heartbeat!!

review.title: Friendly staff
review.reviewText: My girlfriends and I went to San Francisco for a long weekend of shopping and site seeing. The Handlery Hotel was half a block from Union Square, very convient and quiet (after the band stop playing at 10:00 pm). Our rooms were very clean. We all agreed we would definitley stay at the Handlery again.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: Our room had only a shower.

review.title: A Great Stay
review.reviewText: Location was simply amazing and the room was perfect.

review.title: Would definitely go back.
review.reviewText: Hotel rooms were clean. Staff was fantastic. Steps from Union Square and lots of public transportation.

review.title: Good location cosy rooms
review.reviewText: great location handy to everything and right in the right place - some hotels in san fran - esp. cheaper ones - not in good location seems unsafe area.. anyway handlery gave us a good price - room okay with double bed only staff not that friendly. next door to lefty o'douwds dinner and round the corner bar with $2.95 Irish coffees

review.title: great downtown location
review.reviewText: if you want to stay in the Union Square area this is a great choice. many shopping, dining and entertainment options are a short walk away. the hotel itself was clean and the staff was quite friendly. the rooms are a little snug (especially the bathroom), but it is an old building so that is to be expected. i would stay at this hotel again.

review.title: excelent location
review.reviewText: clean, excelent location, good price.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: It was a very central location. Our room faced Greary Street and was quite noisy at night with street people playing the drums and other things. Nice hotel, nice people, just bring earplugs.

review.title: great location but ...
review.reviewText: The location was great but the hotel wasn't as clean as it could have been. The fixtures in our room were dirty and there was a smell we couldn't get rid of even after opening the window. We had to go buy an air freshener. The staff wasn't particularly helpful especially the concierge who seemed annoyed when asked for information.

review.title: Central Location
review.reviewText: Good location for restaurants, shopping, boarding cable cars for Fisherman's Wharf and other great locations. Everyone is very friendly & helpful at the hotel.

review.title: Fantastic location
review.reviewText: We loved staying at the Handlery as it was so close to Union Square and so easy to get around to everywhere. We stayed in a club room (as traveling with a 16 month old, and heard that the rooms were bigger ad able to accommodate a portacot more easily). As others have mentioned, renovations are still ongoing - which meant a bit of a hike to the room - but if you use the back entrance it was easy. Only negative - I asked for express check-out as we had an early morning flight, and we were promised that security would help us out of the room, and a taxi would be ordered. Didn't get the express checkout, didn't get security to help until I phoned, and no taxi waiting. So disappointed with that.

review.title: O.K.
review.reviewText: O.K.

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: Convenient location, very nice accomodations.

review.title: We left our hearts in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel and a great value when comparing to other hotels in the Union Square. One half block from cable cars. Excellent customer service. Our room overlooked O'Farrell Street and we highly do NOT recommend getting a street facing room. The sliding doors are not insulated and you will hear vehicles drive by along with people shouting. It was hard to sleep at times. We recommend getting a room overlooking the swimming pool, they should be less noisy.

review.title: Definately going back.
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel for five days and it was wonderful. Great location, great service, friendly staff. An Expedia representitive helped me with the arrangements and then the hotel took it from there. A+.

review.title: Delightful hotel
review.reviewText: This was my first trip home to San Francisco in 7 1/2 years so I was REALLY looking forward to it. I found this hotel on Expedia and decided that the price and location were perfect. The staff was helpful and friendly. The bedding and bath were immaculate(although I did find a forgotten piece of candy on the floor in a corner!). My only complaint was that I called the concierge for a recommendation on delivered Chinese food and got his voicemail. After 30 minutes I called and asked the operator for a recommendation and she again passed me to his voicemail. After another 15 minutes I gave up and ordered Italian! (North Beach Pizza. Very good.) When he finally called back he was apologetic and told me he had been at dinner! (It would have been nice to know that in the beginning and I could have asked someone else! A bellman or front desk agent!)Other than that I had a great stay and have already recommended this property. You can't beat the location! One caveat: this is an old-fashioned building and the rooms are small. Mine had a double bed.

review.title: Classic San Francisco Resting Spot
review.reviewText: Located just a few doors from the magnificent Union Square, the Handlery is in the heart of the city. It is a convenient walk to all public transportation and the world famous China town. You are greeted by a knowledgable and enthusiastic staff that endeavors to make your stay in the City By The Bay a memorable visit.

review.title: Great hotel !!
review.reviewText: Nice room, very convinient location !! Totaly recommend it !!

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: The rooms are very basic, small and dark, but the location is perfect (very central), which is good when you are there for a short period of time.

review.title: Not impressed with outlook
review.reviewText: This was a fairly basic hotel with room on Heritage side of building, 3 windows overlooking ventilation shafting so no outlook at all. Central for amenities and lots of places for meals near at hand.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This hotel was central to Union Square and the cable car line. The staff was friendly. We were pleased with the hotel and would stay there again. We have a few minor complaints. The TV was very small with limited channels. Our room was on the pool level by the stairs. Our only complaint was we could hear every person who passed, their luggage as they wheeled it by all times during the day and night. Even though it was a non smoking hotel the pool area was used as a smoking lounge.

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: Older but great hotel in the heart of Frisco- Union Square 1/2 block away same with cable cars Lots of good places to eat. All the best shopping with in a few blocks Will stay there again on my next trip

review.title: Excellent location!
review.reviewText: The best thing about the hotel is the location. The hotel is appx 100m from Macy's - excellent for all your shopping and the lovely cheesecake from the cheesecake factory. It is close to Union Square - Tiffany's, SAKS, etc. It is also within easy reach of Powell St - (BART). The staff were friendly, room size, cleanliness very good standard.

review.title: Grest hotel in the best location
review.reviewText: Really enjoyed our stay at the Handelery - the staff were very helpful and their Daily Grill restaurant is worth a visit. The pool is clean and a great escape in this busy city. The location off Union Sq is perfectly central for touring the city. Only negative - the rooms are small.

review.title: Solid Place To Stay
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location and has excellent staff. The rooms are clean with very good beds and linen. The room also had a fridge, which was very useful with an infant with formula. I would stay here again.

review.title: Excellent Anniversary!!
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay at the Handlery in San Francisco, it was very nice.... Close to everything and very well mantained.... Can't wait to go again to celebrate another anniversary!!!

review.title: Excellent position
review.reviewText: Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, the hotel is right on Union square and in an excellent position for the cable cars open top buses and China Town. Our room was very small and the view was not good, however if you pay a little extra ask for a poolside room. Great Irish bar next door which is very useful when your feet are sore after all the walking!

review.title: The Handlery
review.reviewText: This hotel was really nice and clean. Location was great, in the heart of Union Square. All modes of transportation were within walking distance. Rooms were very clean. I would very much recommend this hotel to anyone.

review.title: Excellent place to stay!
review.reviewText: The hotel is a fab place to explore San Fransisco from. Its location is brilliant and the hotl room was lovely. Staff very helpful. Lots of homeless around the area at nighttime, but you just have to ignore them. A couple of great bars and restaurants within a stones throw. I would certainly recommed this hotel to others.

review.title: In a great locatiion.
review.reviewText: It was a great stay. Would stay here next time, and the price was great.

review.title: The Great Central Location Of The Handlery Hotel
review.reviewText: I picked The Handlery based on its location and I was not disappointed. It is quite literally in the heart of Union Square, making it quite easily accessible from all modes of transportation. While the hotel is on the older side--and could use a renovation in parts--the room was clean, comfortable and the staff very nice. The only (small) inconvenience was that the 2nd elevator broke down during the 2nd day and it was hard to wait for the one and only working one at times. But since I was in San Francisco to play and shop, this wasn't a major setback.

review.title: Great Location - good value for money
review.reviewText: Just returned from an 8 day stay at the Handlery Hotel. Great Location just off Union Square. Some refurbishment works taking place between the older part of the hotel and the newer complex. We stayed in the older part and were given a room overlooking Geary Street. Room was OK but not too much space. Main point to note was the street music (I use this term loosely as it was often no more than plastic containers being used as drums!) being played from about 7pm to 10pm each night. Be aware that if you are located at the front of the hotel it is very noisy during these times. Surprised how many homeless people there were in the area (much bigger problem than other American cities we have stayed in such as NY). Main Restaurant attached to the hotel is excellent for evening meals, although you may need to make a reservation. Would recommend Breakfast at 'Lefty O'Douls' restaurant/bar which is located next door to the hotel. In summary we had a great time and loved San Franciscio. The Hotel was very conveniently situated for the central shopping & restaurants, and also nearby to all the main transportation routes (particulary the cable cars).

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: Hotel is very suitable as a central central location and is within easy reach of all locations. Short distance from Union Square and plenty of trams and buses within easy reach. Great location just for walking around and certainly plenty of good restaurants and shops.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Good location, nice hotel.

review.title: Excellent Customer Service! Great Location! Great price!
review.reviewText: My wife and I were visiting San Francisco for our two year anniversary. We were EXTREMELY happy with our stay at the Handlery Union Square Hotel. The hotel was within walking distance to pretty much everything we wanted to do. For those things that weren't, the hotel is located very close to the BART Powell Station as well as Muni's F-Line which gets you to most of the popular places and more. I believe one of the hotel's strongest points to be their customer service. The concierge at the hotel was very helpful. I wanted to surprise my wife with flowers in the room when we got there and the concierge made sure it was done. The flowers were beautiful and my wife loved them! He was also very helpful when it came to finding us the exact type of place when we wanted to dine. We are very excited to go back and when we do we will stay at the Handlery again.

review.title: I thought the hotel was situated fantastically and lovely place to stay. Very impressed.
review.reviewText: Situation of hotel fantastic. Room very comfortable and service brilliant when we needed it. Would wholeheartedly recommend this very highly.

review.title: Great Hotel, Best Location
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with the service at the Handlery. Even though they were doing some remodeling, it did not affect our stay. We upgraded to a nice big room with a great view. We hope to stay here again on our next trip to San Francisco.

review.title: be careful
review.reviewText: If they ask you if you want an interior room that will be quiet tell them no! We thought this would be a good idea and they put us in a room that felt like a dungeon. The windows faced a wall and there was barely any light at all and the room was oddly shaped and uncomfortable. We called and asked to be moved to an exterior room and it was 100 times better! The room was larger, the bathroom was larger and better equiped and there wasn't any street noise anyway! So if they ask, definitely ask for an exterior room (they are the same price!)

review.title: Would stay there again in a heartbeat !
review.reviewText: Staff was very helpful and friendly. Room was way more than i would have expected for the price. Union Square shopping. Extremely close to ChinaTown, BART, Cable Car, and F-Trolly. Trolly to Fishermans Wharf is $3.00 round trip. I will stay there again.

review.title: Great location, extremely good hotel for the price, staff friendly and very helpful.
review.reviewText: I stayed in the Handlery for a week in Aug 08 and was very impressed. The hotel was spotlessly clean, in a great location (right on Union Square and on the tram route) and the staff were both friendly and extremely helpful. I would highly reccommend this hotel.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: The Handlery is the perfect location for visiting San Francisco! It is just off Union Square so all the Downtown shops, bars and restaurants are within walking distance and just a few blocks from Market Street which has lots of transport links to get to other areas of the city. It is also far enough away from Fishermans Wharf, which although isworth a visit, is full of tacky tourist traps!

review.title: Dissapointing..
review.reviewText: Great location and one could be easily fooled by the clean entrance and check-in area but the hotel interior and passageways are dank and smelly. Room was positioned directly in front of giant vent which made a loud noise continuously. Service was not too friendly and the room had poor ventilation and was very stuffy.

review.title: Still offers quality service.
review.reviewText: Stayed at the Handlery 17 years ago and we still found everything very satisfactory. Room was clean and kept very well supplied with tolietries, etc. Concierge was extremely helpful despite the fact he was always busy. The location continues to be ideal...avoided having to rent a car because of the close proximity of cable car and the excellent bus system. Their dining room offered excellent breakfast & dinner entrees. Had a great time!

review.title: Great rate, great location, good service, comfortable room
review.reviewText: The Handlery finds the balance between luxury and convenience, affording a pleasant stay while not charging a small fortune. I was looking to stay at or near Union Square in a good hotel, and this one was just right. The room was very clean and well-kept, and the staff were both welcoming and helpful.

review.title: Would go back
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location, and can't be beat for the value. The staff is excellent and they provided everything I could have wanted.

review.title: a good hotel with a great location
review.reviewText: We stayed here for 5 nights and were impressed by the location of the hotel - so close to shops, bars, the cable cars and a walk to Chinatown. The lobby of the hotel was good - although one of the lifts seemed to be out of order a lot! Our room was a little bit disappointing - very small and a bit out of date. It was very noisy too - lots of sirens/music at night but that is what you get for a city hotel. The hotel staff were friendly and very helpful. I would recommend this hotel - just take ear plugs and don't expect loads of space in your room!

review.title: It was in a good location, good service, and close Union Square Shopping.
review.reviewText: The customer service was Awesome and very comfortable room sizes. Not a good view but really we where hardy in the room, nice pool and SPA. If you like to go shopping to Macy's, Gap, Norstrom, Forever 21, French Connection etc. They are all around the corner 2 blocks from Union Square. You can take the cable cars or trolly anywhere cloe by, Pier 39 etc. Would definite stay there again!

review.title: San Francisco Handlery
review.reviewText: Hotel staff were very helpful and the hotel had easy access to all the tourist sites.

review.title: Expensive price hotel and small room
review.reviewText: I order from Expedia , they gave us a small room and near elevator . The condition is noisy and small restroom and room . I don't want to go back the hotel . I don't think it's quality is worth the price .

review.title: Was a great hotel for the price
review.reviewText: My husband & I came to SF for our 10 yr anniversary. We chose this motel with some concern due to a few bad comments about staff & check in time, but the price was great and the location seemed to be, too. When we arrived at 10 am (check - in @ 3), we were ushered directly into our up-graded room, no wait, just a warm welcome from the wonderful & competent staff. The room overlooked the street that ran in front of the hotel, but we though it was just a very local flavor. We stayed for 5 nights and not once were we interupted by housekeeping or any other member of the staff. The front desk and concierge were top-notch and went above and beyond, and the restaurant was a delicious perk. This hotel is in proximity to anything you could possibly want-cablecar, bus, trolley, rental car offices, bart, etc.... We would definitely recommend this to anyone staying in the area. The only drawback as far as we could tell was that there was no fridge in the room, but this was minor as it was just the 2 of us.

review.title: An amazing city!
review.reviewText: This hotel was great. The location was perfect--close to shopping and some great restaurants and we could easily obtain transportation--cable car, street car, the hop on/hop off double decker bus tours, etc. The front desk was great. I had two minor problems (blow dryer and a bathroom faucet problem) and they were rectified almost immediately. The bed was so comfortable. The concierge was extremely helpful, as well. My only beef was the weather. My daughter and I (after experiencing a cold July in Canada) expected hot weather, and we were shocked at the temperature and the cold wind. It was probably warmer back home. We both had to buy some warm sweatshirts and long pants.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a very good location, and our rate was reasonable for San Francisco. We were able to access public transportation easily. We did not like their wi fi policy. We had to pay for the service (with our own notebook) and were unable to view our own Internet page, which displays all the stocks my husband keeps track of. No PBS either.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Handlery for two nights, we booked a tour to Monterey and the pick up was at the Handleryl. The first night we were on the back street side of the hotel and it was very noisy, till about 2 or 3am. When we returned from our tour to Monerey we checked in again and requested a room that wasnt facing the street, it was very quiet. Nice hotel, good location close to Union Square etc, front desk - great service.

review.title: I would have expected better service out of a family run hotel
review.reviewText: Maid service walked in two days in a row without knocking, kids dominated all four guest computers for facebook/myspace thus not allowing business users access...I wasn't the only one complaining about that issue. While I had a wireless card from my cellular provider, the style of construction prevented a good signal. The location of the hotel relative to tourist & shopping is very good though. The staff behind the front desk are friendly but don't seem very resourceful about the ammenities of their establishment. There was no mention of the construction going on during my stay prior to booking. I guess you get what you pay for on the price. I would have to look closely at comparable or even more expensive hotels before staying there again.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed in a room away from the street and it was quiet. There was construction when we were there near the pool area, walls were wet with plaster. My daughter got plaster on her coach bag. We are waiting to hear from the hotel about compensating her for the damage. The beds were very comfortable and the hotel was clean. I would stay there again.

review.title: Good Hotel not the Greatest
review.reviewText: For the most part we enjoyed our stay at the Handlery. It is a great location. Our room was an interior room so we did not hear the street noise. But we were on the second floor and we could hear the banging around in the lobby. I had ear plugs so I was okay sleeping. Our refridgerator did not work. But we did not tell the hotel about it. Did not want to mess with it. At night, we could not get the room to cool down to the coolest setting. Once again we did not go to the hotel about this. I liked the style of the hotel. Not your typical hotel room. The TV was small. But we weren't in our room all that much either.

review.title: Very nice historic hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean, up to date and in a great part of the city. The rooms are small, and the corridor is a bit of a maze to get to the room, but that is really an asset since it sets the character apart from the box Marriot type hotels. The room was definitely small for entertaining, but I enjoyed the character. I visited while attending Semicon at the Moscone center. It is a short walk away. Several of the nearby restaurants were also quite enjoyable.

review.title: Enjoying city life
review.reviewText: The hotel is absolutely wonderful and close to all the amenities of Union Square

review.title: Best Location
review.reviewText: It's centrally located!

review.title: Central hotel with pool
review.reviewText: Some renovation going on at the moment although there was no noise or dirt. Great location and very comfortable. Hotel pool open from 8 until late small but good. Hotel staff very helpful.

review.title: Good value in S.F.
review.reviewText: Good location and value in S.F.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I spent 3 nights at the Handlery Union Square in San Francisco, CA. We had a very enjoyable stay. Absolutely No Complaints! It was the perfect location. There are tons of things to do within walking distance and a variety of public transportation within seconds to get you anywhere else. The hotel service was excellent, friendly and helpful. The room was excellent, very clean and comfortable. We would definitely recommend the Handlery Union Square for your stay in San Francisco, CA.

review.title: Nice Hotel for the Price-Location
review.reviewText: Hotel conviently located to public transportation, restuarants, shops, clean and well kept. Staff was friendly and helpful. Room was very roomy and clean.

review.title: Good experience
review.reviewText: Once all the renovations are complete ti will be a very nice place to stay. The room was comfortable and the hotel is centrally located. All the staff were friendly and helpful.

review.title: Great Hotel in a Great Location
review.reviewText: Handlery Union Square Hotel is a great hotel to stay in while in San Francisco. The location is a central tourist area and right next to Union Square. My room was small, but clean and lovely. The staff is helpful and friendly. The Daily Grill is right next door is a great place to eat or simply have a drink at the bar.

review.title: Would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed for 6 nights in the newer section of the hotel. The room was clean and of decent size for three people. We were on the third floor and heard no traffic or other noise from the street. The staff was friendly and helpful. Access to public transportation was great. Would stay there again!

review.title: Need to wait for construction to complete
review.reviewText: Note that the pictures shown do not represent all the rooms. They initially put me in the old side of the hotel which was NOT nice at all. I called the manager, they switched the room, and the rest was fine. The location is what really makes this place - one block from Union Square. This is a perfectly comfortable hotel, but I would put it at three stars vs. the 3.5 it gets.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: I was very disatisfied with the hotel. We had to pay $40.00 just to park there over night which is outrageous. The front desk person gave us the wrong directions to Pier 39. We will never go back to your hotel, nor will I recommed it to anyone.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The Handlery Union Square has a great location in San Francisco, with comfortable rooms albiet small. The down side was the staff, especially the conceirge desk, which was not at all helpful. Dispite this, we would go back!

review.title: location location location!
review.reviewText: location location, this was awesome for it and a pool to let the kids recharge in to boot. Service at the front desk was very accommodating and friendly. I'd go back for sure.

review.title: Good hotel for value
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and in a great location in relativity to Union Square. The only problem was you have to pay for parking and the hotel was under some construction. Overall satisfaction was good for the room.

review.title: Everything we wanted
review.reviewText: Perfect location for shopping, dining, etc. Rooms are small but very well appointed. Plenty of mirrors and electrical plugs made it easy to do hair and makeup while shower was in use. Great ventilation in bathroom - shower did not steam up mirror. Loved the magnified makeup mirror. Lots of thick, fluffy towels were very nice. Comfortable beds. Would have preferred a down pillow, but that was my only complaint. Individual thermostat in room was great. Went with a girlfriend this time, but plan to stay there with my husband our next trip to SF.

review.title: Vintage but classy
review.reviewText: Room was small but stylish.

review.title: broken AC and not enough people on staff
review.reviewText: The hotel isn't bad, but be aware that anytime you want something from hotel staff you will be waiting for a while. This includes checkin, checkout, concierge and bell staff services. They don't have nearly enough people on staff to handle the size of the hotel. That said, the stay was ok with the exception that our AC didn't work well and our room got extremely hot at night. This is probably not a major concern though as SF rarely has heat waves.

review.title: Near perfect location for business and shopping in SF
review.reviewText: The Handlery Hotel near San Francisco's Union Square is in an ideal location for both shopping at San Franciso's major deparment stores and easy access to the Moscone Convention Center. I especially enjoyed strolling through the park near the Yerba Buena Center for the Arts every morning on my way to the Convention Center. The "Daily Grill" adjacent to the hotel was a bit expensive and the wait staff somewhat inattentive, but the staff at the hotel were very friendly and professional.

review.title: Disappointment
review.reviewText: Even for San Francisco, at the price paid I expected a larger room and some decent furniture. The bathroom was particularly unconfortable: incredibly small, no bathtub, just a corner shower in a triangular cubicle that could not be turned on without spilling water in the whole bathroom. The shower head could not be directed because it did not move. The good thing I can say about the hotel is that it has an excellent location and (paid) access to a superb fitness club.

review.title: Fun place in San Francisco
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with our rooms and the restaurant next door, The Daily Grill. Overall, it was a great experience and we will be back! Keep the rates low for us travelers.

review.title: Under construction
review.reviewText: You might want to wait until the remodel is complete before visiting this hotel. The room was fine, but getting there was another story. If you are staying in a "Club Room" you will have to walk up several flights of wooden stairs. It was niceto be conveniently located on Union Square.

review.title: Great price, great location friendly staff
review.reviewText: The rooms were clean, very quiet. The air conditioner in our room did not work, however there was a great breeze from the window. The staff was very friendly, night or day.

review.title: Good hotel but could be better
review.reviewText: Overall, it's a nice hotel. It's clean, the price is reasonable, the service is excellent. But, I would advise against the rooms facing the street; it gets really noisy at night. The rooms facing the pool are a good deal. Hotel is convenient in Union Square, so it's a good bargain if you're interested in shopping.

review.title: Pretty Impressed
review.reviewText: Had construction going on which was an inconvenience when going to and from room (especially with luggage) But overall nice hotel, great view from windows, great location!!!!!!!

review.title: The best Hotel in SFO
review.reviewText: The hotel offered more than what I'd expected of. Centrally located in SFO and truly a value for money. Friendly Hotel staff and neat and good spacious rooms.

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: Got a really good deal, receptionist tried very hard to persuade us to upgrade our room as she said it would be too cramped for three(2 adults + 1 child) but we refused. Our 2 x double bed room was spacious and recently re-decorated. Pool was lovely and very sheltered - a real sun-trap. Location is brilliant although I wouldn't have liked a room on the street side.

review.title: Place for romance!
review.reviewText: Thank you,Handlery Hotel! You are small, cozy and absolutely beautifull! The best place in San Francisco to stay!

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: this hotel's claim to fame is its location--half a block off of union square and close to many bus/cable car lines. the downside to this fact is that there can be considerable street noise--try to get a room facing away from geary. a band performed at the corner of union sq every night and was very easily heard even from my room away from the street.

review.title: great hotel in a great location!!
review.reviewText: This was our first time in San Francisco, and we thought the hotel was great. The staff was very friendly, and the room was always cleaned and tidy when we returned. The concierge and reception desks were eager to accomodate us - our flight didn't depart until midnight the day of our check-out, but they were happy to store our luggage until then, and when we booked a couple of tours, they were happy to print our tickets/vouchers for us. The bathroom was small, but comfortable, and the room was the perfect size for two. We booked a single full bed, but were happily surprised when we were given two double beds. The view wasn't great, but the price couldn't be beat, so we weren't complaining. Overall, the Handlery is very affordable and pleasant. The location is ideal, situated right on Union Square and close to the Bart station and the F car. It's very close to SOMA and the Financial District and short steetcar ride away from more touristy areas like Fisherman's Wharf. The hotel, however, is also quite near the more seedy district of Tenderloin, though it is easy to avoid if you plan your transportation routes ahead of time, or decide to take the bus instead of walking.

review.title: Great location, cute hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel location couldn't be better - right on Union Square. The staff was helpful and friendly, the room was clean and comfortable, except the bed which was way too soft and left me with an aching back. Everything else was great.

review.title: Economic choice
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is excellent, and it's cheapest in that area too. the hotel is a bit old but fine to me, staff are nice and helpful.

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: Very unique, we were so busy, but the staff was great at helping with getting our cab. or transportation helps when we needed them. If we ever went back to SF would be a nice place to stay, it's close to everything.

review.title: Nice boutique-y hotel
review.reviewText: If you're looking for a clean nice hotel in the center of Union Square the Handlery is a great pick, it's one block from the Powell St Cable Car line and right on Geary where the 38 runs all night. The bed and pillows are on the firm side so if you don't like that you might not enjoy your stay. The only thing I didn't like were the towels, they were small and rough a hotel of this caliber should have the money to spend on bigger and softer towels.

review.title: Old Time San Francisco Quality
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Handlery from May 20-24, and was very impressed with the cleanliness of the room, and the level of service of the entire staff. The Handlery is a well kept Union Square hotel which has been owned and operated by the Handlery family for 60 years. The hotel was built prior to the 1908 earthquake, and has that great Old Time San Francisco Quality, which is what I always look for whenever I stay in San Francisco.

review.title: Good valur for the Union Square location in SF
review.reviewText: It was a comfortable stay and enjoyed the proximity to the Union Square. Only complaints were: 1. No noise barrier facing the street, 2. Invoice was wrong due to computer glitches, and 3. Renovation work was going on.

review.title: Exactly what we were looking for!
review.reviewText: Fastastic staff. General Manager came out to meet us when we checked in to welcome us for our Wedding Anniversary trip, WOW such a great way to start our vacation! Location is perfect, half a block away from Union Square. Trolly cars pick up across the street, easy acess to BART & MUNI. Visit the Irish Pub, Lefty O'Tools just a few doors down from the hotel & sit at the piano bar is a must when there. Room was comfortable & we loved the historical feel of the hotel. Very classic.

review.title: Will choose to stay next time
review.reviewText: Good location, clean room, and good rate through Expedia, but parking rate is high. That is only one thing we are unhappy about.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: This hotel is in the perfect location of your just in San Fran for a short stay, as its right in the middle of the shopping area, and there are always taxis parked outside for if you want to go to the fishermans warf etc.

review.title: Comfortable Hotel in Great SF Location
review.reviewText: I stayed at this hotel from a Thursday through Saturday while attending a convention near Moscone Center. The location was walking distance to many restaurants, coffee shops, clothing stores and specialty shops. The 10 or so blocks to Moscone center was an enjoyable easy walk. The Handlery Hotel is right across from Union Square. There is parking for a fee both at the hotel and at public parking garages within a block. There was some construction going on at the hotel, but it didn't affect my stay at all.

review.title: Very nice hotel.
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Convenient to everything.

review.title: It was the best
review.reviewText: The staff was very helpful, the hotel was very clean and the room was great.

review.title: Good, but flawed.
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a terrific location right next to Union Square. In general, it seems well run and clean. There are a few problems, though. For the price, there should be a light breakfast included, but there isn't. Also, wireless Internet is extra at a rate equal to $300 per month ($10 per day). In my room, the carpet was clean but heavily worn. Also, the "queen" bed was more like a full-sized bed. The desk chair was small and too short for the desk. The TV reception was inconsistent. None of these things is major, but added together they are enough to make me look elsewhere the next time I visit.

review.title: Location;
review.reviewText: This hotel is located in a great area of San Francisco

review.title: can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Hotel was very central and comfortable. The room was very spacious and spotless. Staff very friendly. Food excellent. Would highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Cute and lovely hotel
review.reviewText: Ive came for business and I looked for a good hotel near the union square. I got what I wanted!! The hotel is really cute, clean and nice, a short walking distance from all the shopping center and the Cheese cake factory

review.title: Would definitely stay here again.
review.reviewText: Quick check in. Very clean room. The bed was comfortable. I was close to the stairs AND the vending machines, yet it was very quiet--I was worried at first, but once in my room I couldn't hear anything. I also loved how convenient it was to the theaters and restaurants in Union Square.

review.title: Reasonable choice in SF
review.reviewText: In a convenient location, the Handlery Hotel is a small, older hotel catering to budget conscious travelers like me. My room was small, but clean. The bath was updated and quite functional; however, I would rate the furnishings as dated.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Conveniently located in the heart of Union Square

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: On the plus side: staff is very nice and courteous, great location On the negatives: Carpeting is very musty. Rooms with are extremely small. Rooms facing street are extremely noisy.

review.title: silence is golden
review.reviewText: The staff was incredibly helpful and extremely courteous. I asked to be moved to quieter rooms two times and they were most accomodating. They were most genuinely happy to move us again to a room on the 8th floor on the inside of the building (poolside) and from there on out the next week was blissfully peaceful.

review.title: well kept old hotel
review.reviewText: well kept older hotel. staff very friendly, and courteous. Restaurant very pricy, would not recommend. Will use hotel again.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Would stay there again.

review.title: VERY GOOD HOTEL
review.reviewText: I needed a big room and that was what i got, even had the chance to view to rooms and decide wich one i wanted. the rooms ending in the number 69 are large and perfect for 4 people they have 2 queen beds and a large vanity area the carpets and sofas need a little cleaning. Concierge very helpulf

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a good location to transportation, shopping, eating and walking.

review.title: 1/2 block from Union Square
review.reviewText: Clean and comfortable, but is in need of room upgrades to a more modern look

review.title: comfortable hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText: Despite the fact that this hotel is on a busy downtown street, we were given a very quiet room overlooking their courtyard with outdoor heated pool (which is apparently a rarity in San Fran). Beds were comfortable. It was good to have 2 queen beds (great when travelling with kids). Not far from BART station if you want to get to the airport inexpensively. The only downside--had to carry luggage up some stairs to get to quiet section of hotel. Overall, I would recommend this hotel.

review.title: A great location
review.reviewText: This hotel was located close to union square, which is close to the subway and also to many attractions and shopping. The hotel itself was very clean and stylish, and I was very impressed with the room. The front desk staff and the conceirge were very helpful. In general, this was an excellenet value and I would definately advise others to stay there. Just one small complaint, the street it is on is noisy at night, and so I wore earplugs to sleep.

review.title: Great value, location, service.
review.reviewText: Outstanding location, spacious clean & well appointed rooms, great service, excellent value. Can't wait to go back.

review.title: Wonderful stay
review.reviewText: Our stay at the Handlery was fantastic. The rooms were clean and roomy enough. For an old hotel, it has been kept up very well. The staff was great - they hailed taxi's for us in the rain, gave great suggestions for things to do and answered our many questions with a smile. We would definitely book again and have already recommended it to family and friends.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The Handlery was located within walking distance of lots of shopping and wonderful restaurants. Not to mention the convenience of the mass transit. It was a very pleasant experience and I would highly recommend!

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Perfect location, close to the BART and a wonderful staff.

review.title: Just okay
review.reviewText: The location is great, which is one reason I would stay there again. We hardly spent any time at the hotel, so it wasn't that bad. But the bathroom was never as clean as it should have been, they took the extra blanket and didn't replace it, they never gave us enough facecloths, etc - all little things, but annoying, nonetheless. Then they tried to charge my card for parking when we didn't have a car - I don't like that they tried to charge my card without me authorizing it. So overall, it was fine.

review.title: location
review.reviewText: the hotel is conveniently located in union square, just a two minute walk from major bus stops and a cable car stop.

review.title: A Wonderful Hotel at Union Square
review.reviewText: We were not expecting much since I decided to attend my business convention at the last minute and my "regular" hotels were already filled. The Handlery Union Square was right across the hotel we were going to stay and it's about half the price. Our room was clean and spacious and the bed was as good as any. I plan to pick this hotel when I return to SF in may. Oh! The Daily Grill is the "hotel's restaurant."

review.title: quaint little hotel
review.reviewText: My husband and I would totally go back to this hotel. It is centrally located in the middle of union square the prices are great and the staff is super sweet and accomadating. the rooms are older but well kept up!

review.title: excellent location will go back
review.reviewText: room clean location excellent decor pleasing staff very friendly and helpful

review.title: Beautiful, gorgeous old world hotel
review.reviewText: Beautiful old world charm...when hotels were really hotels. Situated in the middle of all that is San Francisco -- the main cablecar lines, gourmet restaurants and upscale designer shopping and bus stop for city tours.

review.title: Nice - convenient location
review.reviewText: First room faced the a/c duct work and had a funny odor. Was able to change to another room. Very friendly, helpful staff at front desk and wait staff in Daily Grill.

review.title: Very well located
review.reviewText: We had a great time at this hotel. The cable cars are just around the corner and it's very well located in the centre of the city. We enjoyed its tipical american style as well. We'd like coming back.

review.title: Handerly Hotel - great location
review.reviewText: The Handerly Hotel is located within walking distance to shopping, entertainment, restaurants, cable car line and much more. We have stayed at the Handerly several times over the last 3 years and I'm sure we will stay there again. It's kind of like coming home - everyone is very friendly and helpful, and the hotel is very comfortable.

review.title: Great Location! Great Staff! Great Fun!
review.reviewText: A last minute attempt to ring in the New Year in the City at Union Square proved to be perfect! The Handlery Hotel is conveniently located a 1/2 block off of Union Square. Parking was a breeze even with all the celebrators out in full force. The friendliest staff you could hope for, a very clean room with an EXTRA comfortable bed, and a quaint balcony to enjoy our morning mimosas! (Our only disappointment was a late night dinner from room service.) We were able to walk to all of our favorite places on Union Square for shopping dining and frolicking; and caught the cable cars less than a block away for a trip down to the wharf.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The Handlery Union Square Hotel is an excellent location to stay if you want to be close to great shopping. Just steps from many favorite stores, the Handlery was a nice place for our family. The staff was friendly and helpful. Although the lobby appears new and updated, rooms still have an old feeling. Furniture was dated and space was very limited. Our bathroom was extremely small. We could hear everyone that walked past our room and above us. Since we only spent time in our room to sleep, the size was not a huge issue. This was our second time staying at the Handlery. I can say with all honesty we would stay there again.

review.title: You get what you pay for
review.reviewText: This hotel is very well located and for that you can put up with its dated look and somewhat cramped quarters. Its space is adequate and that describes most aspects of this hotel and its concierge. The only quality that was above average is their parking charge - $38 per day!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Had a nice time, had the smallest room with just a twin bed. Shower was clean and drained well, free shampoo/conditnor was nice and of good quality. Some hall way noise but managable. Had own fridge in room.

review.title: Satisfied, just ignore the funny smell.
review.reviewText: This is an older hotel that appears to have been remodeled. It is in an excellent location! It is as close as you can get to Union Square and only a few steps away from a cable car, that will take you as far as Fisherman's Wharf. The cable car route stops at Chinatown, Lombard St., and brings you within a couple blocks of the business district. The ONLY thing I did not like about the hotel was that the carpet needed to be replaced. I don't care about the age of it (old, but clean), the smell was what bothered me the most. It was something I quickly adjusted to, but somewhat unpleasant and noticable. However, the smell was not unbearable (musty), and I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great deal.

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: Spacious room and bathroom and conveniently located close to shopping and restaurants. Will definitely recommend to a friend.

review.title: Great location, Great hotel
review.reviewText: We will definitely go back. This is a neat older hotel with lots of character. It has the perfect location, close to all transportation, restaurants and shopping. Many rooms are quite small but we upgraded to a larger one and it was perfect! The hotel restaurant is great but a little pricey but there are many many restaurants close by.

review.title: Good hotel and great location
review.reviewText: We had 2 rooms at the Handlery, one of which was an executive suite. The suite was far superior than the other room, which by comparison was very small, overlooked a roof and some pipes and was very dark. However, it was clean and the beds were very comfortable. The concierge and all the staff were very helpful and friendly. It is a great location close to all amenities and public transport. Check out Lori's diner a couple of blocks away, it was a great place for breakfast and cheaper than the attached Daily Grill restaurant.

review.title: A Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Overall, this was a great place to stay. In the heart of downtown San Francisco, it was close to everything we wanted to see (all the tourist attractions). The cable car lines and BART station are only two blocks away. The only negative I can think of is that, since the hotel is downtown, it was a bit noisy very early in the morning with delivery trucks and traffic, but our room was on the street side. We would definitely stay here again if we return to San Fran!

review.title: Clean and simple
review.reviewText: the double bed was abit uncomfortable for 2 people. Very clean and friendly housekeeping staff. nice.

review.title: Great location for visiting SF
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a great location with close proximity to cable cars, Bart, a lot of great restaurants and incredible shopping. Pretty much could do all of SF with the available transportation without needing a rental car. Service was great and the room was very clean. The concierge was extremely helpful in providing directions, making dinner reservations, and answering general questions about the area. The streets were very busy and hotel guests were out late. We were right by the elevator so it could be noisy at times. Recommend if you are looking for more quiet to request an upper floor in the tower away from the elevator

review.title: GOOD VALUE FOR CENTAL HOTEL
review.reviewText: did not have much contact with staff . Very bad start as the rooms were not ready until after 4 p.m. the day of our arrival and we had to wait 3 hours to get into the room ( after a 12 hour flight and 15 hour time difference to Shanghai , this wasnot very good ) I would have expected a drick or voucher to compensate , but nothing. Cleanliness and comfort were good. Not noisy and great location

review.title: Loved it!
review.reviewText: Very good service and friendly staff. We were pool side and it was wonderful.I liked the separate vanity area so my husband and I could both get ready at the same time. Can't wait until my next visit.

review.title: Best location in San Francisco
review.reviewText: This was our second time staying at this hotel. We stayed in the Club rooms both times. The room was very clean, large with a sitting area and the bed was very comfortable. Housekeeping was great, had a problem with the TV and it was fixed right away. We were located in the pool courtyard which was very nice (pool was not used much). We had a late check out due to a late flight, the hotel arranged for us to stay in the same room for a small fee. The location was perfect for sightseeing, shopping and restaurants. Highly recommend this hotel - Club rooms.

review.title: Could have been a more positive experience
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel couldn't have been better. The restaurant was fine as was the lobby. The hotel is old but clean. The employees at the front desk didn't seem too sure of themselves. Two double beds were requested, but when we got there there was only one double bed. They assigned us to the ajoining room which was like a small suite. It looked out onto a dingy alley and the building next door housed undesirables which could be seen from our window. There was a retrofitted air conditioner/heater that was very noisy and stayed on all night.

review.title: A Keeper......
review.reviewText: Completely satisfied from check in to check out! Great location...walk to all. Had a King Club which I believe has more square footage than some of the other rooms. Great room. Took a cab to the Presidio Golf Course for ten bucks. The Daily Grill in the hotel is reasonable, fantastic atmosphere and exceptional. I have no reason to stay elsewhere.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: I was very satisfied with this hotel. It's in a great location, near everything. Room was clean and comfortable, but very small. It suited my needs. Would stay there again. Many good places to eat and very close to the theaters. Had a wonderful time.

review.title: Great hotel, great location!
review.reviewText: Will definitely stay there again. Great value.

review.title: I got what I asked for
review.reviewText: I recovered from Surgery at this hotel. The hotel gave me a quiet room just as I asked, but I traded comfort of quality of air conditioning for quiet. My room never got cool enough and that is where the outside temp never reached above 75. I was given a small fan to help. The hotel had wallpaper pealing off the wall in the bathroom. I was give the 6 pillows I asked for and was treated very well over all.

review.title: very nice and great location
review.reviewText: The hotel was located one block from the BART and also the cable cars. Didn't need to rent a car to travel through the city.

review.title: Great place to stay in downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: Handlery Union Square Hotel is located in the hart of the city, near all the top shops, next to the cable tram line, has a great restaurant (with cheaper options at every corner) and a nice atmosphere. When booked in advance, rates are very good. Highly recommended.

review.title: Close to Union Square
review.reviewText: My friend and I enjoyed our stay at the Handlery. Room was small yet well appointed, beds comfortable, help friendly and very convenient to shows and shopping. One problem..mold in the shower. We appreciated the no smoking policy.

review.title: Awesome
review.reviewText: perfect stay, no complaints at all

review.title: Best location for comfort and convenience
review.reviewText: I regret not having more time to stay and relax at this hotel. My room had easy access to the pool/courtyard. Best location in Union Square to see the sights and dine at great restaurants. I would definitely go back to this hotel. The room was clean and the bedding was comfortable.

review.title: Great Location - bathrooms need updating
review.reviewText: Seconds away from busy Union Square - in the middle of everything and minutes away from many great restaurants, car rentals etc. But the hotel is a little old, the rooms a tad on the small size -- carpet needs to be replaced, but generally everything is clean. The adjacent restaurant, the Daily Grill - was excellent! Great food for all meals!

review.title: Decent place
review.reviewText: Great location, very helpful staff, loved the fact that it had a fridge. Wishes: Free Wi-fi, newer furnishings, little larger room. Overall, met my needs

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: The hotel was in easy reach of all the transport systems to visit San Francisco's attractions, and easy walking to the shopping areas. Very quite hotel. Very efficient staff. Only disappointment was that the breakfast was expensive.

review.title: OK for a few days
review.reviewText: The Handlery Hotel is a an eight storey building, built about 1920 and has a variety of rooms types. It is conveniently located for the transport links found near to Union Square and Powell Street. There is a hotel car park, but if staying in the city then public transport will certainly be a better way of getting around. Not all bedrooms have bathroom, some are shower only.

review.title: Good hotel, central location
review.reviewText: Our hotel room (with 1 queen bed) was comfortable, although on the small side(I'm not sure how it compares with the other SF hotels though). The room we had was on the second level (historical section); the view from the window was the back of another building but you can't hear street noise so we were ok with that. The walls between the rooms seem thick too, at least we couldn't hear anyone else(which is a bonus because that means no one could hear us too!). The concierge was helpful and nice in giving advice about directions/tourist attractions, and when we needed to book onward travel tickets the receptionist was helpful too. We had an enjoyable lunch at The Daily Grill(good service & food tasted nice). The location was excellent, especially if you like to shop as it is literally just walking distance to all the shops at Union Square. You can walk down to the Powell/Mason tram line, so it's convenient for going to Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: excellent choice, not better location
review.reviewText: the location is the best, for the price excellent choice.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: The Handlery is a very nice hotel. The room was comfortable and spotless. There was no tub, only a small shower, a large person might be uncomfortable in the shower. The room was small but most rooms in San Francisco are small. The only complaint is that the concierge is only on duty till 6:00 p.m. Not much help for evening dining suggestions or next day shuttle pick ups.

review.title: Right in the middle of town so very convenient for shops and restaurants.
review.reviewText: Nice, old hotel. The room and bathroom, although quite small, were well decorated in an art deco style. The only view we got was of the wall next door but that didn't bother us. The staff were very helpful, especially Rhonda in the gift shop, whose daughter lives in London. The fact that the hotel was so ideally situated was the best thing about it though - just a minute's walk from the shops and trolley bus stop. The carpets looked as if they could do with a good steam clean - there were a few stains - but other than that, cleanliness was good.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: This hotel is a quaint place right in Union Square. Extremely clean and the staff was friendly and informative. I would definitely stay there again!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: My partner and I recently stayed at the Handlery Union Square Hotel in SF. The location of this hotel couldn't be more perfect if you are wanting easy access to metro transit links (BART, Street Car, Cable Car, Bus...), everything is just about two blocks from the hotel. There are great restaurants all within close walking distance from the hotel & lots of shopping, too. The hotel staff was very accomodating and friendly - we were impressed. We will definitely come back to stay at the Handlery.

review.title: The Handlery Concierges - Making Your San Francisco Trip Great
review.reviewText: The concierges at the Handlery, Dale, Joseph, and John, are most helpful and knowledgeable. We asked them for recommendations on restaurants, schedules of events, transit tips, etc., and were always impressed with their helpful and in-depth answers. If you need any San Francisco advice, ASK!!

review.title: Location, location, location
review.reviewText: GREAT location, just steps from Macy's and Union Square. For the price and the quality, it doesn't get any better!

review.title: A Lovely Hotel in a Great Location
review.reviewText: This hotel had a friendly staff and lovely accommodations. It is located close to many things in the downtown area at an affordable price. Highly recommended.

review.title: Amazing Location, Awesome Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel is right in Union Square, only few blocks from Powell Street Station from SF Airport. Big "H" sign led us straight there; beautiful rooms (although faint smell of humid carpet). Staff changed our room from one queen to two singles at our request; very friendly and so helpful especially during a very busy holiday season. I will return again & again! Thanks

review.title: Okay for the price, great location
review.reviewText: Okay for the price. The location is the best feature as the hotel is 1/2 block from Union Square. The outdoor pool is was unusable in May as it was too cold and little sun reaches it. Lots of street noise comes through the old windows, so ask for a room that is in the inside courtyard if you want a good night sleep. Parking rates are $40 per day, so include this in the budget.

review.title: Good Location and Good Price
review.reviewText: On a very busy weekend this was the most reasonably priced. The location is excellent, the room was quiet and the beds comfortable. On the negative, the grout in the shower was stained, and the carpet was dirty looking. The service was hit and miss. Some staff were friendly and helpful, some were uninformed and aloof.

review.title: Outstanding!
review.reviewText: Can't beat the location of the Handlery. The staff is the best. They make you feel like part of an extended family. The rooms are large and comfortable. The fridge is an added advantage especially if you travel with children or just love to have a snack on hand. Can't beat the shopping no matter what your preference or budget all is within walking distance. Your safety is assured with this hotels location. Need help..the conceirge is at your service with advise, directions, transportation, theatre tickets the list goes on.

review.title: Great hotel, great location
review.reviewText: I have stayed at the Handlery several times over the last year and have been very satisfied. The staff is helpful, and the rooms are clean. You can't beat the location for the price!

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: I loved the location and the help desk was a savor. I wanted a bowling alley they found it anything you want to do ask and everyone from the bellman is hospitable.

review.title: Underwhelmed but would go back at right rate....
review.reviewText: Hotel is in excellent location for sightseeing in San Francisco - walk to union square, curran theatre, chinatown, cable cars, etc. The front desk was friendly, but the concierge (both of the one's I talked to) need better customer service skills. The rooms were clean, but stains on carpet and upholstery left a bad impression. I would stay here again. IMPORTANT: Ask for a quiet room...our room the first night was on the Geary street side and VERY noisy.

review.title: Great for keeping it simple
review.reviewText: I love this hotel! It is perfect for travel. The staff is very helpful and The Grill which is the restaurant attached to the hotel is outstanding for meals. The hotel is centrally located and it is easy to get transportation to any destination in the city from here. Pay for the upgrade if you want a new room (very nice). If you are watching your pennies and won't spend a lot of time in your room the older rooms are clean and fine (just a bit small, older and with fewer bells and whistles).

review.title: Ideal location
review.reviewText: This is a well run hotel in an ideal location to take advantage of the area aroung Union Square. It does not have all the fancy amenities of some of the more expensive locations, but it was comfortable for my family. We were able to return two days after we left to pick up a toy one child had left and the staff was very helpful in doing this.

review.title: Great deal for a great location
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a fantastic location right off of Union Square, close to shopping, food, and transportation. It was a great jumping off point for us to go all over the city. The room was small, but comfortable for 3 people, and nicely decorated. The hallways and elevators also seemed a bit cramped, but that's to be expected in this area and didn't bother us a bit. The service was friendly once you got ahold of someone, which usually didn't take too long, but could be better. All in all, a good place at a great price!

review.title: Convenience
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Handlery Union Square over a recent long weekend. Upon check in we were given a room that very clearly wasn't what we had reserved. When I notified the desk about the discrepancy they immediately upgraded the room without question. The hotel is older and looks worn. The bed was comfortable and the location can't be beat. For the price this was quite a value.

review.title: Wonderful hotel, we will go back!
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay, very helpful staff, and be sure to eat at their resturant "The Daily Grill" from breakfast to dinner, each meal was prepared with care and large portions also!! The beds were exceptionally comfortable! The shower had wonderful water pressure also. Great place.

review.title: Great place in the heart of it all...
review.reviewText: This hotel was really great, I must say I was impressed with it for the price. It is right in the heart of Union Square which is a huge shopping/dining area...all the upscale shops like BCBG, Louis Vuitton, Coach, Gucci are just steps away (not like I could afford any of it, but still fun to look!). We had a room facing the inner courtyard of the building so it was quiet and didn't get any street noise...but I don't know what it would be like to have a room facing the street. The area is pretty much bumping all night long, so it might be too loud for some people - I don't know. My only complaint was that our room was right next to the elevator...so we could hear people laughing and talking most of the time, and it was a bit annoying. I called the front desk to ask for a room change, but they were all booked up so they couldn't. The rooms are small, but not a big deal since you're probably not spending much time in your room anyway. The bed was very comfortable, and they had decent coffees and teas in the room. Overall, it was a pleasant experience and I'd stay there again.

review.title: Ok-- but not as satisfied as I have been at the Hilton
review.reviewText: The best service was the bellhops. They were more helpful than those I have come across at Hiltons, Marriots and Hyatt. 1) Room service - food was cold, and then my dinner was still sitting in the hall the next night. 2) Don't plan on watching sports with the sound on at the bar-- Wouldn't even turn it up for the superbowl. The bartender during the Super Bowl was winy and she said the sound would disturb the dining experience of their customers (needless to say there were five people in the back of the restaurant that were louder than the TV!) So a bunch of us left and went next door to Lefty O'Douls. Better Service, Nicer Bartenders and they have the games on (food at Lefty's is good for breakfast) 3) No Pool-- they decided to replace the lights in it the week I was there. And to do that, they drained it and they used jackhammers all day which prevented me from doing any business in between conference sessions at the hotel. 4) No easy way to get to club section from lobby with luggage.

review.title: Will never go back
review.reviewText: I stayed with the Handlery in January 2007- I often say in the City on nights where work keeps me late. My usual hotel was booked- I'm assuming this was the case because of local conferences (2 big ones, that I'm aware of.) The front desk person was rude, for starters. In reading the other reviews posted here, I requested a quiet room in advance. It took over 15 minutes to find my reservation, and confirm my room. The HVAC was loud, the bed was hard, and the carpet had many stains on it. The bathroom was modern and comfortable, but the furnishings in general were old and worn. Fridge/mini bar was empty. Local hotels, within 3 blocks on Geary, usually are available and competitive in price to the Handlery, so I won't be going back.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The hotel has a destinct and charming personality. Immediately, you notice that it's a picture from the past with its mail slot, some of its features, and the little nooks. The rooms are somewhat small and the rooms are in two areas. If you are in the main hotel, then you have scored!! The other area of the hotel can be a little annoying in getting there after a long day of sightseeing. The concierge service is excellent and the ajoining restaurant is very good. The biggest factor is the location. It is basically in the heart of Union Square with its shopping, restaurants, etc. It's easy to take the train to/from the airport from a station just two blocks away. You're also near a turnabout for a cable car. For the price and location, it's a good deal. REQUEST being, however, in the main building.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: I stayed here after Christmas, a slow period in San Francisco, so I got for a low price a nice room with a bay window. My trip was for both business and vacation (Emerald Bowl), and this hotel worked well for both. The wifi worked fine.

review.title: Great Customer Service
review.reviewText: The staff was very friendly and efficient, we had room service delivered from the Daily Grill, it was delicious. I will reccommend this place to friends and family.

review.title: Good location, but not user friendly if you have a lot of luggage!
review.reviewText: Upgrade to Club One rooms is advisable. However, the access to Club One annex is not convenient from the lobby. Elevators have not been maintained, and run poorly, so you may have to temporarily use the stairs up-and-down six to eight flights. No late night front desk assistance on this issue.

review.title: Nice Place to Be
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed staying at the Handlery Union Square. The beds were comfortable and the room very nice. Only one problem...we were on the "street side" and it was noisy.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Pleasant small hotel, wonderfully located for shopping. Convenient transportation to tourist attractions. Walking distance from Convention Center. Club rooms are most comfortable, though not easily accessible (steps required and well removed from the lobby area). Clean. Evening staff particularly helpful.

review.title: for larger rooms ask for the club section of the hotel we had a great stay and will be back
review.reviewText: Great hotel 1/2 block from Union Square

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Great location in Union Square, and a good deal for the price.

review.title: Wonderful Hotel
review.reviewText: This is a wonderful little hotel right in the heart of San Francisco. I enjoyed my stay. I would stay there whenever my next trip returns me to San Francisco.

review.title: Adequate if nothing else can be found
review.reviewText: I happened to be in SF on business during a week when over 40,000 conventioneers were also in town, which is the only reason I stayed at the Handlery. The location was great and the hotel wasn't a dive. Knowing that I had no other option helped me endure the miniscule room and the very average bed, linens, bathroom, and service. In a pinch, this is tolerable, but if you have other options - take them.

review.title: Very good location.
review.reviewText: Room was in good condition, great location, very helpful and friendly staff.

review.title: Excellent Hotel, would like to go back
review.reviewText: This is one of the best Hotels we have stayed in. Service in the Hotel was very good and particularly so in the 'Daily Grill' Restaurant. Our room was very comfortable and well appointed and a pleasure to stay in.

review.title: Nice and close to all, but a bit noisy
review.reviewText: This hotel is priced well, clean and right in the middle of Union Square. I could walk to restaurants and the convention center. Only issue was that I was on the 7th floor and could still hear lots of road noise and even people talking and laughing on the street. So if noise is an issue for you this probably isn't the right place.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We found the location of the Handlery perfect for all the sightseeing we did in San Francisco. It was easy to access cable cars, sightseeing tour bus, and cabs.

review.title: Great place to stay in Union Square
review.reviewText: We thought the hotel was in an ideal location and would go back in a minute. Our friends were disappointed that they didn't have much of a view; however, our room was overlooking the entrance, and I had to buy a mask for my eyes as the lights were on all night and ear plugs to drown out the noise. Their room was dark and quiet, so a view isn't always the best option!

review.title: Comfortable Old Style
review.reviewText: I loved the old time/school feel of the hotel. Bathrooms were a little small. I was hoping there was a spa to enjoy.

review.title: Great location, good service
review.reviewText: As you will see from the map, the location of the hotel is perfect - within walking distance from many of the key SF attractions. Front desk staff were also extremely friendly and accommodating. Room is a bit small, but that is to be expected I think from a hotel in the heart of the city.

review.title: Perfect hotel in the city
review.reviewText: This hotel is nestled in the best area in San Francisco!! It was close to the best shopping, dining, and drinking establishments. I have stayed in S.F. before and have not found the perfect hotel until now. Place was great !!!!

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our visit to this hotel. The location couldn't be better. It's a great shopping and entertainment district and we took full advantage. I was concerned that it would be noisy, but we didn't even hear the elevator, which was right next to our room. We were very comfortable, and enjoyed our stay immensely.

review.title: Great Hotel - Terrible Service
review.reviewText: The Hotel has an absolutely great location for first-times like us... easy access to public transportation stops and brief walks to stores, restaurants and bars.... but don't expect to be treated well by the front desk people. We had to wait all day (literally) to get into our room, even tho checkout is at noon... we we not let into our room until 6 pm. The only offer they made to accomodate our needs was to offer us a move into a smaller room with no balcony- nevertheless we just waited for the room I paid for.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is a gem. It was clean, quiet, and the staff was very friendly. It was also so close to everything -- restaurants, shopping, theaters!

review.title: Very nice
review.reviewText: THis hotel is very nice.

review.title: Loved the hotel--Just a couple Issues
review.reviewText: We stayed in a club room which was really nice, very comfortable--didn't get one of the balcony rooms but did have a full sliding glass door. Fun. We enjoyed that. Housekeeping was great--quiet and completely unobtrusive yet the room was clean and freshened when we arrived back in the evenings. For the bad, we had chosen the Handlery because, unlike many other properties, they indicated that it was probable that we could get a smoking room--no promises but said that it was likely. When we arrived the clerk said none were available and wouldn't check to see if there would be any later or even the next day. He was pleasant and friendly but it was just no--deal with it. Also, we needed some internet access which was allegedly available but after messing with it for 3 or 4 days and being given a runaround by the front desk people, it became obvious that the hotel's internet service wasn't working. We finally went to a little copy shop right outside the hotel's garage entrance and got most of what we needed taken care of. It wasn't a horrible problem but the lack of honesty caused us a lot of time and frustration. Overall, the good far outweighed the bad and we'd definitely stay here again. We loved the hotel, the location was perfect for transportation and the couple minor issues with the staff is the only thing that drags down this hotel's score.

review.title: review
review.reviewText: location is great, however room did not seem to be air conditioned at times. no continental breakfast.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: There were several mix-ups with the hotel in terms of charges made that were not correct and with the type of room I wanted. The valet scratched our car, and denied it, and was quite rude about the whole ordeal.

review.title: Great Base for San Francisco
