review.reviewText: The Handlery is in a great location for exploring San Francisco. We found the staff helpful and they were able to give us a quiet room away from the road traffic. We stayed in the older part of the hotel and the rooms were fine.

review.title: Close to everything!
review.reviewText: Great little hotel with attached restaurant. We would go back especially for convenient location in Union Square. We walked to the Ferry Building, Giants Ballgame and all the big stores, Macys, Nordstroms, Crate and Barrel.

review.title: Not impressed at all.
review.reviewText: I would not recommend this hotel at all. Hotel is not worth the rates they charge at all. The staff was not friendly. No one offered to help us with our luggage. The room was very noisy and we didn't get any rest. The rooms are old and not very nice. The staff really doesn't seem to want to help anyone. They advertise a family owned hotel, but it sure doesn't seem that way when you're there. We have stayed in many hotels in SF and will never stay at this one again.

review.title: Good hotel in a great location!
review.reviewText: Room was small but fine for a few days. The location can't be beat-Union Square with lots of public transportation was just outside the door.

review.title: Very Pleased
review.reviewText: Staff were very helpful and accomodating. The location was very convenient, close to public transportation and shopping, and very scenic. In fact, our only complaint was the view from our room, but we didn't spend enough time in our room for it to really be an issue.

review.title: Club Room is a must!!
review.reviewText: Absolutely pleased with this hotel. The soda machines didn't work except for floor #2. The view was awesome and there were good channels if you're into watching TV. Room was clean and modern. Very spacious and I will stay here again in the future.

review.title: Nice quaint rooms but also noisy
review.reviewText: Hotel's older section has small rooms and not all have great views. Even though our room had great view of Union Square, it was incredibly noisy at night. Rooms are very clean and well-kept. Staff was very helpful. I'd stay here again

review.title: Worst customer service ever!
review.reviewText: We stayed here for an in town vacation, and I was so disappointed--I specifically chose this hotel because it was family owned, and promised a lot. The service was awful. There were problems and confusion from the moment I drove into the garage, and they didn't even pretend to care whether we were satisfied or not. When I asked for a manager, she couldn't be bothered to show up in person, so she called the front desk where I was waiting. We paid WAY too much for a room that wasn't nearly as big as the photo made it seem, and if you have mobility issues, don't even bother! The place is technically "accessible" but that means you'll have to go through the basement and up two different elevators to get to the front desk and rooms. Horrible experience. There are so many wonderful hotels in SF--don't waste your time or money here!

review.title: Not bad for downtown SF
review.reviewText: They we're overloaded with an "event" in town, so we got a free upgrade which made it work! Parking is a nightmare and an extra $42.oo so be prepared.

review.title: Good Hotel other than Parking Fees
review.reviewText: Overall the hotel was very nice. It was very convieient because it was in Union Square. My only issue was the parking fees for the hotel parking lot. They were too expensive. Parking should have been includes with the room rate.

review.title: Nice, but...
review.reviewText: Hotel room had a very strange odor, but the hotel was very nice.

review.title: Not too bad
review.reviewText: Quibbles: No bathtub in the room, just a shower; TV station selection is pathetic; view out the room window was the worst imaginable - a blank wall and some ductwork. But, the place is just a half block from Union Square and the Powell cable car, is inexpensive for San Francisco, and was clean. So, you pay your money and you make your choice.

review.title: I will come back.
review.reviewText: Selected hotel on line, sight unseen. Location excellent, just off Union Square. Only stayed one night for business trip. Room small but clean. One Queen in middle of room. Dim overhead lighting and better lighting by the bed. Bathroom small, sliding pocket door, but well maintained and clean. Furnishings a bit dated, but in good repair, drab colors, but bed comfortable, AC blew cold with good fan control, so, overall, very good experience and fair priced. I will come back.

review.title: A great option
review.reviewText: Since arriving at the hotel, the service is extraordinary begining with the Concierge, who gave us al kind of details and attractions to visit. The room was inmaculate and housekeeping is like being home. The rate is very appropiate and the location is amazing. The restaurant was delicious and a breakfast option you should nott miss.

review.title: Missed opportunity
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel was great but the front desk was the first indication that things were less than we had hoped for. It appeared that organization problems were preventing staff from offering good service. Reservations were lost, we were sent to an occupied room and had to return to desk where we waited as staff struggled to make amends. The interiors were tired and reflected a shoddy renovation in recent past. We had two queen beds and both had soiled sheets. The carpet was visibly in need of a deep cleaning. Outside of our room, the public areas also seemed worn and tired.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Good services, clean room, parking was very expensive though.

review.title: happily surprised
review.reviewText: Comfortable environment, helpful staff and in the best location; I would stay here again.

review.title: so so
review.reviewText: The room was small and had a funny smell. The window opened on a roof with a vent from a restaurant, so the window stayed closed and the room was stuffy. Still, the location was convenient and the price low.

review.title: Union Square's hotel!
review.reviewText: Short distance to Union Square, Chinatown, shopping area (Macy's, Saks fifth avenue, Tiffany, etc), nice & clean area, old but well maintenance facility!

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: Great hotel! Great location...within a block or two from Union Square, shopping, theaters, great restaurants. The room wasn't as small as many other older, refurbished San Francisco hotels, so that was good. One thing that we had to get used to was that our bathroom sink was outside the bathroom, at the other end of the room. Not sure if all the rooms are designed like this. The other thing was that our room was a little warm even with the thermostat set to 64 degrees. Since it was early part of May and in San Francisco, that wasn't a big deal. But other than that, we would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Clean but room was too small for 3 people
review.reviewText: Nice and clean hotel in a great location. Parking is located on next parallel street which makes is a bit inconvenient because the staff was not able to have the car brought to the front door. Room was great but with the extra bed there was no space to get around. Bathroom was also clean but too small. Lots of noice from the street on a Saturay night.

review.title: Impressed
review.reviewText: Great location: This hotel is very close to Union Square and Cable cars terminal. It's very easy to go to the shopping and sight-seeing areas from there. Even the room is a bit small, it's clean and comfortable.

review.title: Most Convenient Hotel for SFO Shopping
review.reviewText: I have stayed in the Handlery many times over the years. The location couldn't be better. It is now 2 short blocks' away from the subway station that comes directly from SFO airport! They gave me a 3:30 p.m. checkout just to be nice. And one of my favorite restaurants is now part of the hotel (the Daily Grill). Unless you are looking for a 5 star, the Handlery is the best value in town.

review.title: Some good, Some Bad
review.reviewText: Location of this hotel is great. It is located in the nicest part of downtown. The hotel is super clean. Parking is a bit expencive and the customer service from the hotel manager was horrible. Luckily Expedia was able to help me out.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This hotel was right in the center on Union Square; attached to the Daily Grill which is a very nice resturant and bar. The staff from the valent parking to maid service were very helpfull and make your trip stress free. The purpose of our trip was to see San Francisco and catch two Giant Baseball games. We purchase a 3 day Muni-pass for $18 and you can use it for the famous SF Trolley or take the underground Muni right to the Baseball park unlimited transportation.

review.title: tiny room
review.reviewText: I reserved a king size bed room no smoking and got a tiny room with double bed.

review.title: Decent hotel
review.reviewText: The rooms were clean and pleasantly decorated. The staff/service was okay-- not too friendly, and kind of slow.

review.title: Excellent (only minor issues)
review.reviewText: I highly recommend the Handlery. The room was very clean and all of the staff were very friendly. The only minor complaints I have are that the bathroom (especially the shower) was extremely tiny and that we had to wait awhile to retrieve our luggage (after we left it there for the day after checkout). Besides that, it was great. The room was very clean and the hotel was in an excellent location! I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Great Hotel. Check out the layout first!
review.reviewText: Very pleased with the size of rooms and bathrooms in this hotel. Fridge in the room, and although no coffee machines, Starbucks right across the street. Internet access pretty pricey though because you didn't get it for 24 hour periods... always ended at 3pm no matter what time you connected. If you go, best to leave your luggage in the car...check in... drive your car around to the parking garage and take the elevator straight up to your room. Otherwise, you drag your luggage down a hall and then up a flight of stairs to get to the elevator! Started off our stay a bit stressful, so I wish I'd read MY review first! Have fun!

review.title: Always a favorite location to stay whether on business or pleasure. Close to everything.
review.reviewText: My family thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The only area where we could see need for improvement was in the check-in and check-out delays. Each time we waited in line for at least 20 minutes each time. When we were checking in there was an employee at the counter assisting a guest that had difficulty understanding the language. While the employee assisted the guest the rest of us stood in line until he was finished. There was an unused register but no one came up to the counter to assist until the line was quite long. For those of us that are on vacation or on limited time this is a true inconvenience. Aside from those delays our stay was quite pleasant. The staff otherwise was extremely accomidating.

review.title: Always a pleasant stay
review.reviewText: I've stayed at the Handerly before and love the location.

review.title: Handlery Hotel - SF
review.reviewText: Perfect Location - RIGHT next to Union Square - not even a block away. Great value

review.title: Great hotel and Convenient
review.reviewText: Very impressed. Staff was very courteous and room was comfortable, Conveniently located near Chinatown, Union Square, and a quick bus or trolley ride to piers. Very affordable!
